loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Ebenezer has a grinding machine that he uses to grind foodstuffs for his customers.  Ebenezer has been in this business for long.Ebenezer hopes to grow his business to become bigger and stronger in the future.  He is 59 years old, married with 4 children. He is requesting for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase a grinding machine. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine

loans.name: Kingdom Promoters Group

texts.en:
Keh William M. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Kingdom Promoters. She 47 years old and is married with six children. She could not continue her education through elementary.

For six years, Keh has been selling crushed rock for construction at the SKD Boulevard market in Paynesville, Liberia. She started her business with 2,000 Liberian dollars as working capital but has now increased it to more than 5,000 Liberian dollars.

Keh encourages customers to continue buying from her. Her goal and dream is to expand her business to a shop in the near future. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 34,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more goods to sell.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Keh is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Wellingtone

texts.en:
Wellingtone B. O. M. is fifty-two years old. His wife is a farmer and they live in Kakamega where they run their business.

Wellingtone engages in transport services and serves the people of Kakamega. He has been in this business for the last ten years and he says the business gives him income to take care of his family.

Wellingtone says the business is good and the only major challenge is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his and so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. He, however, works very hard to ensure that his business is doing well.

Wellingtone is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to spray-paint his vehicle. He hopes to buy more vehicles in the future to expand his business. He also has dreams of giving his children a quality education. He is hardworking, ambitious and patient.

loans.use: To spray-paint his vehicle

loans.name: Buhumuriro Abarihamwe Group

texts.en:
A determined and very ambitious R. Kellen is the married mother of three children.

Kellen has operated a hardware business for three years in Rwempiri, Kazo town, selling cement, iron sheets, iron bars, wheelbarrows and more. At the end of every month she is able to fetch a profit of 300,0000 Ugandan shillings.

Kellen’s main drawback has been having a small amount of stock in her business that cannot match the consumption rate of her customers. She is seeking a loan that can help her to stock more goods that will satisfy her customers’ high demand and also transform her business into a wholesale operation.

Being very committed to her business with good customer care, Kellen hopes to increase her sales revenue. This will bring about a fundamental change in her business and enable her to achieve a self-sustaining life and cater for her family requirements.

loans.use: To restock her business and expand it into a wholesale operation

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah K. is a married woman and an entrepreneur. She runs a foodstuffs shop at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of food products including maize flour, wheat flour, beans, sugar, cooking oil, rice and other small shop goods.

Dorah’s business plan is to run a wholesale shop as her business income grows. She is requesting a loan of Tsh 800,000 to buy more business goods so as to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blocking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not disclosing his/her location and name, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

This borrower from Lebanon is a 30-year old single man who lives with his parents and one sibling. He and two members of his family work to generate income for their household.

The borrower has five years of experience working as a van driver and has owned his van since 2007. He has been a client of Kiva partner, Ameen, for several years and this loan will be his second Kiva loan. He was able to complete the remaining payments of his first loan early and is now requesting a loan of $1,200 so he can buy a new engine for his van.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his van

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 25 years old and single. Daniel still lives with his parents. He owns his own shop which sells different sorts of products such as cooking oil, water,  juice, soap and so on. Daniel has an experience of two years in his business and employs one person from his community. Daniel starts his business from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day except one day on the week end.

Daniel is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more products which will allow him to earn more profits. With this loan Daniel expects to increase the number of staff in his business who will allow him to run his business well.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate loves clothing and that is why she sells clothes at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a world class boutique in the future. She is 28 years old, single without children. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to excel in her business. She is requesting for a loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more clothes to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane C. is thirty-eight years old and married to William Chebii.They have two children; Laura is eleven, and Dominic is seven. 

Jane runs a retail shop in Kabarnet Town; she started this business one year ago. She earns a profit of 14,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. Most of her clients are residents of Kabarnet Town.

She has borrowed a loan of 20,000 KES from KADET, and she plans to use 10,000 KES to purchase industrial goods, 5,000 KES to purchase maize for sale, and the balance to pay her employee. If this loan boosts her business she will use the extra profits to expand her business from retail to wholesale.

Jane has a dream of purchasing a vehicle for transportation purposes in the future, and she describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase stock for sale in her business

loans.name: Rise And Gain Group

texts.en:
Grace A. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Rise and Gain. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children, four and eight years old, and also cares for a sibling. Presently a college student, Grace has also had a business for the past five years selling used clothes on Pipeline Road in the Redlight community, Paynesville, Liberia.

Grace started selling with 3,500.00 Liberian Dollars of working capital and now has about 5,000.00. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 38,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more used clothes, her goals being to develop her business into a store and enabling everyone in her family to get a good education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Grace is holding the sign. Susie is inset at lower left.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Emmanuel's Group

texts.en:
Viateur is 34 years old, married with 2 children; the first-born is 15 years old and the younger one is 6 years old. Viateur owns a business selling eggs in his region. This is his 15th year of success in his business of selling eggs. Viateur’s business is open from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except Sunday. Viateur is the group representative for a group which is called ABAHUJE in the local language. This group consists of four members.

Viateur and his group are now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business through purchasing more eggs which will allow them to satisfy their customers. In this way, Viateur and his group hope to earn more profits; with these profits Viateur especially will be able to pay school fees of his children as well as providing them with all their needs.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Oke

texts.en: Oke has a hair dressing salon where she makes lovely Nigerian and western hair styles for her customers.  She also sells hair extensions and cosmetics at retail prices to her customers. She is 40 years old, married with 4 children. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: o purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina tiene su puesto en el mercado de Villa Copacabana donde vende café y te (desayunos), tiene ya mucho tiempo con esta actividad y es muy conocida en el mercado, por las tardes se dedica a su salon de belleza que lo atiende en la zona de villa San Antonio Alto, ella tiene estos trabajos para poder pagar los estudios de sus hijos, su hija a veces le ayuda en el salon ya que por sus estudios no puede hacerlo seguido; la cliente es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y quiere mejorar sus dos negocios cada vez más. el crédito que solicita ahora es para  comprar azucar por quintal que utiliza  a diario este producto para el preparado de sus desayunos, comprará también liquidos para permanente y tintes para su salon de belleza, la Sra. Cristina es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable siempre trabaja duro para el bienestar de sus hijos, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Cristina has a stall in the Villa Copacabana market where she sells coffee and tea for breakfast. She has done this for a long time and is very well known at the market. In the afternoon, she works at her beauty salon that serves the neighborhood of San Antonio Alto. She has these jobs to be able to pay for her children's studies. Her daughter sometimes helps her in the salon, but in the future she will not be able to help because of her studies. Cristina is a very hardworking and enterprising person who wants to improve her two businesses even more. She is asking for a loan in order to buy 46 kilograms of sugar to use daily to prepare breakfast. She will also buy liquids for perms and hair dyes for her beauty salon. She is a very hardworking and responsible person who always works hard for her children's well-being. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have in giving her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Folunke

texts.en: Folunke B. sells groceries. She has been in this business for long. She is happy in her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is 48 years old, married with a child. Folunke’s husband is a carpenter and he also supports their home. She is a LAPO client. Lift above poverty organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa. She is requesting for a loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more groceries to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower from Lebanon is a 40-year old married man with two children. The main income provider for his family, he runs a small but very popular juice stand in Lebanon. Fresh juice is popular throughout Lebanese society, and demand is often very high in the summer months. He is requesting a loan of US $1200 to invest in a new juice machine. This will be his second Kiva loan; with his first loan of $1000, he was able to further expand his business.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

loans.use: Invest in a new juice machine

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Very hardworking, dedicated and social, Rosemary A. A. is a 48-year-old widow with two children. Her business, known as Vision Tailoring, is located in the busy town of Kakamegaand where for the last 20 years Rosemary has been engaged in tailoring and selling ready-made clothes. At times her debtors do not pay her promptly, and this makes business in this area very hard to manage. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to maintain the health of her enterprise. She is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to purchase more materials and ready-made clothes for sale. Rosemary hopes to grow her business into a wholesale operation and also wishes to buy a plot of land and her own car someday.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and materials

loans.name: C4362 Abahuje Group

texts.en:
Viateur is 34 years old, married with 2 children, the older one is 15 years old and the younger is 6 years old. Viateur owns a business of selling eggs in his region. This is his 15th year of success in his business selling eggs. Viateur’s business is open from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except Sunday. Viateur is the group representative for a group which is called ABAHUJE in the local language. This group consists of four members.

Viateur and his group are now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business through purchasing more eggs which will allow them to satisfy their customers. In this way, Viateur and his group hope to earn more profits; with these profits Viateur especially will be able to pay school fees for his children as well as providing them with all their needs.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Rosario Araceli

texts.es: La Srta. Rosario tiene su tienda en la zona de Pampahasi, y vive en la misma zona, ella es muy joven pero le gusta trabajar y poder cubrir sus gastos sola, aunque vive con sus padres; está estudiando por las noches y en el día atiende la tienda. El crédito será invertido en la compra de un turril de aceite, garrafas y abarrotes ya que tiene demanda de estos productos, y espera hacer crecer su tienda para luego convertirse en un almacen. Uno de los deseos de la Srta. Rosario es terminar sus estudios y comprarse una casita para poder dar en alquiler y asi tener mas ingresos para ayudar a sus padres ya que ahora con el negocio de su tienda sola mantiene el hogar, trabaja todo el dia dia y aveces esta muy cansada para ir a sus clases en la universidad, es duro para ella pero sigue adelante, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Rosario has a store in the area of Pampahasi and lives in the same area. She is very young, but she likes to work and can cover her expenses alone, even though she lives with her parents. She studies at night and works in the store during the day. The loan will be used to buy a container of oil, containers, and groceries since she has demand for these products and hopes to grow her store to later convert it into a full grocery store. One of Rosario's dreams is to finish her studies and buy a house so she can rent it out and thus have more income to help her parents as with the business from her store she only maintains the home. She works all day and sometimes is very tired when going to classes at the college. It is hard, but she continues on. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown by the giving of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Gerrit Larsen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 50 years old and she is married.  Marthe has a shop where she sells various women's shoes.  She has been in this business for about two years and her shop is open from 7 am to 8 pm every day.

Marthe is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to add more items for sale mainly shoes for men as well as shoes for children. In addition, she will upgrade her facilities.  With the use of this loan, Marthe is expecting to earn more profits which will be used for reinvestment in her business as well as keeping up the sustainability of her business.

loans.use: Additional styles of shoes for sale

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake sells shoes and bags to earn a living. She has been in this business for long. She is happy in her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a shoe company in the future. She is 45 years old and she is widow with 2 children. Folake’s children are doing well at school. Life as a widow has been very challenging and she hopes to overcome the challenge.. She is a LAPO client. Lift above poverty organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa. She is requesting for a loan amount of N170,000 to purchase more bags and shoes to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Ngendahimana

texts.en:
N. is 27 years old, single, and he sells a variety of goods in his shop.  Those goods are rice, drinks, water, body lotions, soaps, etc.  He has been in this business for about one year.  N.’s shop is open from 6 am to 9 pm every day.

N. is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to satisfy the demand of his customers through purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs like rice, beans, peas, wheat, Irish potatoes, etc.  With these additional foodstuffs for sale, N. will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow him to start saving and reinvesting in some other sources of income in various business areas.

loans.use: a large quantity of foodstuffs like rice, beans, peas, wheat, Irish potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 41 years old and she is a widow.  Beatrice has a beauty salon where she cuts hair.  She has done this business for about three years and her beauty salon is open from morning until late in the evening hours.  She employs five people in her business.

Beatrice is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy other machines for cutting hair.  With these additional machines, Beatrice expects to attract more clients and make more profits.  With these profits, Beatrice will start saving and creating as many sources of income as possible.

loans.use: Additonal machines for cutting hair

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris A. is a 47-year-old farmer who breeds cattle in a small village in the Saatli region of Azerbaijan. He is married and has two sons.

Idris breeds calves and then sells them to the local butchers for meat production. He spends all day grazing cattle in the open and this job needs a lot of effort.

Idris applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. O. loves business and she is happy in business. She sells pateries and drinks at retail prices. She hopes to grow her business in the future. She is 41 years old married, with 4 children. She is requesting for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Ayyub

texts.en:
Ayyub Q. is a 58-year-old man who is engaged in livestock breeding. He sells cattle for meat production to local butcher shops and restaurants. He started this business right after school. He is married and has four children who actively help to run his business.

Ayyub’s job is very hard as he spends all his day outside, grazing his cattle and looking after them. With his first loan from AqroInvest he was able to increase the number of his cows and improve his life conditions. At the same time he recommended himself as a client with a successful client history.

Now Ayyub has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 42 years old, married with 4 children aged between 5 and 14. Betty’s husband is an employee of the electricity and water company.  Betty and her husband both work hard for development of their family. Betty, who is a businesswoman of decoration, has an experience of four years in this field. Betty's business is open from 6 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day. She employs 2 people from her community as helpers so that her business can run smoothly.

Betty is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more equipment mainly plastic chairs for renting in ceremonies, and in addition, she sells ceremony cards. This loan will help Betty to earn more profits and these profits will allow her to start saving for a better future of her business as well as her family.

loans.use: The purchase of additionals plastic chairs and ceremony cards for rent to the customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the loan of his vehicle.

loans.name: Adidas

texts.en:
Adidas is 32 years old and married with five children who are 5, 6, 10, 12, and 13 years old.  Adidas sells a small quantity of goods in order to get her daily food.  Those goods include water, tomato sauce, drinks, etc. Her shop is open from 9 am to 4 pm every day and she has about 10 years' experience in this line of work.

Adidas is now requesting a Kiva loan to purchase more goods for sale in her shop.  With these additional goods, the sales and the customers will increase as well as the profits.  These profits will be used in creating many sources of income as well as creating more jobs for the people from her community.

loans.use: buying more goods to sell in her shop

loans.name: Yetunde

texts.en: Yetunde is involved in renting services. She rents chairs and tables to her customers. She hopes to expand her business.  She is 42 years old, married with 3 children. Yetunde’s eldest is 12 years old. She is requesting for a loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more chairs and tables to rent.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more chair and tables

loans.name: Kemishego Women Development, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
N. Ketty is a teacher and has been running her side-business for over fifteen years, selling produce like maize, sorghum, millet, beans and groundnuts (peanuts) as her additional source of income. Her business prospers due to the fact that maize flour, used to prepare food, is in high favor with many Ugandans.

In Nyamunuka, Ntungamo, this 40-year-old married mother of five children is referred to as an early riser, “rising with the lark”. She is a stickler for hard work and, as such, her children are all basking in the glow of her enterprising nature.

This business brings Ketty monthly profits of 300,000 Ugandan shillings. She is looking at a scenario where her business will expand with pomp. The only way she sees this materializing is when she gets a loan to buy more produce for her business.

loans.use: To purchasing more groceries to sell

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad M. is a 48-year-old man who sells children’s clothes in the central bazaar of Sabirabad city. He is married and has three children.

Elshad started his business twelve years ago to cover all his family’s needs and now this is his only financial source. He purchases children’s clothes in Baku city which is three hours away from his home city.

Elshad’s turnover in a month is about 200 AZN and now he would like to increase it and for this purpose he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en:
Natiq M. is a 37-year-old man who sells construction tools and home products in his store in the small village of Saatli. He always buys certified and high-quality goods which makes his shop very attractive to customers. He is married and has two children.

Natiq applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to increase the volume of his merchandise. He believes this will also increase his profit which will allow him to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Shamsiyya

texts.en:
Shamsiyya Q. is a 38-year-old woman who works as a cosmetologist and hairdresser in a small saloon in Saatli, Azerbaijan. She started working in 2006 when her husband lost his job.

Shamsiyya is married and has three children. Her business was the only financial source for the last four years and it was only several month ago that her husband found a job.

But Shamsiyya is going to increase her income by doing make-up for brides. She applied for 900 AZN to purchase make-up tools and cosmetics.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and make-up tools

loans.name: Alizada

texts.en:
Alizada A. is 27 years old and is a very smart young man. He sells dishes and souvenirs in his small shop in Saatli, Azerbaijan. He is married and has one son.

Alizada started his business two years ago and now he has a lot of customers. He brings merchandise from Baku city which is three hours away from his house. He goes for new items every second week.

Alizada applied for 1,000 AZN in order to increase the number of products he sells and to increase his profit.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en:
Teymur H. is a 24-year-old man who lives in the small village of Saatli. He is married and has one son.

Teymur has bred calves since 2002. His father raised cattle and he conveyed the best of his experience to Teymur. Now, Teymur has good experience of his own in raising calves.

Teymur usually purchases small calves to raise and sell them for a profitable price to the local butchers and restaurants. He applied for 1,000 AZN loan to purchase three calves and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline C. hails from Kakamega. She is single and has one child aged eight years old whom she hopes to educate to college level.

Caroline’s business is located at Kakamega in a busy market. She gets tenders from the local schools and makes school uniforms, petticoats and sweaters. She has been in this business for the last ten years and she says she likes it so much, even though it is very seasonal.

Caroline is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more materials to expand her business. She is very hardworking and describes herself as ambitious and patient.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Sanubar

texts.en:
Sanubar A. is a 53-year-old woman who dedicated her life to raising cattle. She is married and has five children. Sanubar is not alone in her business and her husband actively helps her. She lives in the small village of Saatli.

Sanubar applied for a 1,100 AZN loan to purchase more cattle. She will buy calves with this loan and, after fattening them in the next three months, will sell them for a profitable price.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en:
Teyyub A. is a 39-year-old man who breeds sheep in the small village of Saatli. He has been engaged in this business for the last fifteen years. He is married and has three children.

Teyyub has applied for 1,000 AZN to purchase fifteen sheep and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase fifteen sheep and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower from Lebanon is a 63-year-old single woman who is living with one parent. She is the main income provider for the household. She owns a linen store in Lebanon. She has owned this store for the past thirty years. It is important to note that Lebanon has faced political conflict and turmoil for most of the past thirty years as well, which has certainly caused greater challenges to the country’s entrepreneurs. This loan will be her first loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. With her loan of US $1200, she plans to purchase more linen to increase her inventory. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

loans.use: To purchase more linen to increase her inventory

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en: Jumoke loves business and she is happy in business. She sells drinks at retail prices. She hopes to grow her business in the future. She is 41 years old, married with 3 children. Jumoke is very determined to excel in her business and family life. She is requesting for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Gulustan

texts.en: Gulustan H. is 32 years old and a trader who sells different kinds of goods. She sells candies, cookies, eggs, cigarettes and beverages. She is married and has three children. Income from this shop in only one financial source in the Gulustan family. Now she has applied for 1000 AZN to purchase more goods.

loans.use: To purchase more food goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Mirzaga

texts.en: Mirzaga I. is a 56-year-old man who breeds cattle in the small village of Saatli.  He is married and has four children. Mirzaga started his business after he finished school when he was still helping his father. Now he has applied for 1000 AZN to purchase three calves and fodder.

loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Gwali Mutala Women's Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
N. Eva is a 50-year-old alcohol trader in Mpigi. She has been her family’s breadwinner for the last ten years with most, if not all, of her income coming from this business. As a testament, all her six children have been able to get an education. She has done this without the support of any man.

Eva was prevailed upon by one of her friends to start this business after the friend realized that Eva was at her wit’s end. With a sense of determination she got started and at present she makes close to 80,000 shillings a month. She also does some subsistence farming to add to her income.

With this loan, Eva is upbeat that she will purchase more bananas for making her local banana-brew drink.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to make more of her banana-liquor drink

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower from Lebanon is a 24-year-old single woman. She lives with her parents and three siblings. In her household, one parent and two siblings also work. She runs a clothing store that sells mainly special Islamic dresses and tops for women. This loan is her first with Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. She plans to use her loan to increase her store’s inventory.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

loans.use: To increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Temilade

texts.en: Temilade sells stationery in Ibadan, Oyo state. She is a hard working woman and she is so determined to excel in her business and family life. She is a widow with 3 children. She has to work for long hours to support her home. She sells stationery to make a living. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger in the future.  She is requesting for the loan amount of N150, 000 to purchase more stationery to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery to sell

loans.name: Tijani

texts.en: Tijani is a hard working man and he hopes to excel in business. Tijani sells beef at retail prices to his customers. Beef in Nigeria, is used in the preparation of Mouth watery Nigerian cooked foods and beef can also be used to prepare barbecue popularly called suya in Nigeria. He is 30 years old, single without children.  He is requesting for a loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more beef to sell.  He say thank you to all kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 26 years old, married with two children who are 2 and 7 years old.  Fabien also takes care of two dependents who are 7 and 20 years old. Fabien has been a self-employed businessman wholesaling sacks of Irish potatoes and he has been in this business for a long time.  The hours of his business are from early in the morning until late in the evening hours.

Fabien has a problem of not satisfying the demand of his customers, so he is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company which in turn will allow him to increase the quantity of Irish potatoes he sells.  With this additional quantity, Fabien expects to earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to be financially stable and continue taking good care of his family.

loans.use: a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Omowumi

texts.en: Omowumi sells sarongs in Ibadan, Oyo state. She is a hard working woman and she is so determined to excel in her business and family life. She is married with 3 children and she is 45 years old. She sells sarongs to make a living. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger in the future.  She is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more livestock and to modernise its housing

loans.name: Balbino

texts.es:
Balbino tiene 56 años, vive en compañía de su esposa Adela (53) y de su hijo único, que aunque es mayor de edad aún los acompaña en casa.

Este simpático y trabajador hombre se dedica a la agricultura desde que era muy joven y vivía con sus padres. Cuando formó su propia familia continuó con su labor agrícola, de la que dice sentirse muy orgulloso, pues con su esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. 
En la actualidad siembra papa en gran cantidad y en menor cantidad alverja, trabaja junto a su hijo y juntos vigilan cada día, durante todas las mañanas, cada un de sus cultivos para evitar que se malogren o les caiga algún tipo de plaga.
Cuando la producción está lista, la vende a los comerciantes mayoristas que le ofrecen buenos precios dependiendo de la calidad de sus productos. Para más adelante tiene pensado sembrar en mayor cantidad papa y aumentar sus ganancias.

Este es el décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Además se muestra muy satisfecho con el trabajo de su banco comunal, ya que todos los integrantes son responsables y organizados, es por eso que son los mejores de su zona y desean seguir trabajando de esa manera. 

Balbino tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de papa y abono, preparándose para la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Balbino is 56 years old, he lives with his wife, Adela (53) and their only son who still lives at home even though he is an adult.

This nice and hard-working man has been a farmer since he was very young and lived with his parents. When he started his own family he continued as a farmer of which he is very proud as he has succeeded in improving his family´s status. Presently he is planting a lot of potato and a small amount o pea. He works with his son and together they check each and every crop in the mornings to avoid failure and plague.

When the production is ready they sell to wholesalers who offer good prices depending on the quality of their products. For the future he plans to plant even more potato and increase his income.

This is his tenth loan with MFP and he is grateful to all the people that have made the loan possible for him to continue working in search of progress. He is also very satisfied with the work of the community bank as all the members are responsible and organized, therefore they are the best in the area and they wish to go on working this way.

Balbino is planning to invest the requested money in buying potato seeds and fertilizer, preparing for the next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Catedral (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
La señora Edith forma parte del Banco Comunal Catedral en la cuidad de Portoviejo capital de la provincia de Manabí en la costa del Ecuador donde existen las mejores playas del Pacífico.
La señora Edith está casada desde hace 12 años tiene tres hijos, a sus 53 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de comida preparada tiene un restaurant en la parte frontal de su casa, desde hace 9 meses está dedicada a este negocio y cuenta con la ayuda del esposo, A pesar de que el se dedica a lustrar zapatos  en el centro de la ciudad. 

La señora Edith antes de pertenecer a la fundación trabaja como doméstica, una vez que empezó con los créditos de Espoir pudo tener su propio negocio, en las tarde desde las 3 empieza con sus ventas, tiene desde un chuzo (carne asada en palito) hasta un plato más fuerte como arroz menestra y carne asada.

Nuestra socia nos cuenta que con este nuevo crédito podrá comprar una cocina industrial, sillas y mesas para darles mejor atención a sus clientes.
Cuando ella empezó lo hizo con 50 dólares y así pudo comenzar con su restaurant motivada por el esposo no lo pensó dos veces y desde entonces sus ventas marchan bien.  

Visitamos a las socias en día de cierre de ciclo y para conocer más del trabajo de la Fundación Espoir conversamos con la señora Ela es madre de familia casada y tiene 5 hijos mayores tiene 56 años de edad y desde hace 15 años tiene una tienda de víveres ubicada en su propia casa, desde que era muy niña los padres han tenido este negocio en el centro de la ciudad y luego cuando se caso siguió con la tradición, ahora es ella la que mantiene en pie su tienda, el esposo es periodista profesional y en los ratos libres el se encarga de ayudarle, la señora Ela cometa que no tiene día para el descanso asegura que desde las 6 am hasta la media noche tiene abierta trabaja.

Con este nuevo crédito ella invertirá en productos para surtir su tienda tales como; arroz, azúcar, carnes, bebidas como cervezas, gaseosas entre otros, un aproximado de 300 dólares invierte por semana, cuenta la señora Ela que en casa viven sus nietos que son su adoración y ellos les ayudan en las ventas, el sueño de nuestra socia es poder seguir en su tienda y mantener la familia unidad.    

También conversamos con la señorita Karina de 33 años nacida en Portoviejo de profesión Abogada, y además de ejercer ella tiene una tienda en su propia casa y la encargada de atender el negocio es su mamá.

Con el dinero del crédito invertirá en surtir su tienda con productos de primera necesidad y bebidas como cervezas, aguas y colas, desde muy temprano tiene que abrir su negocio y lo está cerrando a las 8 de la noche.
La señorita Karina está conforme con el trabajo que tiene resulta que le deja buenas ganancias, ella cuenta con el apoyo de sus hermanos que son los encargados de hacer los pedidos a los distribuidores un aproximado de 300 dólares por semana invierte para surtir su tienda. El sueño de nuestra socia es poder viajar algunos lugares le encanta conocer otras culturas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edith is a member of "Banco Comunal Catedral", in the town of Portoviejo, capital of the province of Manabí on the coast of Ecuador where the best beaches on the Pacific Ocean are located. Mrs Edith has been married for 12 years, she has three children, is 53 years old and sells food for a living. She has a restaurant located in front of her house. She has managed this business for 9 months and is being assisted by her husband in spite of his work as a shoe-shiner down-town. Before being a member of the foundation she worked as a maid. Once she started with loans from Espoir she was able to set up her own business. She starts selling at 3 o´clock in the afternoon, she has "chuzo" (grilled meat on a stick) as well as dishes with rice, vegetable stew, and grilled meat. Our partner tells us that with this new loan she will be able to buy an industrial kitchen, chairs and tables to offer more comfort to her customers. She started with 50 dollars and was able to start her restaurant, motivated by the husband, she did not think it twice, and since then her sales have gone well. We visited the partners the last day of the cycle and to know more about the work of Fundación Espoir, we talked to Mrs. Ela, married with 5 grown-up children. She is 56 years old and for 15 years she has had a general store located at her house. Since she was a young girl her parents have had this business down-town, and then when she married she followed the tradition, and now she is the one running the store. Her husband is a professional journalist and in his free time he helps her. Mrs. Ela tells us that she does not have any free time, she works from 6 am till midnight. With this new loan she will invest in products for her store such as rice, sugar, meat, beverages such as beer and sodas among others, she invests approximately 300 dollars per week. Mrs Ela tells us that her grandchildren, whom she adores, live with her and they help sell. It is our partner´s dream to continue with her store and keep the family united. We also talked to Miss Karina who is 33 years old, born in Portoviejo, a lawyer who also has a store at home which her mother looks after. With the money of the loan she will invest in providing her store with essential products and beverages such as beer, water, and coca-colas. She opens her store very early and closes at 8 o´clock in the evening. Miss Karina is satisfied with her work which provides her with good profit, she has the support of her brothers who are in charge of managing the orders to the distributors. Approximately 300 dollars are invested in supplies per week. It is our partner´s dream to travel to other places as she likes to learn about other cultures.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, beverages, meet, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 42 years old and married with three children who are 8, 11 and 14 years old. Emmanuel is a self-employed businessman who is well known for selling spare parts. He has been in this business for about two years. His business hours are from 7 am to 5 pm every day.

Emmanuel is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing a large quantity of spare parts (mainly Mercedes Benz parts, as they bring a higher rate of income). With this business, Emmanuel expects to earn more profit, which in turn will allow him to continue paying school fees for his children and reinvesting in his business for a better future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of spare parts

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es:
Hernando tiene 24 años, vive en su casa propia, al lado de sus padres y hermanos, en un barrio ubicado en la sierra central peruana.

Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura, en la actualidad trabaja junto a sus padres en la siembra papa, alverja y habas. El trabajo de campo es pesado, ya que requiere de mucha  paciencia y dedicación en el cuidado de cada una de las  plantas para que no les caiga plaga y lleguen bien hasta la cosecha.  Según sus palabras: “en la agricultura se gana o se pierde, pero si se cuida bien el cultivo se llega a tener una buena producción”. A Hernando le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque las ganancias de lo vendido le permiten vivir cómodamente. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces el precio de la papa baja, se compensa con la venta de las alverja y habas.
Y como es un joven muy emprendedor piensa en el futuro y para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, sobretodo la alverja, ya que su precio se mantiene estable en el mercado nacional.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Además está muy satisfecho con el trabajo que viene realizando su grupo comunal porque todos los integrantes son muy organizados y realizan mensualmente actividades que les permiten juntar para sus ahorros. 

Hernando tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes para asegurar sus plantaciones, también adquirirá semilla de papa, alverja y habas para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Hernando is 24 years old and lives in his own house together with his parents and siblings in a neighborhood located in the central Peruvian mountains.

Since he was very young he has been a farmer, presently he works with his parents planting potato, pea, and bean. Farming is hard work as it requires much patience and dedication with the care of each of the plants not to be affected by plague and reach harvest in good condition. According to his words: "in farming you win or you lose, but if you care properly for your crop you will get a good production". Hernando likes his job because the profit from his sales allows him to live comfortably. What he does not like is that many times the price of potato is low, but the sale of pea and bean makes up for the loss.

And as he is a very entrepreneurial young man he thinks about the future and it is his plan to plant even more, especially pea as the price is stable on the national market.

This is his third loan with MFP and he is very grateful to all the people who made the money possible for him to continue his work. He is also very satisfied with the work done with his community group as all the members are very organized and work on a monthly basis to gather money for their savings.

Hernando plans to invest the requested money in buying fertilizers to assure his crops. He will also purchase potato seed, pea and bean to improve his production.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and seed

loans.name: Tweyambe Batuyambe Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
It’s been one-and-a-half years since K. Prossy began her small retail shop in Bukakala, Mpigi. Her startup story is fascinating: with only two bars of soap, this young, 26-year-old woman began her sugar, soap and food retail shop.

Prossy’s reliable stock in trade at the start was her welcoming nature and she was able to strike a chord with most of her clients. As a result she has been able to consolidate her minimal 10,000 shillings a week. She also sells art crafts to supplement her profits.

With this loan, Prossy wants to buy more merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria tiene 49 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Mariano (49), que es agricultor, y de sus 2 hijos menores, sus hijos mayores ya viven independientemente.

Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, en la actualidad siembra junto a su esposo papa y alverjas. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque es tranquilo y cuida con mucha paciencia cada planta para que lleguen sin dificultad a la cosecha. Cuando debe recoger la producción contrata a operarios para que le ayuden y la producción la vende finalmente a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona. Con las ganancias obtenidas del esfuerzo que hace junto a su esposo, puede ofrecer  una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos, además de educación.
Para el futuro tiene planeado aumentar su producción y vender en mayor cantidad, pues quiere ofrecer lo mejor a sus hijos y dejarles como herencia tierras fértiles en las que puedan seguir sembrando.

Este es el décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Además está muy contenta con el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues todos los integrantes cumplen puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas y son un grupo bastante organizado, ya que han logrado juntar una buena cantidad de ahorros.

Hilaria tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono, guano e insecticidas para brindar mantenimiento a sus tierras y así sembrar sin problemas.
texts.en:
Hilaria is 49 years old, she lives in her own house with her husband Mariano (49) who is a farmer, and their two younger children, their grown-up children are independent.

Since very young she has been a farmer, presently she is planting potato and pea together with her husband. She likes her work very much as it is calm and she patiently takes care of each plant to make the harvest successful. When the crop is ready she hires helpers and the production is finally sold to wholesalers in the area. With the profit of her and her husband's effort she can offer a good living quality as well as schooling to her children.

For the future she plans to increase the production and sell more as she wishes to give her children the best and leave her children fertile land for them to continue farming.

This is her tenth loan with MFP and she is very grateful to all the people that have made the loan possible for her to continue working in search of progress. She is very pleased with the work of her community bank as well, as all the members repay their loans punctually and they are a well organized group as they have succeeded in gathering a good amount of savings.

Hilaria plans to invest the requested money in buying fertilizer, guano, and pesticides to give maintenance to her land and be able to farm without problems.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe sells foodstuffs in Ibadan, Oyo state. She is a hard working woman and she is so determined to excel in her business and family life. She is married with 5 children and she is 41 years old. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. She sells foodstuffs to make a living. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger in the future.  She is requesting for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 26 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su madre, en un barrio ubicado en la sierra central del Perú. 

Desde muy pequeño veía cómo sus padres y vecinos sembraban, y la tierra les proveía del alimento necesario para vivir; cuando alcanzó la juventud empezó a ayudar a su familia y aprendió las técnicas agrícolas necesarias para sacar la cosecha sin ningún inconveniente.
El trabajo en el campo es muy sacrificado, ya que todos los días deben despertarse con el alba para vigilar que todas sus plantaciones de papa y alverja crezcan en buen estado. Así transcurren los meses y cuando es tiempo de cosecha recogen toda su producción para venderla a los comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad.
De esa manera se mantiene y le ofrece una buena calidad de vida a su madre. Para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, tanto la papa como la alverja; además quiere empezar a sembrar olluco, ya que es un producto natural que crece fuerte y el precio en el mercado se mantiene estable.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Asimismo, los integrantes del grupo al que pertenece son muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas y organizan mensualmente actividades que les permiten aumentar sus ahorros.

Juan tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de semillas de alverja y papa, así como fertilizantes para asegurar sus tierras para las futuras siembras.
texts.en:
Juan is 26 years old, he lives in his own house together with his mother in a neighborhood located in the central mountains of Peru.

Since very young he saw how his parents and neighbors farmed and how the soil provided the necessary food to live. When he grew up he started to help his family and learned the necessary farming skills to be able to harvest without problems.

Working the fields is very hard as he has to wake up at dawn every morning to check that his plantations of potato and pea are growing in good condition. This goes on for months and when it is time to harvest, the entire production is sold to wholesalers in the town.

This way he offers good living conditions for his mother. For the future he plans to plant more potato as well as pea. He also want to plant ulluco as it is a natural product that grows well and the price on the market is stable.

This is his fifth loan with MFP and he is very grateful to all the people that made the loan possible for him to continue working. Also, the members of his group are very punctual repaying and organizing monthly activities to increase their savings.

Juan plans to invest the money requested in buying pea and potato seeds as well as fertilizers to assure his land for future crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Zita

texts.en: Zita sells drinks in Ibadan, Oyo state. She is a hard working woman and she is so determined to excel in her business and family life. She is married with 2 children and she is 31 years old. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. She sells drinks to make a living. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger in the future.  She is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 44 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo Enrique de 53 años, juntos tienen 5 hijos, pero ya son mayores e independientes, por lo que solo viven con su última hija. Desde muy joven se dedica a las labores agrícolas, hoy continúa pero en compañía de su esposo, sembrando papas, alverjas y gladiolos. Para ella la faena agrícola son tediosas, pues es una constante vigilancia a cada planta, de esa manera evita que las plagas perjudiquen la cosecha. Julia sabe que si se le brinda el cuidado adecuado a los cultivos, echándoles fertilizantes e  insecticidas, se puede esperar una buena producción; además el tiempo que tiene sembrando, le ha enseñando las técnicas que necesita para que la cosecha sea recogida sin problemas. Luego de obtener la producción, lo lleva a comercializarlos a los comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad, llegando a obtener regulares ganancias que le permite vivir cómodamente con su hija. Como ella es una dama muy trabajadora, tiene como propósito aumentar su producción de gladiolos y alverjas, ya que el precio de estos productos es muy bueno en el mercado. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron lo posible que el crédito le permita continuar trabajando, además conoce muy bien a las integrantes de su grupo comunal y sabe que son muy responsables. Julia tiene pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de semilla de gladiolos y alverjas para extender su producción.
texts.en:
Julia is 44 years old. She lives in the house she owns with her husband, Enrique, 53. They have 5 children of age who are independent, so they only live with their daughter. She has been working in agriculture since a young age, which she continues doing today side by side with her husband, growing potatoes, peas and gladiolus. The seeding and growing processes are hard for her because the crops need continuous watching, to avoid plagues that could trouble the harvesting season. Julia knows that if she takes care of her crops, using fertilizers and insecticides, she can expect a good harvest; besides, all her years in the business have taught her all the techniques she needs to harvest without any problems. After harvesting, she takes her products to the wholesalers in the city, with which she makes regular earnings that allow her to live comfortably with her daughter. As she is a hard working woman, she wants to expand her production for gladiolus and peas, as they have a good market price. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very thankful to all the people who made it possible for her to get it, so she can continue working. Besides, she knows the members of her community group very well and she knows they are very responsible. Julia hopes she will be able to invest the money in the purchase for gladiolus and peas seeds to expand her production.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gladiolus seeds and peas

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin E. P. sells electronics to make a living. Benjamin E. P. hopes to own an electronic company in the future. He is 35 years old, married with 2 children.  He is requesting for a loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more electronics to sell.   He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Akuha Nomuha, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
N. Madina is the young mother of one child. Madina went into her business venture selling motor spare parts close to nine years ago. Being strategically located on Bufunda Street, Ibanda town, in western Uganda, Madina gets many customers.

With this loan, Madina is looking forward to restocking her business and also to doing more advertising to increase the number of her customers. This will help her improve her sales and also enable her to take good care of her family.

loans.use: To restock her business and do more advertising

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi sells shoes in Ibadan, Oyo state. She is a hard working woman and she is so determined to excel in her business and family life. She is married with 3 children and she is 40 years old. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger in the future.  She is requesting for a loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more shoes to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 21 years old and single. Emmanuel lives with his parents. He owns a small business of selling different kinds of products such as beer, rice, and soap. This is second year successful in his business. His business is fruitful in his region. His business is open from 6:00 a.m. in the morning to 8:00 p.m. in the evening every day except Saturday.

Emmanuel is now requesting second loan from Kiva lenders via vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more products for his shop. After purchasing more products, Emmanuel will be able to satisfy his customers, which will help him to earn more profits. With extra money Emmanuel expects to save, he plans to build his own house and then get married.

loans.use: Expand his business

loans.name: Liliana Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Umiña se reúne en la localidad de Manta, uno de los puertos más importantes del Ecuador y situado a orillas del Pacifico, al visitar este banco comunal conocimos la historia de la señora Liliana es socia  desde hace 8 ciclos y tiene buenas experiencias.

Es una mujer de múltiples ocupaciones nos comenzó  contando que tiene una cevicheria en su domicilio desde hace 4 años que atiende únicamente los sábados y domingos, se le ha facilitado este negocio ya que el esposo trabaja en el sector pesquero de Manta y además vende por libra el pescado fileteado, los otros días los dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cuidado personal  como los son  Avon y ropa por catalogo con el crédito ella se ayuda para comprar al contado lo que los clientes le encargan y así ella poder dejarles más tiempo de pagar.

La señora Liliana con este nuevo crédito invertirá en la cevicheria, comprar bebidas y pescado y unas cuantas cosas útiles para el negocio. 

Nos comentaba que a pesar de tener mucha competencia por el lugar los clientes le buscan por su sazón, cuenta con el apoyo del esposo,
Nuestra socia tiene 13 años de casada a procreado 4 hijos, está muy agradecida con la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda con los créditos.
A lo largo de estos ciclos que lleva en el banco comunal ha podido mejorar su condición de vida y de su negocio ha podido comprarse un congelador que lo ha podido terminar de cancelar con los créditos obtenidos.
texts.en:
The Umiña Community Bank is located in the city of Manta, one of the most important port cities in Pacific shores of Equator. When visiting this community bank, we heard the story of Liliana, a partner for 8 terms that has had a great experience in this process. She is a very busy woman who started telling us that she has owned a cevicheria (raw fish store) for 4 years ran at home on weekends. This business was and easy call for her because her husband works in the fish industry in Manta. She also sells fish in fillets by the pound. She sells Avon beauty and personal care products and clothes by catalog the rest of the week. She uses the loans to buy in cash the products her customers order, and therefore allow them some time to pay her back. Liliana will invest this new loan in her cevicheria to purchase drinks and fish and other items useful to her business. She has her husband’s full support. She also told us that in spite of the competition, her customers come to her for her marinates. This partner has been married for 13 years and she has 4 children. She is very thankful with the Foundation for the opportunity they give her every time she gets a loan. Throughout the different payment terms with this community bank, she was able to improve her living conditions and her business. She was able to purchase a freezers, which she finished paying using the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drinks, fish and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Sanya

texts.en: Sanya O. sells gas to make a living. Sanya has been in this business for long and he hopes to lift his business and family above poverty. Sanya is a hard working man. He is 42 years old, married with 4 children. He is requesting for a loan amount of N150, 000 to purchase more gas to sell. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gas to sell

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es: Jimmy N. M., tiene la edad de 34 años, está divorciado, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El  hijo tiene 13 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es tener ganado para engorde. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. El desea aumentar el número de animales que posee en su finca, la cual cuenta con potreros donde se desarrollarán los animales de forma adecuada. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.Don Jimmy trabaja desde hace varios años con el ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Jimmy N. M. is 34 years old. He’s divorced and has a 13-year-old son, who is his first priority. He wants to use this loan to purchase cattle. He is planning to fatten these animals. He wants to provide a good care for his cattle to obtain the best income possible when sold. He wants to increase the amount of animals he owns in his farm where he has pastures, where the animals can develop properly. This is the first time he requests for a loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy about the opportunities he has been given. Jimmy has worked in the cattle business for many years. He hopes he'll be able to provide a better quality for life for his son in the future and a better economic stability. He wants to continue growing as a person and as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves for development and fattening

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Nanziga Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
30-year-old Alex M. exemplifies hard work in its essence. Like a lark he is an early riser, fully focused on what lies ahead in terms of gains in his business.

For three years, Alex has been giving a good account of himself running his dispensary in Nanziga, Mpigi. This happy-go-lucky married father of two has reached a satisfactory rate of progress in his business. With monthly proceeds of 70,000 shillings he has managed to give his two children a quality education.

Alex is planning on expanding his dispensary on the acquisition of this loan. He plans to buy more dispensary equipment and also to equip his clinic with enough drugs.

loans.use: To purchase dispensary equipment and new consignments of drugs

loans.name: Didacienne

texts.en:
Didacienne was born in 1968. She is married and has four children between the ages of 5 and 15. Didacienne’s husband is a farmer. They both work hard to providing the necessities for their family. 

Didacienne owns a small shop in which she sells a variety of clothes to men and women. The hours of her business are from 6:00 a.m. in the morning to 8:00 p.m. in the evening every day except Sunday. This business is very fruitful in her region.

Didacienne is now requesting her second from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business and satisfy the demands of her clients. This loan will help her to earn more profits simply because she will be able to attract more customers with her good qualities and large quantities

loans.use: To buy various clothes for men and women

loans.name: Beata Narcisa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Narcisa es una socia que forma parte del banco comunal Umiña situado en la costa de Manabí a orillas del Pacifico este es un puerto pesquero mayor importador de Atún para diferentes partes del mundo, siendo catalogado como el primer puerto que se dedica a esta pesca.

La señora Narcisa es una mantense de nacimiento dedicada a su trabajo a hacer una mujer muy responsable, ella a sus 54 años de edad mantiene en firme un hogar de 4 hijos su hijo mayor tiene 30 años, la señora Narcisa  labora en una fabrica de pescado, aparte de eso se dedica a la venta de ropa de una manera informal visitando a sus clientas en sus domicilios, la mercadería la trae desde Guayaquil a bajo precio, compra  al por mayor para poder obtener mayores ganancias, nos hizo un ejemplo de cómo es que ella gana dice le ayuda de mucho poder ir a comprar a los distribuidores porque si allá le salen a 12 dólares ella se esta ganando el doble en cada pantalón, tiene que tomar encuentra el viaje el gasto que tiene que hacer para poder encontrar buena mercadería, con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia invertirá en mercadería para el mes de las madres que es un buen mes para las ventas, el sueño de la señora Narcisa es poder tener en su momento una cevicheria y la venta de bocaditos.
texts.en:
Beata Narcisa is a member of the Umiña community bank located on the Pacific coast province of Manabí. This fishing port is a major exporter of Tuna to different parts of the world since it was the first one dedicated to that type of fish. Narcisa is a native of Manta and is a responsible woman dedicated to her job. She is 54 years old and maintains a stable home with four children. Her eldest son is 30 years old. Narcisa works at a fish factory and aside from this also makes a living selling clothing by informally visiting clients at their homes. She brings in her merchandise from the city of Guayaquil at a low price, buying it at wholesale so she can obtain better profits. She gave us an example of how much she is benefiting from Kiva's help by being able to go and buy from the distributors because for every $12 she spends she doubles her profit with each pant she sells. She has to keep in mind the costs of the trip that she has to make in order to find good merchandise. With this new loan, she plans to invest in the purchase of clothes for Mother's Day since that month is a good one for sales. Narcisa's dream is to have a food stand selling ceviche (popular fish dish) and sandwiches.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pants and clothing for women

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 42 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Juan de 47 años, que es chofer de bus de transporte público y juntos tiene 2 hijos, mayores de edad, pero solteros aún. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, cuando era pequeña observaba a su familia sembrar gladiolos, alverjas, zanahorias y  lechugas en sus tierras que poseen, hoy su labor lo realiza con ayuda de sus hijos que son jóvenes. Ella sabe que el esfuerzo y dedicación que pone sobre sus chacras, tienen su recompensa en el momento que recoge su producción, ya que luego son vendidos a los comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad. Con la comercialización de sus productos obtiene considerables ganancias que le permiten vivir cómodamente a lado de su familia. Ana tiene muchos proyectos en mente,  como sembrar en mayor cantidad las verduras que tanta satisfacción económica le han dado, pues tiene más hectáreas de terrenos por cultivar y cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de sus hijos. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP además se siente satisfecha con el desempeño de sus compañeros de su grupo comunal, por ser todos muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. Ana tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de semilla de alverja y abono para asegurar sus cultivos en la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband Juan, 47, who is a public bus driver. Together they have two children, who are both adults but are still single. Since she was very young, Ana has worked in agriculture. When she was little she watched her family plant gladiolus, peas, carrots and lettuce on their land, and today she carries out the work with the help of her children. She knows that the hard work and dedication she puts into her land will be repaid when it's time to harvest and then she can sell her products to the wholesale merchants in the city. She obtains considerable profits when she sells her products, which allow her and her family to live comfortably. Ana has many projects in mind, for instance planting larger quantities of vegetables to satisfy the demand in the market, since she has more land to cultivate and can count on the unconditional support of her children. This is her eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she also is satisfied with the performance of her fellow members in her community bank for all being very responsible with their payments. Ana plans to invest the loan in the purchase of pea seeds and fertilizer to assure her crops of the next harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pea seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Shallom Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Isaac O. is thirty-two years old. He is married and blessed with two children who are both currently in basic school. The first born is eight and the second is five years old. He lives with his wife and the children in a rented apartment in the community. Isaac’s wife works to help him support their family. She is a food vendor.

Isaac is a humble and hard-working man. He is a commercial driver. He drives a commercial vehicle to convey goods and people, especially petty traders and commuters in and around the community where he is domiciled. Isaac has been driving a commercial vehicle for the past four years and has acquired some experience. He aspires to grow his business to another level. He looks forward to acquiring a new car. He is hopeful to give all his children the best education he can afford and says he will be glad to see them make it to the tertiary levels.

Isaac is currently the leader of a five-member trust bank group called ‘Shalom’. The group members are mainly into trading activities and they request the loan to procure goods in bulk to scale up their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase a car engine

loans.name: Kadidia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadidia Dembélé est âgée de 37 ans, mère d’un  enfant, elle vit dans une famille nucléaire à Fana Guegneka II un des quartiers la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro République du Mali.
Kadidia est électricienne à la Société Énergie du Mali. En plus de cette profession, elle exerce le commerce d’habillements et de chaussures depuis maintenant plusieurs années. 
C’est dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires qu’elle décide de collaborer avec l’institution. Elle est à son premier prêt individuel avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des chaussures et des habits à Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente sur place au niveau des entreprises professionnelles et à son domicile, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle compte avoir 100.000FCFA de bénéfice au cours de son cycle de prêt qui servira à couvrir ses dépenses personnelles et payer l’intérêt du prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. Kadidia Dembélé, aged 37, is the mother of one child and lives in a nuclear family in Fana Guegneka II, a district in Fana City, Region of  Koulikoro, Republic of Mali.  She is an electrician at the Société Énergie du Mali (energy company of Mali).  Aside from this profession, she has been operating a business selling clothing and shoes for several years now. In her search for supplemental financial resources, Kadidia decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan with the institution's loan program.  She intends to use her loan for buying shoes and clothing in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesale merchants.  She sells locally at professional enterprises and out of her home.  Her customer base is composed of women and men.  Kadidia expects to have 100,00 francs CFA of profit over the course of her loan cycle that will be used to meet her personal expenses and to cover the loan interest. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shoes and clothing to sell

loans.name: Rosa Herminia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Umiña situado en el bello y fructífero puerto de Manta a orillas del espectacular Pacífico.

Nuestra socia es una gran comerciante de joyas en fina plata, cuenta con un varios años de experiencia en  este negocio, a sus 54 años está convencida que su gran pasión ha sido las joyas, con su negocio ha podido sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos a pesar que le toco una difícil labor ser padre y madre se siente contenta de que sean profesionales.

Empezó con el negocio siendo una artesana, desde muy joven aprendió del oficio en un taller en la cual prestaba los servicios de  mano de obra, después de un buen tiempo conoce a una señora que le ofrece ingresar a las ventas de las joyas traídas directamente desde Cuenca, ya son muchos  los  años que se dedica a este negocio trabaja en su mayoría con pedidos, se desenvuelve con este negocio de la siguiente manera compra la mercadería  a una  persona mayorista de Cuenca que le entrega en la ciudad de Guayaquil y una vez con las prendas se encarga la señora Rosa de entregar a 20 personas que son las que se encargan de llevar a vender por diferentes ciudades del País las joyas.

Con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia podrá comprar más joyas, a ella le gustaría tener su propia joyería en la ciudad de Manta no descarta esa posibilidad, ya hasta ha conversado con la persona que le distribuye las joyas para que le brinde una oportunidad de hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Umiña community bank located in the beautiful and luscious port of Manta on the banks of the Pacific Ocean. Rosa is big merchant of fine silver jewelry and has a number of years of experience in the business. At 54 years old she is convinced her biggest passion is jewelry, and with her business she has been able to raise her children despite having the difficult task of being both their mother and father. She feels content that they are professionals. She started the business after being an artisan, and she learned crafts from a very young age at a shop. After a good amount of time she met a woman who offered her to take up selling jewelry brought in directly from the city of Cuenca. Many of the years she spent the majority of her time working on orders. She developed the business as follows: She purchases the merchandise from a wholesaler in Cuenca who brings it to the city of Guayaquil; once it is delivered to Rosa, she splits the supplies with 20 people who are in charge of taking the jewelry to sell throughout the country. With this new loan, Rosa plans to purchase more jewelry. She would like to have her own jewelry store in the city of Manta and doesn't rule out the possibility. She has even talked to a person who distributes the jewelry to give her a chance to realize her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jewelry at wholesale

loans.name: Luisa Solanda

texts.es:
La señora Luisa es socia de la Fundación desde hace 4 años en los actuales momentos es socia del Banco Comunal Umiña en Manta primer puerto atunero del Ecuador a orillas del Pacifico.

Nuestra socia se dedica al comercio de frutas, plantas y ropa, quizás parezca una combinación algo rara pero es así como ella junto a su esposo se ganan la vida, ya son 7 años en este negocio en Tarqui una parroquia de Manta con gran asentamiento comercial en la zona,   

Empezó con el negocio con un dinero que tenía ahorrado pero necesitaba de mas capital porque sus ventas fueron en aumento y tenía que surtir su almacén pero fue ahí que una amiga le hablo para que ingrese al banco comunal, y desde entonces le va muy bien con los créditos y ha ido incrementando su negocio.
