En los actuales momentos la señora Luisa invertirá su nuevo crédito en gran parte a la ropa y el restante para surtir su negocio de las frutas,  junto al esposo trabajan en un local que le han dado los suegros, quien empezó con el negocio fue el esposo, y después fue la señora Luisa que invirtió en la mercadería de ropa porque una hermana de ella que vive en los Estados Unidos  le envía la ropa, zapatos, cartearas y bisutería.

Desde hace 10 años está en unión con su esposo, no han podido tener hijos, pero han sabido superarlo, ahora están dedicados a su negocio, el sueño de nuestra socia es tener una boutique de primera para brindarle mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luisa has been a member of Fundación ESPOIR for four years. She is currently a member of the Umiña Communal Bank in Manta, which is Ecuador's first tuna fishing port on the Pacific coast. She works selling fruit, plants, and clothing. Perhaps this seems like a strange combination, but this is how she and her husband earn a living. For seven years, they have run their business in Tarqui, a parish of Manta with a large business presence in the area. She began the business with money she had saved up, but she needed more capital because her sales were increasing, and she had to stock her store. At that time, a friend advised her to become a member of the communal bank, and since then the loans have worked well for her, and she has been expanding her business. Luisa will invest her new loan mainly in clothing and use the rest to stock her fruit business. She and her husband work together in a place her in-laws gave them. Luisa's husband was the one who began the business, and later on Luisa invested in clothing sales because her sister, who lives in the United States, sent her clothing, shoes, bags and costume jewelry. Luisa and her husband have been married for ten years. Then have been unable to have children, but they have learned to deal with that and now are dedicated to their business. Luisa's dream is to have a boutique in order to make her customers more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of assorted clothing

loans.name: Fanny Monserrate

texts.es:
En un sector de la ciudad de Manta Llamado Umiña se reúne el banco comunal del mismo nombre, conversamos con la señora Fanny quien es una excelente socia, dedicada a su restaurant desde hace 22 años todo empezó cuando por medio de un compadre y un amigo medico quienes le ayudaron para que la señora Fanny pueda tener la venta de comida en el Hospital del Seguro de Manta, en una área destinada para ella fue que pudo asentar su espacio y empezar a trabajar desde cero. 

Al principio paso por momentos difíciles porque no le era permitido poner su negocio ahí pero fueran más fuertes las ganas de nuestra socia en querer trabajar que hasta los actuales momentos sigue laborando.
Nuestra socia Fanny está casada tiene 6 hijos varones mayores de edad el esposo es comerciante él se encarga de una tienda de víveres en el sector de su domicilio desde hace 6 años, por ello es que la hermana de la señora Fanny es quien le ayuda en las labores del restaurant.

Ahora con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia invertirá en su negocio para brindarle mejor atención a sus clientes, ya necesita de varios cambios como mesas, sillas platos y demás utensilios para la cocina, además de invertir en los víveres y productos en general que se necesitan para prepara sus alimentos. Ella sale desde las 5 de la mañana al mercado central de la ciudad de Manta para realizar sus compras para a las 7 estar vendiendo el desayuno luego al medio día el almuerzo y en las tardes bocaditos como empanadas, postres y refrescos trabaja hasta las 6 de la tarde todos los días de la semana.
texts.en:
In an area of Manta city called Umiña the communal bank of the same name meets. We talk with Fanny who is an excellent member, dedicated to her restaurant for the last 22 years. It all began when a buddy and a medical friend helped her so that Fanny could sell food in the Seguro de Manta Hospital in an area designated for her. She was able to set up her space and begin working from scratch. In the beginning she had some difficult moments because she was not allowed to have her business there but the will of our member in wanting to work was stronger and she is still working currently. Our member Fanny is married and she has 6 adult sons. Her husband is a shopkeeper and he has looked after a supply shop in their neighborhood for the last 6 years. Fanny's daughter helps her in the restaurant. Now with this new loan our member will invest in her business to give her customers better service, as she needs to make various changes like tables, chairs, plates and other utensils for the kitchen as well as investing in supplies and general products that she needs to prepare her food. She leaves home at 5 in the morning for the Manta city central market to make her purchases then at 7 she is selling breakfast, at midday lunch and in the afternoons snacks like empañadas, sweets and soft drinks. She works until 6 in the evening every day of the week.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, kitchen utensils, and supplies.

loans.name: Ayeyi Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Florence A. is thirty-two years old. She is married and blessed with six children, most of who are currently in basic school. The last born is only two while the first is nineteen years old. Florence lives with her husband and the children in a rented apartment in the community. Her husband is a commercial driver.  

Florence is a very hard-working woman. She is into trading. Florence trades in groceries such as tins of milk, sugar, candies, bread, etc. She has been running this business for five years and aspires to expand her store in the near future. She is also hopeful to give all her children the best education she can afford. She requests the loan to procure goods in bulk to scale up her business.

Florence is the leader of a seven-member trust bank group called ‘Ayeyi’, meaning 'praise'. The group members are mainly into food production and trading activities. It is the dream of the members of this group to access this loan so as to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 22 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Oswaldo de 30 años, que es chofer de transporte público. Juntos tienen una pequeña hija de 5 años. Cada día es una lucha constante, puesto que se dedica a la agricultura, que junto a su esposo, quien la ayuda durante sus ratos libres, siembran alverjas, flores de gladiolos, lechugas, zanahorias, siendo la más rentable las semillas de gladiolos, ya que cada saco tiene un alto precio en el mercado nacional. Al término de la cosecha, sus productos son llevados a los mayoristas de la ciudad, recibiendo a cambio buenas ganancias económicas, permitiéndole vivir cómodamente con su familia. Para ella, el trabajo de campo requiere de mucho esfuerzo, ya que todos los días debe vigilar los cultivos para evitar que las plagas ataquen sus siembras, además de protegerlos de los cambios climáticos. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene el propósito aumentar su producción, pero sobretodo aumentar la semillas de gladiolos, que son  bastante rentables. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, además manifiesta que esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible que el crédito le permita seguir produciendo, asimismo se siente satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo comunal porque es un grupo muy sólido que trabajan con mucha afinidad. Karina tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de abono, alquilar dos toros para poder arar la tierra y de esa manera asegurar su próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Karina is 22 years old, she lives in her own home with her 30 year old husband Oswaldo who is a public transport driver. They have a young 5 year old daughter. Each day is a constant struggle since she farms, together with her husband, who helps her in his free time. They grow peas, gladiolus flowers, lettuces, carrots. Gladiolus seeds are the most profitable, since each sack earns a high price on the national market. At the end of the harvest, the products are taken to the wholesalers in the city, and she receives a good financial profit in exchange, allowing her to live comfortably with her family. For her, field work requires a lot of effort, given that every day she has to watch over the crops to avoid pests attacking her seeds, in addition to protecting them from climate changes. As she is a very enterprising woman, she has the future goal of increasing her production, but aboveall to increase the galdiolus seeds, which are quite profitable. This is her first loan with MFP, and she expresses her gratitude to everyone who makes this loan possible allowing her to continue producing. She feels satisfied with the work of her communal group because it is a very solid group who work with a lot of affinity. Karina has plans to invest the loan in purchasing fertilizer and hiring two bulls to be able to plough the earth so that her next harvest is successful.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, to hire two bulls to plough the earth.

loans.name: Djalia

texts.en:
Djalia is 36 years old. She is married and has two children who are 3 and 5 years old. 

Djalia has been a proven entrepreneur for a long time. This is her 10th successful year in business. She sells different goods in her shop, mainly soaps, biscuits, toothbrushes, ripe bananas, etc. Her small shop is open from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. every day.

Djalia needs to request a Kiva loan to expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of additional goods, mainly food, such as rice, beans, wheat, etc.  With this additional business, Djalia will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business for a better stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy soaps, biscuits, toothbrushes, ripe bananas, etc.

loans.name: Mariana Del Jesus

texts.es: La señora Mariana es socia del Banco Umiña, es comerciante tiene una tienda de víveres varios que es de tradición familiar, el esposo trabaja en una fabrica tiene 11 años de casada, le llegan los proveedores a entregarle directamente a su negocio, le gustaría tener su casa, cuando se caso vivía en otra parte cuando sus padres quedaron solos y el papa le pidió que se mude a vivir en su casa y desde entonces los acompaña a ellos, en un sector de la ciudad llamado santa Martha desde hace 10 años frente a una cancha, le va muy bien con los créditos de la fundación, y ahí tiene su tienda, tiene un espacio destinado para su tienda, viene siendo administrada por sus hermanos hasta que ahora como hermana menor le toco a ella, tiene 3 hijos, ella vende carne de pollo, bebidas, no tiene inconveniente al vivir con sus padres es una gran ayuda para ellos,
texts.en:
Mariana is member of the Umiña community bank. She is a businesswoman who owns a supplies store, which has been handed down in her family. Mariana’s husband works in a factory. They have been married for 11 years and have three children. Suppliers deliver directly to her store. Mariana would like to have her own home. When she got married, she lived in another part of the city but then her parents found themselves isolated so her father asked if they could all live together. Since then, and for the past 10 years, they all live together in an area of the city called Santa Martha. Their house is situated in front of a field. Mariana is doing well with the previous loans arranged by the Foundation, and has a designated place in the house for her shop. Previously, the shop was managed by her brothers, but now as the younger sister, it is her turn to manage it. Mariana sells chicken, drinks, and is very content to live with her parents, which helps them a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks, meat, and general provisions for her shop.

loans.name: Kwagala Development Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
This is the story of K. Hajara, a young, ambitious and married 32-year-old woman operating a twelve-year-old grocery store in Nakasero market, Mpigi. To get started she first had to work as an apprentice at a neighborhood grocery store. She also does some poultry.

Hajara values highly the prospect of seeing all her children through university in her lifetime. It’s for that reason that she has been working hard to make sure all five of her children are in good schools.

With this loan, Hajara is looking at buying more stock that is in high favor for her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her store

loans.name: Viviana Margarita

texts.es:
En el Puerto de Manta en la costa del Ecuador específicamente en la provincia de Manabí visitamos el banco comunal Umiña en un sector del mismo nombre, es ahí donde es socia la señora Viviana de 27 años está casada tiene dos niños, ella junto al esposo  tenían una vida hecha en la capital Quito donde trabajaba en un local de comida, pero una vez que se les termino el contrato de trabajo se quedaron sin hacer nada y deciden regresar a su tierra natal Manta para ver que podrían hacer y seguir trabajando.

En una seria conversación la señora Viviana con su esposo decidieron ponerse un negocio de comida, con un pequeño capital que habían ahorrado, invierte nuestra socia en  una carreta que la mandaron hacer bien elaborada para ahí empezar su propio negocio, como la señora Viviana conocía algo de cocina lo puso en práctica, pidieron permiso al municipio de la ciudad para poder trabajar en la carreta  de esta pareja de esposos y lo vienen haciendo desde hace 2 años.

Tienen que trasladar todos los días su carreta desde su casa hasta el lugar que es un parqueadero donde tiene su negocio, en esta carreta se ofrece comida tipa de la región, ella tiene 27 años y el esposo 28 el trabaja en albañeria, ella en la mañana se queda con sus hijos en casa, el negocio lo estaciona en un parqueadero de un sector bastante concurrido de la ciudad.

El crédito invertirá en comprar los alimentos y comprase una carpa para pretejerse  de la lluvia, las ventas ayudan a pagar puntualmente las cuotas del credito.
Ella nos cuenta que  empezó con 70 dólares en su negocio y ahora ya tiene que invertir cada vez mas, se arriesgaron al poner este negocio y no se arrepienten.
texts.en:
In Manabi province in Puerto de Manta (Manta Port) on the Ecuadorean coast, lies the community bank, Umiña, in an area of the same name. A member of the community bank, Viviana, 27 years old, lives here with her husband, 28 years, and two children. The couple has been married for 11 years. They had made their lives originally in the capital of Quito where they worked in a food outlet. However, once their work contract expired, they were left with nothing, and decided to return to their native town of Manta to see what work they could find. After a serious discussion with her husband, Viviana and her husband decided to set up their own food stand using their modest savings to invest in the business. Viviana’s husband bought a cart and elaborately adapted it to suit the needs of the business. Viviana put her cooking skills into practice. The couple sought permission from the council in order to station their cart in an area three houses away from where they both lived, and once permission had been granted, Viviana and her husband began working and have continued to do so for the past two years. Each day, the couple has to move their cart from their house to a car park (parking lot), where the council has granted them permission to run their business and which is three blocks away in a busy area of the city. The food cart offers typical regional fare. The loan will be used to buy food and a tent to protect them from the rain. Their strong sales will help them repay their loan installments on time. Viviana tells us that she started her business with just $70 and now she continues investing more and more. Though they took an initial risk in setting up the business, they have never regretted the decision.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provisions and an awning for their business.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 26 years old and single. Celestin has a small shop where he sells drinks (beer and Fanta), cooking oil, sardines and so on. Celestin has run this business for three years and his shop is open from 6 in the morning to 5 in the evening every day. Celestin is well-known in the region where his business is located. Celestin employs one person from his community so that his business runs smoothly.

Celestin is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more drinks and other products. With this loan Celestin will be able to attract more customers which will allow him to earn more profits. With the extra money, Celestin expects to get married.

loans.use: Expanding his shop

loans.name: Claudia Soledad

texts.es:
La señora Claudia V. es socia activa del banco comunal  Mujeres Luchadoras que se encuentra ubicado en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca al sur del Ecuador y se encuentra a una altura de 2500 msnm. Esta ciudad es la capital cultural y deportiva del país además es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la UNESCO en el año 1999.

Nuestra socia tiene 31 años de edad, se encuentra casada y en su unión ha concebido dos hijos de 11 y 6 años que estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo trabaja como latonero (reconstrucción de las latas de los vehículos), no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Claudia se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado  los días miércoles, sábados y domingos en los mercados de la feria libre y 27 de febrero donde cuenta con su puesto propio  y labora de 6 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m., se dedico a esta labor gracias a su mamá que trabajaba en esta actividad,  los créditos del banco comunal ha ido invirtiendo en su negocio y con el nuevo préstamo comprara jeans, blusas, casacas, camisas, calzado deportivo, formal y casual. 

Su meta es  entregar los mejores estudios a sus hijos para que lleguen lejos en sus vidas siendo unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Claudia V. is an active member of the Mujeres Luchadores (Motivated Women), a community bank located in the large city of Cuenca in the south of Ecuador, which is 2,500 metres above sea level. The city is cultural and sporting capital of Ecuador and was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1999. Claudia is 31 years old, married and has two children (11 and 6 years old) who study in a local school. Her husband works as a panel beater (reconstructing bodywork on automobiles). They do not have their own house and instead rent property. Claudia sells clothes and footwear on Wednesday, Saturday, and Sunday in the Feria Libre and 27 de Febrero markets, where she has her own stall, and works from 6am until 4pm, thanks to her mother who also worked previously in the same job. Claudia has invested her previous loans into her business and with the new loan hopes to buy jeans, blouses, jackets, shirts, trainers and other types of formal and casual wear. Claudia’s goal is to ensure her children get the best education so that they can go on to become professionals and be successful in life.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jeans, blouses, jackets, shirts, formal, casual and sport footwear

loans.name: Action Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Janet F. is thirty-five years old. She is married and blessed with five children, most of whom are currently in primary and junior high school. The children are between the ages of five and twenty-two years old. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the community. Janet's husband is a farmer.  She is a very hard-working woman. 

Janet is into trading. She trades in cosmetics such as creams, body lotion, perfumes, powder, etc. She has been in business for fifteen years and aspires to expand her business by procuring goods in bulk. She is also hopeful to give all her children the necessary support they need to make it in life.

Janet is currently the leader of a five-member trust bank group called ‘Action.’ The group members are mainly into food production and trading activities. It is the dream of the members of this group to access this loan so as to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Mt. Zion Group

texts.en:
Mama B., the leader of the five-member group Mt. Zion, is a 39-year-old single mother of five children who range from 4 to 19 years old and also cares for five siblings. Mama did not have the opportunity to go to school due to a lack of financial support.

For 25 years, Mama has been selling quality cosmetics at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia, treating her customers with politeness and respect which ensures much return patronage. She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 60,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cosmetic products, her goals being to develop her business into a shop and improve the living conditions of her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mama is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic products.

loans.name: Zenzontle Group

texts.es:
El grupo Zezontle está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras que tienen varios ciclos trabajando con Adim. En este tiempo según comentaron ellas han crecido gracias a los préstamos y a las orientaciones sobre cómo manejar sus ingresos que le brindo la institución.
La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Elba Rosa S. de 43 años de edad quien desde hace tres años instalo una pequeña venta que con el tiempo y los prestamos ha ido aumentando hasta convertirla en una pulpería. 
Sus compañeras de grupo son  Milagros F., artesana de hamacas desde hace 20 años quien con el préstamo comprara materiales como manila, colorantes etc.,  Alma Nubia L. C. quien empezó vendiendo pan y actualmente distribuye ropa en lo cual invertirá el préstamo y Gema Auxiliadora M. L. la cual desde pequeña trabaja en el comercio de frutas y verduras, y a que su madre se dedicaba a dicha actividad y ella ahora lo administra.
texts.en:
The Zezontle Group is comprised of four hard working, determined, and enterprising women who have had various cycles of working with Adim. These women have been able to continue expanding their businesses thanks to the loans and advice on how to manage their income as provided by the institution. The Group’s coordinator is Elba Rosa S., 43 years of age, who, three years ago, opened up a small stall. As time has gone on and with the help of previous loans, the stall has expanded to become a local store. Her colleagues in the Group include Milagros F., who for the past 20 years has been making hammocks and who with the loan will purchase materials such as Manila hemp, dyes, etc; Alma Nubia L. C., who started out by selling bread and who now sells clothes and plans to invest in this business with the loan; Gema Auxiliadora M. L., who since childhood has worked in a grocery shop due to the fact that her mother did this for a living and who currently manages such a shop.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more supplies and increase variety in provisions.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en:
Anastasie is 39 years old, married with 4 children ranging from 18 years to 2 months. Anastasie sells small fish, flour, and salt. Anastasie is well-known in her business of selling small fish which is very important for her. so she can sell more small fish. Anastasie employs one person from her community so that her business runs well. She opens her business from 6 in the morning to 5 in the evening every day except Saturday.

Anastasie is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by adding a large quantity of small fish which will allow her to satisfy her customers. With this loan, Anastasie will be able to earn more profits which will help her to pay school fees for her children and provide them with all the necessities.

loans.use: Expanding her business through adding a large quantity of small fish for sale.

loans.name: María Grimanesa

texts.es:
La  señora  María Grimanesa  Ávila es socia del banco comunal  Mujeres Luchadoras hace diez años,  vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca en una casa arrendada con su esposo que es chofer de un taxi, su ultima hija que se divorció con quien comparten los gastos de la casa, sus otros dos hijos son casados y viven en otro sector de la ciudad.  Cuenca está ubicada al sur del Ecuador a una altura de 2500 msnm, urbe conocida como la capital cultural y deportiva del país y considerada por los  ecuatorianos como una de las ciudades  más bellas.

María Grimanesa vende caldos,  tamales, humitas, chaul afán y otros platos que realiza bajo pedido  y los aprendió a base de  su imaginación en la cocina,  lleva siete años  en esta actividad de domingo a domingo sin regirse a un horario fijo;  con el  nuevo crédito comprará  carnes, arroz, choclos, hojas, harinas,  etc. para la preparación de su exquisita comida.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio más grande y también  una casa propia.
texts.en:
María Grimanesa Ávila has been a member of the communal bank Mujeres Luchadoras for ten years. She lives in the city of Cuenca in a rented house with her husband who is a taxi driver. Her youngest daughter, who is divorced, shares the household expenses. Her other two children are married and live in another part of the city. Cuenca is in the south of Ecuador, at an altitude of 2,500 meters above sea level. It is a city known as the cultural and sports capital of the country and considered by Ecuadorians to be one of the most beautiful cities. María Grimanesa sells soup, tamales, humitas, fried rice and other dishes to order. She learned using her imagination in the kitchen. She has been doing this activity for seven years Sunday to Sunday without a set schedule. With the new loan she will buy meat, rice, corn, leaves, flour, etc. to prepare her delicious food. Her dream is to have a bigger business and also her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, rice, corn, flour, leaves, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 39 years old and married with two children.  Christine has been working hard at the business of selling various styles of women's clothes.  She has had this business for 4 years and the hours of her business are from 8 am to 8 pm every day.

Christine is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance in order to expand her business through reinvesting.  With this loan, Christine hopes that she will earn more profits which in turn will allow her to start saving and continue taking care of her family.  By receiving and using this loan, Christine has a hope for the future and she really hopes that the people from her community will benefit by getting jobs from her business.

loans.use: different styles of clothes for sale

loans.name: We Are One Group

texts.en:
Beatrice T., the leader of the five-member group called We Are One, is 32 years old, single, and has four children who range from 1 to 13 years old. She was only able to attend school through ninth grade due to a lack of financial support.

For five years, Beatrice has been selling quality cooked food at the Pipelines Road in Paynesville, Liberia, enjoying much return patronage. She started by selling vegetables that she planted herself, and now plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more rice, oil and fish to improve her business, her goal being to grow and expand her enterprise to other communities in Monrovia.

In the accompanying photo, Beatrice is holding the sign. Yassah is inset at the lower right.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil and fish to improve her business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 38 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Delfino de 40 años, juntos tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con el último,  ya que los demás son mayores e independientes.  Cada día es nuevo para esta trabajadora mujer que se dedica a la agricultura, ella siembra papa y alverjas junto a su esposo e hijo. Sin embargo el trabajo en el campo es cansada, pero le gusta mucho porque sabe como cuidar bien cada planta para que llegue en buen estado hasta la época de la cosecha. Cuando es tiempo de recoger toda su producción de papas y alverjas, toda la familia se dedica a cargar el producto al camión, para luego ser trasladado en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. De esta manera obtiene regulares ganancias, esto le permite vivir cómodamente. Esta laboriosa dama tiene muchos planes para el futuro, entre ellos sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mayores ganancias y seguir adelante. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible que el crédito le permita continuar trabajando; además esta muy satisfecha con el desempeño de todos los integrantes de su grupo comunal, pues han demostrado ser responsables en el pago de su cuotas. Luz tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de abono e insecticidas, para asegurar sus tierras en la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Luz is 38 and shares her home with her husband Delfino, who is 40. They have five children, all but one of whom live independently. Each day brings hope to Luz, who works cultivating the land to plant potatoes and peas, helped by her husband and son. Though tiring work, Luz enjoys the rewards of tending crops until harvest time, when her family transports the produce to a local wholesale market for sale. She has obtained a stable income from her efforts, and in the future plans to expand cultivation to obtain higher returns. This is her third microloan from MFP, and Luz is very thankful for the opportunities she has had as a result; she is also encouraged by the other members of the communal loan program, who have been responsible in paying off their small loans in a timely way. Specifically, Luz will invest the loan funds in fertilizer and insecticides, to prepare her lands for the next harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides for crops

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Don Luís Manuel tiene 55 años de edad, es muy activo en su trabajo, ha logrado hacer su casa, apoyar  a sus hijos, todo esto lo logro ya que es  ingeniero naval desde joven gracias a sus padre quien lo apoyaron para que estudiara, anduvo muchos años trabajando y la paga era buena, pero es un trabajo en donde no permite estar  con su familia por que se embarcan por meses Es por eso decide renunciar y con su liquidación comprar un camión que lo trabaja como transporte de viaje.
Lo que desea con este financiamiento es comprar plátanos y vender al mayor y así lograr abrirse más en el mercado con el objetivo de generar mejores utilidades rentables. A futuro desea comprar otro camión que pueda cubrir la demanda de viaje transporte y con las ganancias poder ahorrar para su vejes ya que abecés se siente cansado.
texts.en:
Luís Manuel is 55 and an active worker, having built his home and supported his family with care. At a young age he became a naval engineer, thanks to his father who supported his studies. For some years he made a good living in that field but left in order to spend more time with his family on land. His severance pay allowed him to buy a truck, which he uses to make a living in transportation. With this loan, Luís Manuel wants to buy and sell plantains on the wholesale market to increase his income. In the future he wishes to buy another truck to better serve local demand for transport, and assure a comfortable living for old age when he can no longer work full time.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell plantains for wholesale market

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La señora María Cristina es una gran persona que  ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en la vida, pero se siente muy bien en los actuales momentos formando parte del Banco Comunal Umiña en la ciudad de Manta gracias a los créditos recibidos a podido salir adelante.

María Cristina tiene como oficio el tejer a corchete diferentes manualidades, además de ser una experta en hacer postres, también se ha unido a la venta de productos de medicina  natural, ella esta en todas no le gusta quedarse con los brazos cruzados, nacida en un bello cantón de la provincia como es Calceta decide un día radicarse en el primer atunero del País Manta hace 15 años y desde entonces lo considera su segunda tierra, nuestra socia de 50 años perdió a su esposo hace 5 años y al contarnos sus ojos se humedecieron aun no lo puede creer y le tocó asumir el rol de padre y madre a cabalidad, pues sus  hijos la necesitaban mucho.

La señora María Cristina aprendió a manualidades por necesidad y eso es lo que ahora le ayuda a salir adelante, ella  realiza a mano la elaboración de carteras, bolsos, gorras y blusas  a base de un material llamado colita de rata y con un corchete empieza su labor todos los días en su domicilio, este material le traen desde Guayaquil ella le encarga a una hermana y  se encarga de enviarle, y también a ingresado a vender productos de medicina natural, su mercadería hecha a mano han sido reconocidas hasta en otros países cuenta nuestra socia que tiene amigas y familiares que viven por allá y envía a vender le va muy bien con el negocio esta feliz porque nunca se imagino que iban a valorar mucho su trabajo.
Con el nuevo crédito que esta solicitando lo podrá invertir en sus tres negocios, como los son las manualidades que requieren de los hilos los corchetes, en los postres todo el material como azúcar, harina,  colorantes entre otros, además tiene que entregar varios pedidos de los productos medicinales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Cristina is a great person who has had to live through a lot of adversity. Now she is happy to be a part of the Umiña Community Bank in the city of Manta, and thanks to their loans she has been able to improve her life. Maria Cristina works sewing or crocheting different crafts; she is also an expert at making deserts, and has also started selling homeopathic medicines. She is involved in everything, and she is not one to sit there with her arms crossed doing nothing. She was born in Bello Canton in the province of Calceta. One day she decided to get on the first tuna boat to Manta. She came 15 years ago and since then she considers it her second home. Five years ago Maria Cristina lost her husband at the age of 50 and she still cannot believe it. She has had to assume the role of both mother and father because her children need all of her support. Mrs. Maria Cristina learned how to sew by necessity and this is what now helps her continue to move forward. She makes wallets, bags, hats, and shirts by hand from a material called "rat's tail" and clasps. She starts working every day in her home; her sister brings her the material from Guayaquil. She has also started selling natural medicine products. Her handmade products are renowned even in other countries! She has friends and family who live abroad and she sends them products to sell. Her business is going well, and she is happy because she never imagined that her work would be so appreciated. With the new loan she will invest in her three businesses, she needs thread for her crafts, sugar, flour, and coloring for her deserts, and she needs to fill several orders for her medicinal products.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of thread, sugar, coloring, flour, and medicinal products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase maize and charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Mirtha Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Mirtha es una mujer trabajadora de 48 años de edad, con una familia de cinco hijos, tres de ellos trabajan, su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosmético que vende por catálogos los productos Avon desde hace dos años, pues anteriormente trabajaba en una casa particular cuidando a una anciana, también trabajo como conserje para poder ganar el alimento cada día para alimentar a sus hijos ya que no tuvo la ayuda de su compañero.
Su objetivo es comprar ropa, cosmético en cantidad, para aumentar las ventas, y salir a vender en mayor cantidad de productos para lograr mejores ganancias, ya que tiene poco inventario,  para en el futuro hacer las mejoras a su casa ya que quiere mejorar la infraestructura de los cuartos que aun no ha logrado hacer,  por falta de dinero.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a 48 year old hard-working woman. She has five children; three of them work. She sells clothes and Avon cosmetic products by catalog. She has been doing this for two years. She previously worked in a private home taking care of an elderly woman. She also works as a custodian to be able to earn her daily bread and feed her children. She has not had help from her companion. Her objective is to buy clothes and cosmetics in quantities in order to increase sales. Then she will go sell her products in greater quantity in order to get improved earnings. She now has a small inventory. In the future she wants to make improvements to her house. She wants to improve the infrastructure of the rooms that she has not yet been able to make due to lack of money.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more clothes and cosmetics to increase sales

loans.name: Tres Pino Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tres Pino será integrado por tres personas trabadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas. Una ellas es la señora Margarita del Carmen V.  de 46 años y quien desde hace doce años se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de cosechas de acuerdo a la temporada. Ella actualmente con el crédito cosechara pipian con la ayuda de su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de 18 y 14 años.
Sus compañeros de grupo son María del Carmen V. quien desde hace cuatro años se dedica al cultivo y su mayor anhelo es poder contar con fondos propios y Pedro José E. quien vende ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Tres Pino group is comprised of three people who are hard-working, enterprising, and who put forth a great deal of effort. One of the members is Margarita del Carmen V., age 46. She has been farming and selling her seasonal harvest for 12 years. She will use the loan to plant pumpkins. She will do this with help from her husband and her two children, ages 18 and 14. María del Carmen V., her colleague in the group, has been farming for four years. Her greatest desire is to be able to have her own funds. Pedro José E., another colleague, sells clothes and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant pumpkins

loans.name: Rosa Rebeca

texts.es:
Rosa  C. tiene 48 años,  se encuentra casada y tiene tres hijos que se encuentran de 28, 26 y 21 años, todos sus hijos son solteros, los  dos primeros  trabajan y son quienes ayudan en la economía del hogar y para el  estudio del  último hijo que está en la  universidad, su esposo es chofer de un Instituto de la ciudad,  con nostalgia nos comenta que tenía una casa pero por ser garante de una amiga  que no pagó la deuda embargaron su propiedad  y ahora viven arrendando en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, localidad ubicada al sur del Ecuador a una altura de 2500 msnm, esta ciudad es muy reconocida por ser cuna de escritores, poetas, deportistas, también fue designada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

Es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadora hace tres  años gracias a la invitación de una compañera del mismo, se siente  muy contenta de formar parte de estas mujeres luchadoras como su nombre lo dice, ella  es consultora de belleza de la línea Yanbal y Avon hace tres años aproximadamente y gracias  Dios le va muy bien y además le queda tiempo para estar con su familia.

Con su nuevo crédito comprará perfumes, maquillajes, labiales, cremas, tratamientos para el cabello y corporales y bisutería de  Yanbal y Avon para satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes. Su meta es llegar a tener una casa nueva.
texts.en:
Rosa C., age 48, is married and has three children. The children are 28, 26, and 21 years old; and they are all single. The first two work, and they are the ones who help the household economically. They also help with the last child’s education. Her husband is a driver for an institution in the city. She nostalgically tells us that she had a house. It was guaranteed by a friend who did not pay the debt, so the property was seized. They rent the place they now live in. They live in the large city of Cuenca, which is located to the south of Ecuador at 2,500 meters above sea level. This city is very well known for being the cradle of writers, poets, and athletes. It was also designated as the Cultural Heritage of Humanity by UNESCO in 1999. She has been a member of the Mujeres Luchadora (Tenacious Women) Communal Bank for three years, thanks to an invitation from a colleague in the bank. She feels very happy to be part of these tenacious women, as the name indicates. For approximately three years she has been a beauty consultant for the Yanbal and Avon lines. Thank God, it is going very well. Also, she has time to be with her family. She will use the new loan to buy perfume, make-up, lipstick, creams, body and hair treatments, and costume jewelry from Yanbal and Avon. She will buy these to meet her customers’ needs. Her goal is to have a new house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume, make-up, lipstick, creams, body and hair treatments, and costume jewelry from Yanbal and Avon

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish and pig feet to sell

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es: Ninfa tiene 37 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo Rolly de 38 años, que es agricultor y de sus 2 hijos menores de edad, que estudian en el colegio. Desde muy pequeña se dedicó a las labores agrícolas, cuando vivía con sus padres los ayudaba a sembrar. Luego de unos años, cuando conformó su propia familia, empezó a sembrar papas y alverjas, junto a su esposo, quien la ayuda en esta labor. Cada día debe vigilar sus cultivos con paciencia y dedicación para que la cosecha sea provechosa y nada se malogre en el camino. Afirma que le gusta trabajar en el campo, aunque es un poco cansado despertarse cada día con los primeros rayos del sol, pero es gratificante cuando vende toda su producción a los comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad. De esta manera puede ofrecerle lo mejor a su familia. Ninfa tiene muchos planes para el fututo, una de ellos es, lograr que sus hijos estudien una profesión y para ello espera sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mayores ganancias. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible que el crédito le ayude a continuar trabajando, además esta muy satisfecha con el trabajo que viene desempeñando su grupo comunal pues todos las integrantes son muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará fertilizantes, insecticidas y abono para poder mejorar los cultivos y lograr obtener una productiva cosecha.
texts.en:
Ninfa, age 37, lives in her own house with her husband, Rolly. He 38 years old, and he is a farmer. They have two minor children who go to school. She has been doing farm work since she was very small. When she lived with her parents she helped them plant. As the years passed and she formed her own family, she started to plant potatoes and peas with her husband. He helps her in this work. Everyday she needs to watch over her crops with patience and dedication. She does this so that the harvest is profitable and nothing gets in the way of that. She likes to work in the field even though it is a bit tiring to get up everyday with the first rays of the sun. But, it is gratifying when she sells all of her production to the wholesale merchants in the city. This way she is able to give her family the best. Ninfa has a lot of plans for the future. One of those is to have her children study a profession. To do that, she plans to plant a greater quantity in order to get greater income. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is very grateful to all of the people who made the loan possible. It helps her to keep working. She is also very satisfied with the work that her communal bank is doing. All of the members are very punctual with their payments. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy chemical and natural fertilizers and insecticides to improve her crops and have a productive harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and insecticides to protect her crops

loans.name: Fatima Aracely

texts.es:
Fátima es una joven de 29 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 4 años, junto a su esposo se esfuerzan mucho para poder ahorrar y poder comprar su propio terreno y lograr hacer su propia casa ya que viven en casa de su mama, ya que no cuentan con el dinero para comenzar a construir. Su esposo trabaja en reparación de teléfonos celulares, y ella se dedica al comercio venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace varios años el cual comenzó con dinero que su  esposo dio, y financiamientos con otra institución.
Su meta es poder alcanzar ventas alta, captación de clientes nuevos, lo cual invertirá en ropa para dama, caballero, niño y cosmético en variedad para lograr mejores utilidades que beneficien en su hogar.
texts.en:
Fatima is 29 years old with a a four-year old son. She and her husband work very hard to save money to buy land and have their own house because they currently live in her mother's house. They still do not have enough saved to start construction. Her husband works repairing cell phones, and she works selling clothing and cosmetics. She started this business several years ago with money that her husband and other financial institutions provided. Her goal is to increase her sales and gain new clientele. She will use the loan to purchase clothing for women, men, and children as well as a variety of cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuevo Horizonte está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ella es la señora Adriana del Socorro M. G. quien desde hace quince años trabaja en costura oficio que aprendió y realiza junto con su esposo para mejorar su situación y en el cual ha instruido a sus cuatro hijos de 18, 17, 16 y 14 años respectivamente.
Ella desea comprar maquinas para mejorar el negocio y adquirir otro terreno para trasladar el taller el cual se localiza actualmente en su casa de habitación.
Sus compañeros son María Concepción A. L. quien vende frutas y verduras en el mercado todas las mañanas, licor en su casa por las noches y nacatamales los fines de semana y José María L. es comerciante de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The New Horizons group is made up of three hard-working people. Mrs. Adriana del Socorro M. G. started working as a seamstress when she was 15. She works along with her husband to improve their living situation; she has taught her children, 18, 17, 16, 14, respectively, how to sew as well. She hopes to buy sewing machines to improve her business and purchase a lot where she can relocate her shop, which she currently operates out of her house. Her partners are Maria Concepcion A. Lopez. Maria Concepcion sells fruit and vegetables in the market every morning, sells liquor from her house at night, and sells nacatamales on the weekedns. Jose Maria Lopez also sells fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, and buttons

loans.name: Cira Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes se reúne en la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita en la costa ecuatoriana, esta ciudad es mas conocida como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, cuenta la historia que en tiempos pasados cuando aun no era ciudad en lo que ahora son sus calles habían sembrado muchos arboles de tamarindo y de ahí base el nombre.

Al visitar este banco conversamos con la socia Carmen, es madre soltera con 6 hijos es una portovejense de nacimiento vive en la orquídeas un sector bastante vulnerable de la localidad, ella se dedica al comercio de ropa, vende prendas interior, sostenes, medias y mas,  sus compras la realiza en Guayaquil viaja cada dos meses según como  vaya  sus ventas, invierte de  400  a 500  dólares en la mercadería, la forma en la que se gana la vida es recorriendo las calles del sector donde vive y entre otros cercanos, de una manera que le facilita a sus clientes le deja a crédito la mercadería cobrando por semana , ya son 17 años que lleva este oficio, el ser socia de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho ha superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito surtirá su negocio  viajara a comprar mas mercadería.
texts.en:
The Small Traders Community Bank meets in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi province, on the coast of Ecuador. This city is known as the city of Tamarinds. The story is that many years ago when it was not yet a city they planted many tamarind trees in what are now the city streets, and that is how it got this name. Upon visiting this bank we spoke with Carmen, a single mother with six children. She is a native of Portoviejo and lives in the Orquideas, a low-income neighborhood in the city. She works selling clothing, underwear, bras, hosiery and more. She buys her products in Guayquil, where she travels every two months. Depending on how her business is going she invests between 400 and 500 dollars on merchandise. She makes her living selling her products door-to-door in her neighborhood and others nearby. She sells her merchandise on credit, collecting payments every week. She has had this business for 17 years. Being a member of the foundation has helped her overcome problems and grow her business. With this new loan she will supply her business with more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase underwear, hosiery, bras

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid M. A., tiene la edad de 53 años, está divorciada, y no tiene hijos. Vive sola. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado para engorde y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Ingrid tiene varios años dedicada al ganado. Ella espera en un futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Ingrid M. A. is 53 years old. She is divorced with no children and lives alone. The loan she is applying for will be used to purchase cattle and feed. She hopes to maintain her animals better and thus make higher profits when she sells them. She also hopes to increase the number of animals and in order to keep them in better condition she has an ideal space to raise and maintain her cattle. This is the first time that she will receive a loan from FUDECOSUR and is very happy with the terms that they offered. Mrs. Ingrid has raised cattle for many years. She hopes that in the future she will have a better quality of life, more economic stability, and the ability to keep growing as a person and as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: María Nicolasa

texts.es:
María Nicolasa G. F. es una humilde mujer trabajadora que se dedica la realización de sombreros y bordados actividad que aprendió de su madre y realiza desde los siete años. Ella con este negocio saco adelante a sus hijos de los cuales uno de ellos y sus nitos son los que trabajan hombro a hombro con ella.
G. con el préstamo piensa invertir en materia prima como trenzas, lana, cabuya, mecate y anelina entre otros lo cual le permitirá seguir trabajando y aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
María Nicolasa G. F. is a humble, hard-working woman who makes hats and embroideries. She learned this work from her mother and has done it since she was seven years old. With this business, she gave her children a good start in life. One of her children and her grandchildren work closely with her. G. thinks she will invest the loan proceeds in raw material such as pleats, wool, pita fiber, cord, Angelina fibers, and other material, so that she can continue working and increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For raw material such as pleats, wool, pita fiber, cord, and Angelina fibers

loans.name: Enma Eremita

texts.es:
La señora Enma es una socia del Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes en la ciudad de Portoviejo.

La señora Enma está casada tiene5 hijas, se dedica a la venta de sabanas lleva 6 años la forma de trabajo de nuestra socia es vendiendo puerta a puerta, las compras de la mercadería es en la ciudad de Guayaquil en los mayoristas de una manera que se la haga más fácil poder tener un ingreso, nos comentó la señora Enma que su esposo es comerciante de frutas compra y vende frutas desde hace 12 años, el sale a las calles a recorrer en un triciclo todos los días, con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia podrá invertir en mas mercadería y a la vez ayudar al esposo para que invierta en las frutas, es una manera de poder ayudarse y solventar los gastos del hogar, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas que le ayudan a vender.

Al recibir el crédito le tocara a nuestra socia salir de viaje para hacer las compras en esta ocasión tiene como pedidos 15 juegos de sabanas y parte de esas, quiere trae 5 juegos más.

La señora Enma tiene muchos sueños en la vida pero le gustaría por lo pronto es tener su casa propia ya está cansada de pagar arriendo, por eso junto al esposo están reuniendo dinero con las pocas ganancias que les quedan.
texts.en:
La señora Enma is a member of the Small Business Person's Communal Bank in the city of Portoviejo. La señora Enma is married and has 5 daughters. She has sold sheets door-to-door for 6 years. She buys the sheets in the wholesale market in the city of Guayaquil and is therefore able to profit upon resale. She told us that her husband is a fruit seller and has bought and sold fruit for 12 years. Every day he goes into the streets and travels all around on a tricycle. With this new loan, our member will be able to invest in more merchandise and at the same time help her husband invest in fruit; therefore, they will be able to pay household expenses. They count on their daughters' help in their sales work. Upon receiving the loan proceeds, our member will take a trip to purchase merchandise. She has placed an order for 15 sets of sheets and also wishes to purchase 5 additional sets. La señora Enma has many dreams, but for now she would like to have her own home. She is tired of paying rent. She and her husband are saving what they can from their modest earnings in order to purchase a house.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 20 sets of sheets for resale

loans.name: Gloria Monserrate

texts.es:
La señora  Gloria está casada tiene 4 hijos se dedica a comercializar los productos de Yanbal, Avon  a la vez tiene la venta de productos varios a través de un sistema llamado cartilla en los que resaltan los electrodomésticos, para poder manejar este sistema tiene que  compra los artículos de contado y para eso tiene que utilizar el crédito, no se conforma con esto nuestra socia a ella se considera una mujer muy activa en los negocios, por eso en la casa también tiene un negocio que es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, como el arroz, azúcar, aceite entre otros.

La señora Gloria le ha tocado pasar por momentos difíciles en cuanto a lo económico pero desde que se unió al banco comunal sus condiciones fueron otras. A pesar que le toca madrugar para salir a comprar los productos de la tienda no lo ve como una carga que se le impone más bien es como una gran ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos, a pesar de que su esposo también tiene su trabajo ya por más de 12 años en un local de pintura ella está segura que no es suficiente el ingreso para la cantidad de gastos que tienen.

En los actuales momentos la señora Gloria está muy bien en sus ventas, con este nuevo crédito podrá hacer mas pedidos de Yanbal y Avon y a la vez surtir su tienda, tiene que invertir todo el crédito que recibe para poder dejar a crédito a sus clientes los productos así les brinda la oportunidad que el cliente desee.
texts.en:
La señora Gloria is married and has 4 children. She sells Yanbal and Avon products and sells products through a system called Cartilla, which is mainly concerned with electrical appliances. In order to use this system, she has to pay for items in cash, and her loan proceeds will be used for these cash purchases. But she is not content with just these businesses. In her home, she also has a business selling necessities such as rice, sugar, oil, and other items. La señora Gloria has endured economic difficulties, but since she joined the communal bank her situation has improved. Although she must rise at an early hour to buy products, she does not feel it is a burden but a great way to give her children a good start in life. Her husband has worked for more than 12 years in a painting business, but she is certain that his income will not pay for all the family expenses. Currently, la señora Gloria is doing very well in her businesses. With this new loan, she will be able to purchse more from Yanbal and Avon and at the same time replenish the inventory at her home. She will have to use all of the loan proceeds to grant credit to her customers and give them the opportunity they want.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies, Avon and Yanbar cosmetics, and electrical appliances for resale

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes que se reúnen en la ciudad de Portoviejo tiene a unas socias bastante responsables y muy trabajadoras.

Al conversar con la señora María nos dio una pauta para saber que todo se puede cuando hay disposición, ella es  ejecutiva del hogar se dedica a cuidar a sus hijos, pero tiene un negocio familiar junto al esposo, por más de 6 años vienen con este negocio de venta de Cd en una de la calles principales de la capital manabita, el esposo de nuestra socia inicio este negocio cuando por medio de un amigo quien fue que le motivo y le dio el espacio para que se dedique a vender Cd  de videos musicales y de películas, no es mucho lo que se gana pero con eso han podido salir adelante, con la ayuda de la Fundación y todos los créditos que ha recibió nuestra socia mantiene en firme su negocio, al principio si fue grande la inversión le tocó comprar televisor, Dvd y un amplificador para iniciar con el negocio, a tan solo un dólar que cuesta un Cd a la semana tiene como ganancia 40 dólares aunque en fechas especiales como el día de las madres se vende más.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora María invertirá en comprar más discos tener una variedad de películas y videos musicales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Pequeños Comerciantes" meets in the city of Portoviejo, and has members who are quite responsible and very hardworking. In talking with Maria, she provides us with an example to follow: that one can do anything if one has the will. She runs a home and is devoted to the care of her children, but also has a family business with her husband. They have had a business selling CDs on one of the main streets of the capital of Manabi province for more than 6 years. Her husband started this business, thanks to a friend who motivated him and gave him the space to sell CDs of music and films. She does not earn much, but with this business she has managed to get ahead. With the help of the Foundation and all of the loans she has received, she has been able to maintain her business. At first she had to make a big investment to buy a television, DVD player and amplifier to start the business. Although each CD only costs a dollar, at the end of the week she has earnings of 40 dollars, and on special dates such as mother's day, she sells more. With this new loan, Maria will invest in the purchase of more CDs, so she will have a greater variety of films and music CDs.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy music CDs and DVDs of films

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  El Crédito esta ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca, considerada una de las ciudades  más bellas del Ecuador por su arquitectura, sus paisajes naturales,   sus ríos y  su gente  son atractivos que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero.

Rosa  es casada y tiene  seis  hijos quienes se encuentran de 42, 38, 34, 32, 25, 15 años, de ellos cuatro son casados y viven independientes, arrienda una casa en la urbe de la ciudad Cuenca donde vive con su esposo que  es jubilado y pasa en casa, su hijo de 25 años estudia en la universidad y el ultimo hijo  aun esta en secundaria gastos que solventan  con lo  que recibe su esposo de pensión, su hijo de 34 años ayuda económicamente  a sus padres y ella que se dedica  a la venta de ropa (hace 20 años) y  para incrementar los ingresos de su casa hace poco tiempo monto un pequeño negocio  de comida rápida en el que atiende de 11 am a 8pm de lunes a viernes 

Es socia del banco comunal El Crédito hace 10 años y todos los créditos le  han beneficiado para ir incrementando su negocio de venta de ropa, con su nuevo crédito comprará  una estufa y menaje de cocina que le hacen falta para su negocio de comida rápida. Su meta es  llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Crédito is located in the city of Cuenca, which is considered one of the most beautiful cities in Ecuador. Its architecture, its natural countryside, its rivers, and its people are attractions that draw both national and international tourists. Rosa is married and has six children ages 42, 38, 34, 32, 25, and 15, four of whom are married and living independently. She is renting a house in the city of Cuenca where she lives with her retired husband who is at home, her 25-year-old son who is studying at the university, and her last son who is still in secondary school. They cover expenses with the pension received by her husband, the economic help of their 34-year-old son, and she has sold clothing for 20 years. To increase the household income she recently started a small business selling quick meals, which occupies her from 11am to 8pm Monday through Friday. She has been a member of the communal bank El Crédito for 10 years, and all the loans have been beneficial to grow her clothing-sales business. With her new loan she will buy a stove and kitchenware needed for her quick-meal business. Her goal is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a stove and kitchenware

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 26 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo Hilmer de 31 años, que es agricultor  y de sus 3 hijos menores de edad. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica desde muy joven a la agricultura, por lo que ahora siembra papas de buena calidad y alverja. Disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza, porque en el campo la vida es tranquila, cultivando en sus propias tierras, con la seguridad de recoger una buena producción. Aunque para ella, el trabajo es cansado y requiere de bastante sacrificio, no le importa, pues le gusta despertarse temprano todos los días y vigilar cada planta, pues sabe que con el tiempo darán buenos frutos. Así transcurren los días de esta laboriosa mujer que se da tiempo para trabajar sin descuidar la crianza de sus pequeños. Además toda la cosecha la vende a comerciantes mayoristas fijos que le ofrecen buenos precios por sus productos. Como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, para mejorar sus ganancias, pues la educación y manutención de sus hijos cada día aumenta, y ella junto a su esposo quieren ofrecerles lo mejor. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, además se siente muy satisfecha con el desempeño de su grupo comunal porque esta compuesto por personas bastante responsables. Noemí tiene pensado invertir el crédito que solicita en la compra de abono, fertilizantes e insecticidas para asegurar sus tierras en las próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Noemí is 26 years old, lives in her own home with her husband Hilmer, who is 31 years old and a farmer. Together they have 3 young children. She is a very hardworking woman and has been farming since she was very young and now plants very good quality peas and potatoes. She enjoys her work a lot, since in the fields life is tranquil, she is able to cultivate her own land, confident that she will be able to collect a good harvest. Even though it is tiring work and she must make sacrifices, she doesn't mind, since she likes to waking up early every day and monitoring each plant, knowing that eventually they will bear fruit.

This is how this industrius woman spends her day, taking time to work without neglecting the care of her children. Furthermore, she sells all of the harvest to loyal wholesalers who offer good prices for her products. As an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to plant more crops to earn more income for the education and support of her children who are growing each day. Together with her husband she wants to offer them the best.

This will be her third loan with MFP and she is very happy with the performance of her community group because it is composed of very responsible people. Noemí is thinking about using the loan to buy manure, fertilizers, and insecticides to prepare her land for the next sowing.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying manure, fertlizer, and insecticide for her fields

loans.name: Mercedes Isabel

texts.es:
A pesar de que nuestra socia Mercedes le ha tocado criar a su hijo sola eso para ella no ha sido un impedimento para salir adelante, actualmente forma parte del Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes en la ciudad de Portoviejo.

La señora Mercedes tiene 34 años es madre de un pequeño niño de 8 años, su ocupación es de comerciante, tiene la venta de ropa para damas, caballero y niños, al mismo tiempo que sale a recorrer productos de Yanbal y utensilio de cocina, es una mujer bastante luchadora se las ingenia para que el tiempo le alcance y pueda vender y no descuidar a su hijo que tanto la necesita, por las mañana se levanta a preparar el desayuno para su niño lo lleva a la escuela y se queda recorriendo sus productos hasta el medio día para reunirse con su niño no tienen que le ayuda a cuidarlo, y cuando tiene que salir en las tardes lo lleva con ella.

La señora Mercedes invierte todo el crédito que recibe de la Fundación en sus negocios, por decir en los productos de belleza tiene que comprar al contado, para poder dejar a crédito a sus clientas,  en la venta por cartilla de pagos es donde mejor se gana según sea el electrodoméstico mejor es la ganancia.

El sueño de nuestra socia es estudiar párvularia le gusta mucho tratar con niños y aspira poder algún día hacer su sueño realidad.
texts.en:
Even though Mercedes has brought up her son by herself, this has never been a problem for her. She is currently a member of the Pequeños Comerciantes (Small Businesspeople) Community Bank in the town of Portoviejo. Mercedes is 34 years old and has an 8-year old son. She runs a business selling clothing for men, women, and children and also sells Yanbal beauty products and kitchen equipment. A very hard-working woman, Mercedes juggles her time so that she can both work and look after her son who needs so much care. Every morning she gets up and prepares food for him to take to school. She spends the morning travelling around selling her merchandise, and then at midday she meets her son again. There is no one else to help look after him. When she has to go out again in the afternoon, she takes him with her. Mercedes invests all the money she gets from the Foundation back into her business, in other words into the beauty products that she has to buy on account. She then lets her clients purchase them on credit. Catalog sales provide good profits, with sales of kitchen appliances being best of all. Mercedes’ dream is to study to be a nursery school teacher as she loves working with children. One day she hopes to turn this dream into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy Yanbal beauty products and small kitchen appliances

loans.name: Veronica Nurilaura

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes es un buen grupo de socias que se reúnen en la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de la provincia de Manaba.

En este banco se encuentra la señora Verónica de 38 años de edad está comprometida el esposo es chofer,  tiene 3 hijos, su ocupación es ser comerciante de productos de belleza Avon, en la mañana se dedica a las tareas del hogar en las tardes es que tiene que salir a recorrer a sus clientes a diferentes lugares, también ha optado por realizar reuniones en su casa para que las clientas conozcan mas de los productos, entrega folletos y tarjeta de esa manera le ayuda a tener mas clientes, a nuestra socia le gusta mucho trabajar es un aporte económico para el hogar, también cuenta con la ayuda del esposo en el taxi que el conduce, si ella tiene que ir a visitar a alguna socia y vive lejos la  lleva el esposo, al principio estaba con duda si entraba al negocio o no pero fue una amiga quien la motivo y ahora está muy contenta las señora Verónica.

Con el nuevo crédito nuestra socia invertirá el total en los adquirir los productos ya tiene que entregar varios pedidos.
texts.en:
The Pequeños Comerciantes (Small Businesspeople) Community Bank is made up of a wonderful group of women who work together in the town of Portoviejo, the capital of Manaba Province. One of the members is 38-year old Verónica whose husband is a driver. They have three children. Verónica sells Avon beauty products. She spends the mornings doing household chores and then in the afternoons she goes out to visit her customers in different locations. She also invites customers into her home where they learn more about the products, and delivers flyers and business cards to help her gain more customers. Verónica really enjoys her work and is a great financial help for her family. Her husband also helps her. If she has to visit someone who lives a long way away, he drives her in his taxi. She wasn’t sure if the business was a good idea at the beginning, but a friend encouraged her to go ahead and now she is happy with the way it has turned out. Verónica plans to use all of this new loan to buy more products for which she already has orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy Avon beauty products

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es: Vanessa B. A., tiene la edad de 18 años, está  casada y no tiene hijos. Vive con su esposo. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado de engorde y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También ella  junto con su esposo desean aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
18-year old Vanessa B. A. is married but doesn’t have any children. She lives with her husband. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy cattle to fatten and food for them to eat. She wants to raise them well in order to obtain the best price possible when it comes time to sell them. Vanessa and her husband also want to increase the number of animals and provide better living conditions for them. She owns a field which is ideal for raising cattle. This is the first time that Vanessa is asking for a loan from Kiva partner FUDESCOR, and she is very happy with the terms that are offered. She hopes to provide a better quality of life for her family in the future, better financial stability, and she also hopes to continue growing as a person and livestock farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, localidad muy hermosa por sus calles, sus iglesias, sus ríos, su gastronomía, sus artesanos y sus escritores,  atractivos propios de la ciudad,  Es socia  hace ocho  años del banco comunal El Crédito gracias a la invitación de su cuñada, con los créditos recibidos  ha cubierto algunas necesidades de la casa y el negocio ya que ella se dedica a la venta de juguetes a la entrada de las escuelas, lleva 17 años en ésta labor. Con el  nuevo crédito que reciba comprará carros, pelotas, canicas, yoyos, baleros, etc., y también lápices y borradores para tener un stock surtido para ofrecer a los niños
 
Ana María  tiene 45 años, casada y madre de tres hijos que se encuentran de 27, 23, 17 años,  el primero de ellos es soltero pero vive independiente, su  segundo hijo estudia en la universidad de la ciudad y su último hijo no le gusto estudiar por lo que se dedica a trabajar, su esposo realiza transporte escolar, tienen su casa propia en otro canton  de la ciudad de Cuenca por lo que viven arrendando.
texts.en:
Ana María lives in the city of Cuenca, a city known for its very beautiful streets, churches, rivers, food, handicrafts writers, and other attractions. She has been a member of the communal bank " El Crédito" for 8 years, thanks to the invitation of her sister-in-law. With the loans she has received, she has covered some necessary household expenditures and invested in her business selling games at the entrance of schools. She has been doing this work for 17 years. With this new loan she will buy toy cars, balls, marbles, yo-yos, cup-and-ball games, and other toys. In addition, she will buy pencils and erasers to have an inventory to offer the children. Ana María is 45 years old, married, and is the mother of three children who are now 27, 23 and 17 years old. The eldest is single, but lives independently. Her second son studies at the university in the city, and her youngest does not like to study and so he works. Her husband works as a school bus driver. They live in a canton of the city of Cuenca where they live in a rented home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy toy cars, balls, marbles, yo-yos, cup-and-ball games, and also pencils and erasers

loans.name: Mariana Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora  Mariana S. es socia del Banco Comunal El Crédito, ella  vive en la comunidad Misicata localidad  que se caracteriza por presentar hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, mucha gente joven ha migrado a otras ciudades del país o fuera de él  para brindar un mejor futuro a sus familias.

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido dos hijos que se encuentran de 5 y 3 años, su  primera hija este año ingresa  al jardín de infantes, su esposo trabaja como acerrador de madera elaborando tablas, tablones, se encuentra contenta ya que tiene casa propia.

Mariana prepara  papas fritas en funda actividad que realiza hace dos  años, labora los días lunes y jueves, cuenta con una clientela fija  que le hacen  pedidos semanales,  los otros  días realiza la limpieza de departamentos en ésta actividad apenas tiene seis meses,  se encuentra en su séptimo crédito con su banco comunal  y fue una amiga quien la invito a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres muy luchadoras y emprendedoras, con su nuevo crédito va a comprar  aceite, papas, etiquetas,  fundas etc.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mariana S. is a member of El Crédito ("The Loan" or "The Good Reputation") Communal Bank. She lives in Misicata, an area known for its beautiful scenery. The people are mainly farmers. Many young people have migrated to other cities in Ecuador or in other countries to help give their families a better future. Mariana is 32 years old. She is married and has two children, a five-year-old and a three-year-old. This year her elder daughter begins kindergarten. Her husband's work is to make wooden boards and planks, and he is happy since they have their own house. For two years, Mariana has made potato chips on Mondays and Thursdays. She has steady customers who place weekly orders. The rest of the week, she cleans apartments, a job she has had barely six months. This is her seventh loan with her communal bank. A friend had invited her to become part of this group of very determined and enterprising women. With her new loan, Mariana will buy oil, potatoes, labels, paper bags, etc. Her goal is to keep growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes, oil, paper bags, labels

loans.name: Vicelino

texts.es: Vicelino V. H., tiene la edad de 81 años, es viudo y tiene 1 hijo de 36 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para comprar materiales y remodelar la porqueriza, además, de comprar algunos cerdos para la cría. La idea es darle el adecuado mantenimiento a los cerdos para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Vicelino tiene varios años en este negocio de cría de cerdos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Vicelino V. H. is 81 years old, widowed, and has a son who is 36 years old. The loan he needs is to buy materials and remodel his pig sty. In addition, he will buy some pigs to raise. He hopes to provide appropriate maintenance to the pigs so that he can have a better income when he sells them. This is the first time that he has taken a loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very satisfied with the payment terms that they provide. Don Vincelino has been raising pigs for a number of years. In the future he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and better economic stability, and to be able to continue to grow as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs and make a pig sty

loans.name: Yolotl Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio de la Sra. Adelina P. Martínez, un integrante del grupo Yolotl que significa corazón en el dialecto Náhuatl, que está ubicado en la comunidad de Ajalpan en el Estado de Puebla, México.
