En la foto se puede apreciar su local. Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta y verdura que inició hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercancía. Sus clientas dicen que el servicio que reciben de ella es muy amable y entusiasta. También vende servilletas de tela bordadas a mano. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente agradecida con la oportunidad que se le brinda para poder incrementar su negocio.  Tiene 56 años, estudió hasta el cuarto año de primaria, es casada y tiene en total 4 hijos (3 mujeres y  1 varón) los cuales ya cuentan con la mayoría de edad y no dependen de ella económicamente, sin embargo hace algunos años falleció una hija la cual le dejo a su cargo a 3 hijos los cuales ella mantiene económicamente.  Quiere este crédito para comprar en un futuro una caseta o local ambulante mas grande. También espera que con sus ganancias pueda solventar la educación de sus nietos y remodelar su domicilio.

Guadalupe Pérez C. es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 24años, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria, vive en unión libre y tiene en total 2 hijos (1 mujer y 1 varón).  Ella se dedica a renta de películas que inició hace 3 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de un mostrador. 

El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes. Los otros integrantes son:

Karen P. A.				Vta. De ropa.
Joachin Judith A. P.		Vta. De ropa.
Olga Soledad A. O.			Vta. De cosméticos.
Griselda Edelmira C. Rodríguez		Vta. De medicamento natural.
Elizabeth Alejandra Carreño R.		Cría de aves domésticos.
Mayra P. C.				Vta. De cosméticos.
Noemí Martínez González				Vta. De muebles.
Iris A. P.			Vta. Ganado porcino.
Inés González Juárez				Vta. De accesorios para celular.
María Guadalupe Díaz Méndez			Vta. De tortillas y trastes.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Adelina P. Martiniez’s business. She is a member of the Yototl group. Yototl means heart in the Náhuatl. The business is located in the Ajalpan community in the state of Puebla in Mexico. In the photo you can appreciate her place of business. She started selling fruit and vegetables two years ago. She is requesting the loan to buy more merchandise. Her customers say that the service they receive from her is very friendly and enthusiastic. She also sells hand embroidered napkins. Upon requesting this loan she feels grateful for the opportunity offered to her to be able to increase her business. She is 56, and she has a fourth grade education. She is married and has four children (three girls and one boy). The children are now grown and are not economically dependent upon her. However, a few years ago one of her daughters died and left three children for her to support. She wants this loan to later buy a larger stall or mobile stand. She also hopes that she will be able to pay for her grandchildren’s education and remodel her house with her earnings. Guadalupe Pérez C. is the president of the group. She is 24 years old, and she attended school until the third year of high school. She is in a common-law marriage, and she has two children (a girl and a boy). Three years ago she started a business renting movies. She is requesting the loan to buy a counter. The group is comprised of 12 members. The members are: Karen P. A.: Sells Clothes Joachin Judith A. P.: Sells Clothes Olga Soledad A. O.: Sells Cosmetics Griselda Edelmira C. Rodríguez: Sells Natural Medicines Elizabeth Alejandra Carreño R.: Raises Poultry Mayra P. C.: Sells Cosmetics Noemí Martínez González: Sells Furniture Iris A. P.: Sells Pigs Inés González Juárez: Sells Accessories for Cell Phones María Guadalupe Díaz Méndez: Sells Tortillas and Cooking Utensils

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

location.town: Comunidad de Ajalpan en el Edo de Puebla

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo R. M., tiene la edad de 24 años, está casado, y no tiene hijos. Vive con su esposa. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros de engorde y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Ricardo tiene varios años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Ricardo R. M., 24, is married and has no children; he lives with his wife. He wants the funds to buy a few calves to raise for subsequent sale. He wants to provide adequate care for the cattle so that he can get the highest possible sale price for them when he sells them. He also wants to increase his herd size and keep them under improved conditions; he has space that is ideal for raising cattle. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms he got. Ricardo has been a cattleman for several years. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability and to continue to grow both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Centeno Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Centenos está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Martha Rosaria Martínez M. de 53 años quien decidió poner con la liquidación un pequeño negocio que consiste en la venta de gaseosa, quesos, helados y pollo en lo cual invertirá el préstamo.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Lucrecia del Carmen C. quien desde hace quince años vende delantales los cuales distribuye en el mercado Oriental y Güembés y Heling de los Ángeles S. hace siete años inicio con su pequeño negocio de bordados el cual ha mantenido.
texts.en:
The Los Centenos group is composed of three hard-working women one of whom is Martha Rosaria Martínez M., 53. She used her severance pay to set up a small business consisting of soft-drink, cheese, frozen treats and chicken sales; she will use the funds to buy stock merchandise. Her fellow group members are Lucrecia del Carmen C. who has sold aprons for the last 15 years in the Oriental y Güembés market and Heling de los Ángeles S. who started a small embroidery shop seven years ago that she still has.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For soft-drinks, cheese, frozen treats and chicken.

loans.name: Jason

texts.es: Jason C. F., tiene la edad de 34 años, está soltero, y vive con sus padres y hermanas. El crédito lo quiere para la reparación del local del taller mecánico y compra de un compresor. Desea mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y ser más eficiente en su trabajo. Él cuenta con una instalación donde realiza los trabajos de mecánica y soldadura. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer de mejores condiciones a sus clientes. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecido con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como mecánico.
texts.en:
Jason C. F., 34, is single and lives with his parents and sisters. He needs funds to repair his workshop and to buy a compressor. He wants to improve his working conditions so that he can be more efficient in his work. He has a shop where he performs auto mechanics and welding jobs. He has been in this line of work for several years and has several regular customers; this is why he wants to offer better conditions to his customers. This will be the first time he has negotiated a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very grateful with the loan terms offered. He hopes in the future to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life and increased economic stability and to continue growing both as a person and as a mechanic.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a compressor and for repairs to his workshop.

loans.name: Wilston

texts.es: Wilston tiene 22 años, vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de ellos y de sus hermanos menores. A pesar de su corta edad, este joven trabajador tiene varios oficios, a los que se dedica con mucho empeño para salir adelante. Por temporadas lo contratan como obrero en diversas obras de construcción (sobretodo para construcción de caminos de la sierra peruana), y trabaja durante casi todo el día; afirma que el sueldo es bueno, aunque el trabajo es algo tedioso por la lejanía de los lugares y los factores climáticos de la sierra. Durante los fines de semana, cuida sus cultivos, pues siembra papas y alverjas junto a sus padres, por lo que se despierta muy temprano para realizar dicha labor. Paralelo a ello, tiene también una tienda de abarrotes en su casa; que es atendida por su madre. Manifiesta que las tres actividades le generan regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. Por el momento esta terminando de construir su casa, asimismo desea sembrar en mayor cantidad para aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, además se siente satisfecho con el trabajo de su banco comunal pues conoce a todos los integrantes de su grupo comunal y sabe que son muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. Wilston tiene pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de fertilizantes para mantener sus tierras preparadas para su siguiente siembra, además necesita abastecer su tienda con variados productos comestibles, para ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Wilston, 22, lives with his parents and younger siblings. Despite his young age, this hard-working young man has several jobs that he puts much effort into to get ahead in life. He is a seasonal construction worker (especially building roads in the Peruvian mountains), work that takes up almost all day. He states that the salary is good although the work is tedious because the job sites are far and because of weather conditions in the mountains. On weekends he tends to his crops; he farms potatoes and peas with his parents. This work requires him getting up very early in the morning. In addition, he has a grocery store in his home which his mother tends to. He tells us that the three jobs produce earnings that are adequate to help his parents meet household expenses. He is currently finishing building his house and he wants to increase his farming production in order to increase his profits. This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he is satisfied with his communal bank’s work because he knows all his fellow members well and knows that they are responsible with their payments. Wilston plans to use the requested funds to buy fertilizers to prepare his lands for the next planting as well as to buy assorted food products to stock his store so that he can offer his customers the best.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to stock his store with assorted products.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un padre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el anexo Santa Rosa del caserío Lagunas, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope, caracterizado por tener a la mayoría de su población concentrada en áreas rurales consideradas como zonas pobres, sus principales actividades son la agricultura y el comercio de animales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la crianza y venta de animales, el cría ganado ovino, porcino y vacuno en un ambiente situado a pocos metros de su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un nivel de desarrollo adecuado los ofrece en venta el distrito de Mórrope, en los anexos o en los alrededores de la zona donde vive, eventualmente los comercializa con los negociantes que suelen visitar el lugar. Este negocio le provee de ingresos estables que le ayudan a sostener a su familia y sacarla adelante. Adicionalmente suele trabajar como peón agrícola con lo que obtiene una ayuda económica adicional.

Carlos desea ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales para obtener mas ganancias y poder ayudar a su familia a progresar. Para lograr su objetivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de animales pequeños para criarlos y también en la compra de alimento balanceado para que estos tengan un buen desarrollo.

Carlos es una persona que gusta mucho de su trabajo y que desea darle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive el es muy conocido y estimado por sus vecinos. Anteriormente el ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Carlos, 42, lives with his wife and three children in Caserío Lagunas’ Santa Rosa annex, a rural zone in Mórrope district noted for having most of its residents, whose main commercial activities are farming and animal-raising, concentrated in rural areas considered to be poor. It is part of Lambayeque province and is located an hour and fifteen minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. He has raised sheep, pigs and cattle for over 10 years now in a location located a few meters from his home. When the animals reach an ideal weight for sale he takes them to Mórrope or to his surrounding annexes to sell; sometimes he sells them to merchants that come by the area. The business produces stable income that helps him support his family. In addition, he often works as a farm hand to earn extra income. Carlos would like to increase his business in order to obtain higher profits to help his family progress. To reach this goal he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to buy small farm animals to raise; he also will buy nutritionally balanced feed for them so that they will develop properly. Carlos enjoys his work very much and wants to provide his family with a good quality of life. He is very well-known and liked in his neighborhood. He has collaborated with our institution in the past and has shown himself to be a punctual and responsible client with respect to his repayment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

location.town: Anexo Santa Rosa - Lagunas - Mórrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica, de 26 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Nilson de 31 años  y de sus 3 pequeños hijos que aún están en etapa escolar. Desde muy pequeña empezó a trabajar en los campos agrícolas, por lo que aprendió  observando a sus padres y vecinos como trabajaban las tierras. Hoy siembra junto a su esposo, papa de buena calidad, a pesar que el precio de este tubérculo es bajo en el mercado, aún se muestra optimista, puesto que le gusta este trabajo, aunque algunas veces es tedioso tener que vigilar sus cultivos, peros sabe que todo esfuerzo es recompensado cuando su producción es vendida a los comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad, recibiendo buenas ganancias. Con estos ingresos, puede vivir tranquila con su familia, por lo tanto desea mas adelante aumentar su producción de papa y empezar a sembrar alverjas. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible que el crédito la ayude a continuar trabajando, además esta muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo comunal porque todos los integrantes son bien responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. Yessica tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para asegurar y proteger la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Yessica, age 26, lives in her own home in the company of her husband Nilson, age 31, and her 3 small children, who are still of school age. She has worked in agriculture since she was very young, learning from her parents and neighbors as they worked their fields. Today, she farms together with her husband, growing high-quality potatoes. Although the price of potatoes at the market is low, she is still optimistic, because she enjoys her work. She sometimes finds it tedious when she has to constantly care for her crops, but she knows that all of her efforts will pay off when she sells her harvest to the city's wholesale buyers, receiving a good profit. With this income, she can live in tranquility with her family, and accordingly she would like to increase her potato production in the future and also begin planting peas. This is her third loan with MFP, and she is very grateful to all of the people who have made the loan possible, allowing her to continue with her work. She is also very satisfied with her communal bank, because all of the members are very responsible in making their payments. Yessica plans to invest the loan in buying compost and fertilizer to protect and nourish her next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying compost and fertilizer for her next crop

loans.name: Darling Vanessa

texts.es:
Junín es una ciudad cálida, hospitalaria y sus habitantes muy buenas personas, así es la señora Darling M., de origen guayaquileño pero  con raíces manabitas  está  casada y  tiene 2 hijos, se dedica al comercio de ropa y zapatos.

Se comprometió con un manabita, prácticamente desde que llego a Manabí se dedicó al trabajo, ella lleva 10 años con su negocio su mama tenia un bazar y por ello ella vino a vivir a Junín, para ayudar a su madre de quien recibió los mejores ejemplos.

A los oídos de Darling llegaron comentarios que había  una fundación que hacia prestamos  para personas que quisieran tener sus negocios propios, por eso se unió la Fundación Espoir lleva 10 ciclos en mi bankito  sus compras las realiza en Guayaquil y Perú su esposo es chofer de volqueta tiene 9 años de comprometida,  su forma de vender es recorrer y dejar a crédito por semana  cobra y con el dinero recogido hace sus compras y con los créditos que hace también reinvierte en su negocio , además de zapatos y ropa nueva también vende ropa de paca , la compra en Portoviejo, tiene 20 a 25 clientes fijos ella se dedicó a vender ropa por su mamá  y por el bazar que tenia, su madre falleció pero le dejo además del bazar esos buenos ejemplos que se reciben de una madre tan trabajadora como la de ella, ahora aspira tener a mas del bazar un almacén para incrementar  sus ventas y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Junín is a warm, hospitable city and its residents are very good people. Darling M. is like this. She is from Guayaquil with roots in Manabi. She is married and has 2 children. She sells clothes and shoes. She got enagaged to a Manabitan, and practically since she arrived in Manabi she has worked. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her mother has a variety store and that is why she came to live in Junín, to help her mother who always was the best role model for her. Darling heard tell that their was a foundation that made loans to people who want to have their own businesses. That is why she joined Fundación Espoir. She has been in the bank for 10 cycles. She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and Peru. Her husband is a dump truck driver, and she has been with him for 9 years. The way she sells is she goes out and sells on credit and she collects every week. With the money she has collected she makes her purchases and she reinvests the loans into her business. Besides new shoes and clothes, she also sells clothing in bulk. She buys it in Portoviejo and she has 20 to 25 regular customers. She began selling clothes because of her mother and the variety store she had. Her mother passed away but apart from the variety store she left her the good example of being a hardworking mother like she was. Now she aspires to having a store inaddition to the variety store, in order to increase her sales and her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.es: Giovanni S. G., tiene la edad de 25 años, está soltero y vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la siembra de una hectárea de café y asistir el café que ya posee en su finca. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Giovanni trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Giovanni S. G. is 25 years of age. He is single and lives with his parents. He wants the loan to sow a hectare of coffee and to care for the coffee that he already has on his farm. He would like to have adequate funds to maintain his coffee crop to achieve better quality and to obtain the most possible income at harvest time. This is the first time that he has requested a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very pleased with the facilities that were offered him. Mr. Giovanni has worked for several years in agriculture. He hopes in the future to offer his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to cultivate coffee

loans.name: Fanny De Lourdes

texts.es:
Es ama de casa y modista, madre abnegada y esposa  fiel, así es  Fanny de 52 años  de edad, tiene 4 hijos , aparte de su dedicación por su hogar y familia, ella centra sus ideales en  lo que es la moda, además de ser modista  también se dedica al comercio,  compra las telas y cose edredones , sabanas de recién nacidos, almohadas  y también borda , en fin todo lo que tenga que ver con los bordados , luego de bordar las prendas  las pone  a la venta,  lleva 10 años en su negocio, la señora Fanny es tan entregada a su trabajo que también opta por instruirse lo hace recibiendo  cursos.

Sus sabanas las entrega en Guayaquil y Portoviejo 15 sabanas por semana aparte de lo bordado, sus compras las realiza en Santo Domingo viaja con su esposo a hacer las compras el material que ella utiliza es pintex, su esposo es profesor de colegio  y una hija le ayuda a bordar su mayor sueño es tener un restaurante en Junín sin dejar la costura, el crédito que esta solicitando es para invertir en su negocio  y ver como con su esfuerzo su familia sigue adelante.
texts.en:
She is a housewife, a seamstress, a self-sacrificing mother, and a loyal wife. That is Fanny. She is 52 years old, and she has four children. Besides her dedication to her home and her family, she focuses on fashion. In addition to being a seamstress, she is a merchant. She buys fabric and makes comforters, sheets for newborns, and pillows. She also embroiders; she does everything that has to do with embroidery. After she embroiders the articles, she puts them up for sale. She has been in this business for ten years. Fanny is so devoted to her work that she chose to receive instruction by taking courses. She delivers her sheets to Guayaquil and Portoviejo. There are 15 sheets a week aside from the embroidery. She makes her purchases in Santo Domingo. She travels with her husband to buy the material, “pintex”, that she uses. Her husband is a teacher. One of her daughters helps her embroider. Her biggest dream is to have a restaurant in Junín, but she would keep sewing. The loan she is requesting is to invest in her business. She will see how her family gets ahead through her effort.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheets and fabric

loans.name: Nuevo Oriente Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuevo Oriente  está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras  las cuales trabajan con Adim desde hace años. La coordinadora del grupo es Rosa Virginia Fran una señora alegre y esforzada la cual se dedica a realizar sartenes con la ayuda de un  nieto. Ella con el préstamo comprar materiales para la fabricación de dicho producto.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Ana Paulina C. quien vende perfumes por encargo, Elivee T. M. comercializa prendas en oro laminado y perfumes y Ángela S. comercializa de todo un poco desde ropa, perfumes, cosméticos,  cremas, panas, bolsos…etc.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Oriente group is comprised of four hard-working and enterprising women. They have worked with Adim for several years. Rosa Virginia Fran is the coordinator of the group. She is a happy and dedicated woman who makes pans with the help of a grandson. She will use the loan to buy material to make this product. Ana Paulina C. is a colleague in the group. She sells perfume by order. Elivee T. M., another colleague, sells articles that have been laminated in gold and perfume. Ángela S., a colleague, sells a little of everything like clothes, perfume, cosmetics, creams, bread, and purses, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials to make pans

loans.name: Isabel Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Isabel tiene 21 años de casada con dos hijos ella junto a su esposo tiene un taller llevan con el muchos años, nacieron en este bello cantón de la provincia de Manabí como lo es Junín, en esta parte de la región sus habitantes son agricultores ganaderos y comerciantes de productos de la tierra, pero en esta ocasión nuestra socia se dedica a otra ocupación con lo es la venta de repuestos para  bicicletas,  y además de que el esposo y sus hijos se dedican a reparar las mismas, el pequeño taller lo tiene en su propia casa en una área destinada para ello, desde las 7 de la mañana están en pie para emprender la labor cotidiana hasta que sean las 7 de la noche que es cuando cierran el taller para ir a descansa.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Isabel podrá trasladarse hasta la ciudad de Portoviejo para surtir su taller, es en la capital de los manabitas que realiza sus compras necesarias como repuestos, pintura ligas y mas accesorios, ya tiene un lugar preciso donde comprar al por mayor y así  obtener buenas ganancias, hasta los actuales momento la señora Isabel no ha tenido problema alguno con los pagos al créditos muy responsable y espera seguir trabajando en lo mismo le gusta mucho y eso le hace feliz a toda la familia, con todo estos años de trabajo han podido estos esposos brindarle el estudio a sus hijos y hacer de ellos hombres de  bien.
texts.en:
Isabel has been married for 21 years. Along with her husband and two children, she has a workshop that they have had for many years. They were born in the pretty Junín canton in the Manabí province. In this area the inhabitants work in agriculture and livestock production, and they also sell agricultural products. But this time our member has a different occupation. She sells spare parts for bicycles, and in addition, her husband and children repair bicycles. The small workshop that they have in their own home is in a separate area dedicated to the business. From 7 in the morning they are on their feet carrying out the daily labor until 7 at night, which is when they close the workshop so they can rest. With this new loan Isabel will be able to go to the city of Portoviejo to restock her workshop. This is the capital of Manabí province, where she can purchase the items she needs, such as spare parts, metal paints, and other accessories. She already has a place where she buys wholesale; in this way she gets good profits. Up to this date, Isabel has not had any problems with the payments on her loans. She is very responsible and hopes to continue working in the same business. She enjoys it very much, and it makes her whole family happy, because with all of these years of work this couple has been able to provide their children with an education and raise them to be good men.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy metal paint and bicycle accessories

loans.name: Liliana Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la localidad de Junín un bello y paradisiaco cantón en la provincia de Manabí nos reunimos con las socias del banco comunal Junín del cual la señora Liliana forma parte del el y nos permitió conocer mas de ella, ya son 6 ciclos los que lleva en el bankito y esta muy contenta al trabajar con los créditos, porque aparte de ser una excelente madre y buen ama de casa también esta inmersa en el mundo de los negocios, y desde hace varios años tiene el negocio de las ventas de ropa como  medias , pantalones, blusas y todo para lucir bien en toda ocasión.

Ahora con este nuevo crédito la señora Liliana  hará un viaje hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil donde hace sus compras para el negocio, va hasta los grandes distribuidores de ropa e invierte todo lo que el dinero que recibe, por lo general viaja cada dos meses eso también depende de cómo se manejen las ventas, una vez traída la mercadería saca su puesto los días domingo en la feria del pueblo, el esposo le acompaña a pesar que el tiene su propio trabajo que es de ser agricultor los días que no esta en las siembras es el domingo y se lo dedica al negocio de su esposa.
texts.en:
In Junín, a beautiful and heavenly canton of Manabí province we meet with the members of the Junín communal bank. Liliana is a member and she allowed us to learn a bit more about her. She has been a member of the bank for six cycles and she is very happy to work with the loans because, besides being an excellent mother and good housewife, she is immersed in the business world: she has had a clothing sales business for several years where she stocks hosiery, pants, blouses and everything else needed to look good for any occasion. Liliana will use this new loan to travel to Guayaquil where she will purchase stock merchandise for her business; she will visit the large clothing distributors and will invest all the funds she receives. She usually makes this buying trip every two months depending on how good sales are. Once she brings the merchandise she sets up her sales stand at the town’s Sunday market. Her husband keeps her company although he has his own occupation. He’s a farmer but his day off from farming chores is Sunday so he dedicates it to his wife’s business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted women's clothing.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra G. V., tiene la edad de 45 años, es soltera y vive con sus dos hijos de 14 y 18 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de inventario para su negocio. Desea tener un inventario más amplio y variado de productos para ofrecer en su minisuper. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en el negocio, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecida con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.
texts.en:
Mayra G. V. is 45 years old and single. She lives with her two children, ages 14 and 18. She wants the loan to buy inventory for her business. She wants to have more ample inventory and a variety of products to sell in her small super-market. She sells groceries. She started this business several years ago, and she has many good customers. She needs to offer them a greater variety of products in her business. She also needs greater income for her household. This is her first loan with Fudescosur, and she is very grateful for the ease of the loan. In the future she hopes to give her family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. She also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and as a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Junín del mismo nombre de la ciudad se reúne cada 15 días en casa de una de las socias, se puede dar a notar que este es un grupo de socias bastante carismático y están  presta a colaborar, y eso fue propio para empezar con nuestras entrevista, en ser la primer de conversar con nosotros es la señora Ramonita.
 
La señora Ramonita a sus 60 años de edad tiene un pequeño negocio de comida, un restaurant donde trabaja diariamente con clientes fijos esta contenta con este negocio y le ha ido muy con el resultado que ha obtenido no se lo esperaba  de esta modo, ella en viudo y quedo acompañada de sus hijos que ahora son los que le dan fuerza para salir adelante, el negocio lo tiene en su propia casa desde las 5 de  la mañana ya anda en pie preparando los alimentos, ella ofrece desayuno, almuerzos y en la tarde vende tortillas de maíz con café ya saben sus clientes y le buscan por su buena sazón, con este nuevo crédito que obtendrá piensa en comprar los alimentos y los productos necesarios para preparar el menú, cuenta que tiene que viajar hasta la ciudad de Portoviejo para ir al mercado central y abastecerse de todo.
texts.en:
The Junín communal bank, named after the city it meets in every two weeks, gathers in the home of one of its members. One can notice that this is a group of quite charismatic members that are ready to collaborate which was just right for us to begin our interviews. Our first interviewee was Ramonita. Ramonita, 60, has a small food business, an eatery where she works daily taking care of regular customers. She is happy with this business and has done well with it better, in fact, than she had expected. She was widowed and was left in the company of her children who are now her strength to continue forward. Her business is in her home and she is on her feet from 5am on preparing meals; she offers breakfast and lunch and in the evening she offers corn tortillas with coffee. Her customers are aware of this and seek her out because her dishes are so tasty. She will use the new funds received to buy groceries and other products needed to prepare her dishes. She tells us that she must travel all the way to the city of Portoviejo to go to the central market and stock up on everything.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Rita Natalia

texts.es:
La señora Rita es una de las Fundadoras del Banco Comunal Junín, esta casada tiene 6 hijos ella es comerciante junto con su esposo tiene una distribuidora de llantas, ya han pasado 15 años desde que decidieron abrir este negocio, un día el esposo decide que le gustaría tener su propio negocio y decide por este, que lo han sabido mantener, sin necesidad de salir de casa o alquilar algún local ellos decidieron que sea en su propia casa.
Con el crédito que recibirá nuestra socia Rita invertirá en surtir su negocio, la mayoría de las personas que habitan el sector va a comprar para sus vehículos llantas, tubos de escape, aceites, ya tiene sus propios clientes sin necesidad de buscarlos.

La señora Rita es la que esta siempre al pendiente de los detalles, pero también se da su tiempito para hacer una labor que le gusta mucho como lo es la preparación de dulces típicos de la región como, galletas de almidón, rompope, dulces de frutas y mas, cuenta nuestra socia que es por hobbies que hace esto pero así también tiene sus clientes que le viene a comprar de otras partes que le compran por libras. Con todo lo que le pasa a la señora Rita dice que esta muy agradecida porque sus sueños se le han hecho realidad es una mujer felizmente realizada.
texts.en:
Rita is one of the founders of the Junín Communal Bank. She is married and has six children. She and her husband are merchants; they have a tire distributorship. It has been 15 years since they decided to open this business. One day her husband decided that he would like to have his own business. He decided on this one. They knew how to maintain it without having to leave the house or rent a location. They decided it would be in their own house. Rita will use the loan she receives to stock her business. Most of the people who live in the area are going to buy tires, exhaust pipes, and oil. They already have their own customers without having to look for them. Rita always watches out for the details, but she also spends a little time doing what she really likes doing. She makes typical regional sweets like meringues, rum cookies, sweets from fruit, and more. She says that she does this as a hobby, but she has customers who come from other places who buy them by the pound. With everything that happens to Rita, she says that she is very grateful because her dreams have come true. She is a happily fulfilled woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires, exhaust pipes, and oil

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus cinco hijos en el anexo Barrio Muro del caserío Tranca Sasape, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito de Mórrope, distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayoría de su población dispersa en zonas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 20 años a trabajar en labores agrícolas, especialmente en la crianza de animales, ella cría ganado vacuno y caprino para comercializarlos, cuando estos llegan a un buen punto de desarrollo, con los pobladores de zonas aledañas y con los negociantes que visitan el lugar. Adicionalmente en el caso de las vacas aprovecha también la leche que estas producen para comercializarla con sus vecinos. Estas actividades le permiten apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia, su esposo se gana la vida como agricultor.

Gladys desdea mejorar la calidad de los animales que cría y también mejorar la calidad de la leche que producen sus vacas, por ello desea brindarles una alimentación balanceada. Siguiendo su objetivo ha creído necesario solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Gladys es una mujer trabajadora y hogareña, ella no sólo se dedica a trabajar en su vivienda, sino que también apoya a su esposo en las actividades agrícolas. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Gladys, 45, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Tranca Sasape’s Barrio Muro annex, a rural area of Mórrope district noted for having most of its population spread out in rural zones; it belongs to Lambayeque province and is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For over 20 years she has farmed, especially raising animals like cattle and goats. When they reach an ideal weight she sells them to residents in adjacent areas and to merchants who visit the area. In addition, in the case of the cows, she also sells the milk they produce to her neighbors. These activities allow her to help her husband support the family; he earns his living as a farmer. Gladys wants to improve the quality of her animals as well as the quality of the milk her cows produce. For this reason, she wants to provide them with balanced nutrition. To reach this goal, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan. Gladys is a hard-working and home-loving woman. She not only works on her home she also helps her husband with his farming chores. She has collaborated with our Institution in the past and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible with respect to her installment payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

location.town: Anexo Barrio Muro - Tranca Sasape - Mórrope - Lamb

loans.name: Rafael Angel

texts.es: Rafael Angel G. A., tiene la edad de 44 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 19 y 13 años de edad, y son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de insumos para el mantenimiento del cultivo de tomate,la idea es sembrar más tomate y dar mantenimiento al cultivo existente.Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de tomate para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Rafael también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Rafael Angel G. A., 44, is married and lives with his wife and two children who are 19 and 13 years of age and his main priority in life. He will use the requested funds to buy farming supplies for his tomato crops. The idea is to plant more tomatoes and to provide crop maintenance to the existing plants in order to have a better quality harvest that will produce the best possible sales price. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the terms offered. Rafael has been a farmer for many years. He hopes to provide his family in the future with a better quality of life and increased economic stability as well as to continue to develop both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For tomato crops.

loans.name: Marenco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Marenco está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Josefa Leonarda E.  de 54 años quien se dedica a  realizar costura  como camisetas, vestidos etc. desde 1980. Ella con el préstamo compra materiales como telas, hilos, botones etc. para aumentar su negocio.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Patricia Lucia A. Espiniza quien a la edad de catorce años empezó a realizar trabajos de costuras y  Celania de la Asunción C. Marenco trabaja en Textil y vestuario desde la edad de 18 años cuando aprendió abordar con unas vecinas y el cual ha ido perfeccionando con nuevas técnicas y tendencias.  El trabajo de ella lo promueve a través de Ferias Nacionales, Fiestas Patronales y cruceros y muy pronto si Dios se lo permite llegara las ferias internacionales.
texts.en:
The Marenco group is made up of three hard-working women. One of them is Josefa Leonarda E., 54, who is a seamstress; she has made shirts, dresses, etc. since 1980. She will use the loan to buy materials like fabric, thread, buttons, etc. to increase her business. Her fellow group members are: Lucia A. Espiniza who has been a seamstress since the age of 14 and Asunción C. Marenco who has worked in textiles and dressmaking since she was 18 years old and learned to embroider from some neighbors; since then she has been perfecting her work with new techniques and trends. She promotes her work at national markets, patron saint feast days, cruises and very soon, God permitting, international markets.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials like fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Danny Jesús

texts.es: Danny Jesús A. F., tiene la edad de 24 años, está soltero, y no tiene hijos. Vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros de engorde y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Danny tiene varios años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Danny Jesús A. F., 24, is single and has no children; he lives with his parents. He wants the loan to buy some calves and feed for them. He wants to provide proper care for them so that he will get the highest possible sale price. He also wants to increase his herd size and keep them in better conditions; he has an ideal space for cattle-raising. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he’s very happy with the terms offered. Danny has raised cattle for several years. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and increased economic stability and to continue developing both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves and feed for them.

loans.name: Karys

texts.es: Karys B. S., tiene la edad de 32 años, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos de 15,13 y 12 años de edad respectivamente, ellos son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para comprar cerdos para engorde. La idea es darle el adecuado mantenimiento a los cerdos para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Karys tiene varios años en este negocio de cría de cerdos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Karys B. S., 32, is married and has three children who are 15, 13 and 12 years of age respectively; they are her greatest priority in life. She will use the funds to buy pigs to raise. The idea is to provide them with proper care so that they will get the highest possible sale price. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she’s very happy with the loan terms offered. Karys has been in this pig-raising business for a long time. She hopes to provide her family with better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future and to continue to develop both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Elsa H. D. 57 años D. edad, actualmente casada y tiene 4 hijos, es una D. las 7 integrantes D. la Alcancía Comunal Nuevo Amanecer.
DesD. hace 28 años viene trabajando  en la venta D. zapatos, zapatillas, y prendas D. vestir D. forma ambulatoria, los venD. al contado y a crédito, empezó con una docena D. zapatos y poca cantidad D.  prendas D. vestir: camisas, polos, y otras, pero al transcurrir el tiempo su ingreso fue mejorando y fue aumentando  su mercadería D. acuerdo a la venta que realizaba,  empezó  en Edaprospo  por intermedio D. una vecina  que la invitaron  a participar. Su primer préstamo lo invirtió en la compra D. zapatos y prendas D. vestir.
Este actual Préstamo  lo invertirá en la compra D. una docena D. zapatos y zapatillas y una cantidad D. prendas D. vestir.
El anhelo D. Elsa es poder establecer  una tienda propia en una zona publica para  vender su mercadería, y culminar la construcción D. su casa.
texts.en:
57 year-old Elsa H. is one of the 7 members of the Nuevo Amanecer ("New Dawn") Communal Bank. She is currently married and has four children. For the last 28 years she has worked selling shoes, sneakers, and clothing as an itinerant vendor for cash and credit. She started with a dozen shoes and a small quantity of clothing like shirts, jerseys, and other items, but over time, her business improved and she expanded her merchandise based on the sales she maD.. Elsa came to EDAPROSPO through a neighbor who invited her to participate. She invested her first loan in the purchase of shoes and items of clothing. She will invest this loan in the purchase of a dozen shoes and sneakers and a number of items of clothing. Elsa's dream is to be able to establish her own store in a public area, where she can sell her merchandise, and to finish constructing her house.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, such as shoes and sneakers

loans.name: Anonymous

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Rosalía tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Sapamé Alto, una zona rural del distrito de Túcume, conocido por sus pirámides, uno de los principales puntos arqueológicos de la región. La zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde que se casó apoya a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economia familiar. Ella suele trabajar confeccionando pantalones en drill y poliéster, también cría animales para comercializarlos con sus vecinos y con los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. 

Se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace seis años, empezó apoyando en un taller y poco a poco fue aprendiendo del oficio, actualmente trabaja con un vecino en la confección de pantalones para caballeros los cuales los vende a un acopiador que revende la mercadería en la sierra del país. 

Por otro lado, lleva dedicándole a la crianza de animales el mismo tiempo que a la confección, cría cerdos y vacas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han llegado a desarrollarse de manera correcta los ofrece en venta. Estas actividades le sirven para apoyar a su esposo que trabaja como agricultor.

Rosalía desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de alimento balanceado para así poder mejorar la calidad de sus animales de modo que pueda obtener mas ganancias, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y que siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo de los suyos. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Rosalía, 25, is married and has three children; she lives with her family in the Sapamé Alto settlement, a rural area of Túcume district, an area known for its pyramids, one of the region’s main archaeological sites. The zone is part of Lambayeque province and it’s located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. She has helped her husband support the family ever since she got married. She manufactures dril (a fabric similar to canvas or denim) and polyester pants and she also raises animals to sell to her neighbors and to merchants that visit the area where she lives. She has made clothing for the past six years. She started out helping out in a shop and gradually learned the skills. Currently, she works with a neighbor making men’s pants that are sold to person who gathers goods from several manufacturers to then resell in the country’s mountain settlements. On the other hand, she has raised animals for about the same amount of time since she’s been sewing; she raises pigs and cows in her back yard and when they reach proper weight she sells them. With these activities she helps her husband, who is a farmer, support their family. Rosalía wants to increase her business and needs to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed so that the quality of her animals will improve leading to better profits. For this reason, she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan that will help her reach this goal. She is quite a responsible woman that is always watching over her family’s wellbeing and development. She has collaborated with our Institution in the past and has shown herself to be responsible and punctual when it comes to her installment payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced feed.

texts.en: Nonato B. Jr. is from the village of Imurong, Baggao, Cagayan. He is 36 years old and is the group leader of an eleven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Nonato is married and has three school-aged children. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business, providing transportation services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. Nonato joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. This loan will be his first from ASKI. Nonato plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine L. is from the city of San Jose Santiago. She is 37 years old. Josephine is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Josephine L.'s group.

Josephine is married and has 3 school-aged children. Josephine owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

Elba is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This will be the third loan taken out by Elba from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

Irene Z. is from the town of Turod Norte Cordon. She is 55 years old. Irene is the group leader of a 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. loans.name: Rashidan

texts.en:
Rashidan is a 54-year-old married woman who lives in the mid-sized city of Riwind, Pakistan. She is a very humble lady. She owns a three-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for over twenty years.

Rashidan has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. Her sons work in a local factory on monthly wage; her elder daughter helps her in her dairy business and the younger daughter is fifteen years old and studies in 9th standard grade.

Rashidan and her family operate a dairy business and are very hardworking. Their business is renowned in their community. They get up early in the morning to get milk from their dairy cows and sell to the milk shops and in the community. Now, their dairy business has become their family business. They enjoy their work a lot and they are happy to help each other to grow their business.

Presently, Rashidan has two dairy cows at home. She is a regular client of Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). She has successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah and now she is applying for the fifth time to purchase another dairy cow to expand her dairy business.

Rashidan has a dream to have her own milk shop in future so her family earns good profits and improves its living standard.

loans.use: To purchase another dairy cow for her dairy business

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is 39 years old and lives with her husband and one teenage son in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. She and her family live together in a single-roomed house.

Currently, Sajida operates a business sewing clothes while her husband is a painter. They have been operating their businesses for over fifteen years, and have steadily expanded them. Her husband, F. H., paints windows and doors and Sajida sews clothes for her neighbors. Their businesses are well known to their customers. With the profit, they purchased a color television and a fridge.

Sajida has been a client of Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan) for the last two years. Now she is applying for a loan for the third time to start a business selling paint. She and her husband have the expectation that the new business will give them good earnings which will help them to provide a better lifestyle to their son.

loans.use: To start a business selling paint

loans.name: Rasoolan's Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan is 27-year-old woman. She is from the city called Borewala, in Pakistan. (Borewala is famous for its shrines.) She is an uneducated lady. Her parents couldn’t send her to school because they have a big family to support.  She spent her time at home and did household work. She got married at the age of 18 to a man whose name is M. R.. 

Rasoolan gave birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son reads in 2nd standard and the others have no occupation. Rasoolan is a very talented lady; she manages her clothes-selling business. She receives order from her neighbors and relatives. She purchases clothing from different cities (especially Multan & Lahore) because of their cheap rates and good designs. She has been operating this business for the last 3 years. Her income helps her to share the financial burden with her husband. 

Her husband sells vehicle tyres (rubber edging for wheels) in the market. He has been in this business for over 25 years. He has obtained a good reputation among his customers. He sells quality materials in his shop which attracts more customers.  

Rasoolan has been a client of Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan) for the last three years. She is applying for a loan for the fourth time to purchase tyres in bulk to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: Purchase tyres for husband's business

loans.name: Razia Sultana's Group

texts.en:
Razia Sultana is married to M. J. A..  She lives in Pakistan, in the city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. 

Razia is 31 years old, and she owns a two-room brick house, where she has been living with her family for more than 5 years. She is a mother of three children: one son and two daughters. Her son is in school, but the other children are not old enough for school yet.

Razia is a very caring lady who stays at home and takes care of her family and manages the domestic chores. Her husband makes a living driving an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).  He also sells fresh flowers in morning, supplying the flowers to the flower shops to generate income. He has two businesses to improve the family's standard of living and to provide a better future for the children.

Razia is a regular client of the Asasah microfinance institute in Pakistan. She has successfully paid back three previous loans from Asasah and now   is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s flower-selling business.

loans.use: Purchase flowers for husband's business

loans.name: Hargul

texts.en:
Hargul is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Kalbadjar region.  She has settled in the Absheron region.

Hargul L. was born in 1962. She is married and has 4 children. Hargul sells cosmetics for a living.  She has been in this business for 6 years and is very experienced in her business  She has a small shop is in Masazir. She is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to improve her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mahnure

texts.en:
Mahnure M. is single. She was born in 1983 and she lives with her mother and father in the Absheron region. 

Mahnure has been in the glassware business for 5 years.She wishes to buy more inventory to improve her income. She is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to buy wares such as chandeliers in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy wares such as chandeliers

loans.name: Serfinaz

texts.en:
Serfinaz M. is 38 years old and married, with 3 children. Serfinaz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Kalbadjar region.  She has settled in the Absheron region. 

She has been in the carpet business for 4 years. Her shop is small but very good. She is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 5 carpets to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy 5 carpets

loans.name: Elshen

texts.en:
Elshen M. was born in 1964, and he is married, with 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan.  He has now settled in the Absheron region. 

Elshen has been in the home-construction business for 17 years. His father also built houses. Elshen is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary materials to build houses.

loans.use: To buy materials to build houses

loans.name: Tunzale

texts.en: Born in 1974, Tunzale M. is married and has 4 children. Tunzale has been in this business for 10 years. Tunzale is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, now settled in Absheron region. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 Azerbaijani Manat (AZN) to expand her shop.

loans.use: To expand her shop

loans.name: Mais

texts.en: Mais has been in the business of making plastic windows for 10 years. He was born in 1977, is married and has 3 children. The family lives in the Absheron region. His grandfather made wooden windows and doors, but Mais makes them in plastic. He needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary equipment for making windows and doors to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary equipment for making windows and doors

loans.name: Najebullah

texts.en:
Najebullah, the son of S. A., is 31 years old, married and the father of 3 children. He lives in Kabul with his family of 8 members, including his father, his mother and one brother. Najebullah has a catering shop in Kabul and he has been involved in this business for more than five years.

He is now experiencing some financial problems. Najebullah has requested a loan of 50,000 AFN to buy some tools such as pots, bowls, spoons and more. He wants to thank all the lenders of Kiva and AFS in Afghanistan for supporting poor people in this poor country.

loans.use: to buy some tools such as pots, bowls, spoons, etc.

loans.name: Gull-E- Badam Group

texts.en:
Bashi K., the son of S. W. K., is 53 years old and the leader of the G.-E- Badam group. He is married and the father of 6 children. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan and is an educated man. He has a shop in Kabul where he sells books and magazines. Now he wants to enlarge his bookstore and buy more books for his shop.

Therefore, he has a requested a loan to buy books and magazines for his shop. He wants to work hard to make a better future for all of his family, especially for his son who works with him. He is sure that he can be more successful and further his business.

loans.use: buy books and magazines for his book shop

loans.name: Setara Gharb Group

texts.en:
Mohammad Ameen is a young man and the leader of the Setara Gharb group. He is an educated person with lots of experience. He is a tailor and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. From when he first started his business, he has always wanted to improve it. He has his shop in the town where he lives.

With this loan, he wants to purchase a new sewing machine and other required materials such as different kinds of threads, needles and cloth. He is grateful for this loan process. He wants to say that it is his first loan and it is really great, especially for his workers. He wants to continue his partnership and encourage other workers to use this loan service.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and other required materials

loans.name: Hafis

texts.en: Hafis H. was born in 1984 and is married. He and his wife live in the city of Baku. He has been farming for 8 years. In the picture, Hafis is working on his saplings. He needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fertilizers and seeds to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Robaba Zaghona Group

texts.en:
Naimaullah, the son of M. A., is 26 years old and the leader of the Robaba Zaghona group. He is an educated man with much experience. He has a stationary shop in the city of Kabul. He needs a small loan to help his business become strong and his family to manage better.

With the loan, he wants to enlarge and expand his business, so he wants to buy pens, pencils, notebooks, sharpeners and more. He also wants to buy the necessary materials to complete his stock for the shop and start working hard.

loans.use: to buy pens, pencils, notebooks and sharpeners for his stationary shop

loans.name: Nawy Gozar Gah Group

texts.en:
Mahboba, the daughter of J., is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She is the leader of the Nawy Gozar Gah group. She lives in Kabul. She has a carpet weaving business in which she has been involved for more than 6 years.

She has requested a loan in order to buy a new carpet frame to help her work better and to expand her business. She is very happy about this lending process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to buy a new carpet frame

loans.name: Sedreddin

texts.en: Sedreddin H. was born in 1958. He is married and has 2 children. The family lives in the city of Baku. He has been in the taxi business for four years. He needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts for his car to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz A. was born in 1964, and he is married with 2 children.  Mubariz and his little family live in Baku city. 

He has been in the agriculture business for 5 years. So far, he has planted vegetables, but he has resolved to add other products. He is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fertilizer and seeds to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Mehrac

texts.en:
Mehrac was born in 1980, and he is married, with one child. Mehrac Aliyev and his little family live in Baku city. 

He has sold fruit and vegetables for 4 years. He is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fruit and vegetables to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Nicat

texts.en:
Nicat M. was born in 1975, and is married and has 2 children. He lives with his family in Baku city. 

Nicat has been in the glassware business for 6 years. He is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Momun

texts.en: Momun A. is married and has 3 children. He was born in 1979. Momun and his family live in Baku city. This man has been in his business for 6 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy buy fertilizers and seeds to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Kamran A. was born in 1983. He is single. Kamran lives in Baku city with his family. He has been in the consulting business for 3 years. Kamran prepares different types of the materials and print copies and forms which are requested by his clients. Another aspect of his consulting is translation. In order to provide good service to his clients he needs to expand his business by purchasing a new computer, photo copy machine and provide new equipment for a new employee. He is young and his business is new. Karman needs a loan of 2000 AZN to expand his business.

loans.use: to expand the area

loans.name: Vusale

texts.en: Vusale Xanbiyeva is 24 years old and single. She lives in the city of Baku with her family. She has been selling cosmetic products for 4 years. She now needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more cosmetic products to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Xalid

texts.en: Xalid M. was born in 1974. He is married and has 5 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the town of Fuzuli, in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, now settled in the Absheron region. He has been in this business for 10 years. He now needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy home products to sell to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil was born in 1988 and is single. He has been in the taxi business for 2 years. He now needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts for his car to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil Q. was born 1976. He is married and has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the town of Fuzuli, in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, now settled in the Absheron region. He has been farming for 6 years. He now needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy fertilizers and seeds to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Munkhbaatar

texts.en: Munkhbaatar is 53 years old and lives with his wife and 2 daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter, Tserendolgor, is 29 years old and works as an accountant. His 24-year-old daughter, Dulamjav, attends a university. Munkhbaatar operates a water well in his town. He also operates an auto repair service. His wife has a very enterprising spirit, and she has grown potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes and carrots on her own land. Munkhbaatar is an honest person and has good communication skills. He is requesting a loan to build a new house.

loans.use: to build a new house

loans.name: Sharavdulam

texts.en:
Sharavdulam is 35 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a small house which they own. Her daughters attend a kindergarten.

Sharavdulam operates a business selling second-hand products such as shoes at Narantuul market, the largest and most crowded market in the city. Sharavdulam started her business in 1998 and has had steady growth over the years, gaining great business experience. She has used her earnings to support her family and expand her business. Sharavdulam is very hardworking and hopes to continue her success in the future. In 2009, Sharavdulam and her husband purchased their own house, grocery store and car. She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Jamal Agha Group

texts.en: Shakiba is the daughter of A. J.. She is 26 years old, married, and has one son. She is the leader of 'Jamal Agha' group. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She has a brother who is single and he is responsible for whole family including his father and mother who benefit from the income he generates through his business, a fresh fruit and vegetable shop. So his sister (Shakiba) has requested a loan for her brother. With this loan he wants to buy more fresh fruit and vegetables. Her brother is very happy that he has got a chance to progress as soon as possible.

loans.use: buy more fresh fruits and vegetables for his shop

loans.name: Zazay Group

texts.en:
Shah Kuku is the daughter of S. A.. She is 38 years old and the leader of 'Zazay' group. She is married and the mother of 5 children; they live in Kabul, Afghanistan. She wants to take out a loan for her husband who has a general store. With this loan he wants to buy beans, shampoo, pens and notebooks.

So she is very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan and wants to thank those who support this process, especially Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: buy beans, shampoo, pens and notebooks for his shop

loans.name: Kide

texts.en:
Kide M. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and dried fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock onions to sell.  Kide is 27 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock onions to sell

loans.name: Uafala

texts.en:
Uafala I. is currently in the business of selling beans, pulses, and cassava flour and is requesting a loan to stock maize flour to sell.  Uafala is 25 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store to sell her goods in.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock maize flour to sell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely P. is from the village of Cabol-Anonan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Fely is widowed and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Fely owns & operates a business venture selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to local community members. Fely has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Fely is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Fely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Rosito

texts.en:
Rosito A. is from the village of Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 60 years old. Rosito is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Rosito owns and operates a tailoring business. He has been engaged in his business for over 40 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, he joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosito is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase cloth for dress-making. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
