Para ella no es fácil administrar ambos trabajo pero es necesario para poder cubrir los gastos de la casa ya que la canasta básica ah incrementado y su salario es el mínimo. . Su mejora será la construcción de un muro para reguardar  su propiedad. 
Comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y poder hacer el comienzo del muro. Sus planes es lograr aumentar las ventas de colchones y con estas ganancias aumentar la producción del negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Manuela is 54 years old and the mother of four children. She works as a cook for the national police and also helps sell mattresses at a business managed by her husband. For several years, Manuela built up her own savings and took advantage of loans provided by AFODENIC. Even though it is not easy to manage both jobs, Manuela believes it is necessary so that she can cover her household expenses and food costs on her minimal salary.

She plans to build a wall in order to protect her property. Manuela will buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, and iron so that the work can begin. Her plans include increasing her mattress sales and reinvesting the earnings to boost production of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials needed to build a security wall

loans.name: Maria Filibertina

texts.es: La socia Filiberta A. tiene 39 años de edad, esta casado con Noe Lorenzo tiene 2 hijos, su negocio es una tienda de consumo diario tambien tiene crianza de pollos, cerdos y tambien tiene una venta de zapatos americanos. Solicita el credito para la compra de mas zapatos americanos y colocar una venta de clavos, tornillos, tachuelas, etc. poner una mini ferreteria. Sueña con poner una gran ferreteria pues dice que todas las metas que se a propuesto las ha alcanzado con la ayuda de Dios.
texts.en:
Filiberta A. is 39 years old and the mother of two children. She is married to Noe Lorenzo. Her business involves managing a store that sells daily consumer products and raising chickens and pigs. In addition, she sells American shoes. Filiberta is requesting a loan in order to buy more American shoes as well as nails, screws, tacks, and other items so that she can open a small hardware store. She dreams of having a large hardware store, but says that all of her proposed goals can only be achieved with the help of God.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase American shoes to sell & various items to open a hardware store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase merchandise & an industrial machine

loans.name: Las Orquidias Flat Group

texts.es: EN LA COMUNIDAD  DE JALOXTOC SE FORMO UN GRUPO DE 5 INTEGRANTES, MUJERES TODAS, LAS CUALES, EXPRESARON LA NECESIDAD QUE TENIAN POR OBTENER UN CREDITO LA SRA.MA.GUDALUPE F. C. SE DEDICA ALA VENTA DE  POLLO MUERTO X KILO, LA SRA.ANA MARIA R. G. VENDE ANTOJITOS, LA SRA.ROSALINA T. T. VENDE COSMÉTICOS, LA SRA.DOLORES B. V. SE DEDICA ALA VENTA DE COSMETICOS, Y LA SRA.ELVIA M. T. QUIERE INICIAR EL NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE ROPA, TODAS ELLAS SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO MINORISTA Y CON EL  CREDITO QUIEREN SURTIR Y AGRANDAR SU NEGOCIO EL GRUPO SE LLAMA: LAS ORQUIDEAS LE PUSIERON ESE NOMBRE POR QUE SE IDENTIFICAN CON LAS FLORES, POR QUE SON MUJERES FRAGILES PERO TRABAJADORAS, LA SRAGUADALUPE F. C. ES LA REPRESENTE DEL GRUPO, ELLA VIVE EN UNION LIBRE, TIENE 3 HIJOS QUE LLEVAN POR NOMBRE:JAIR VAZQUEZ F. DE 8 AÑOS, JONATHAN VAZQUEZ F. DE 15 AÑOS,CINTHLI VAZQUEZ F. DE 17 AÑOS, SU HIJA ES LA QUE LE AYUDA EN EL NEGOCIO YA QUE COMO SE TRATA DE DESTAZAR EL POLLO PARA VENDERLO POR KILO ES ALGO LABORIOSO PARA SUS HERMANOS, YA LLEVA 6 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA CON EL NEGOCIÓ, TIENE MUCHOS CLIENTES YE L CARÁCTER PARA ATENDERLOS ES MUY BUENO ES IMPORTANTE MENCIONAR QUE ELLA ES UNA PERSONA MUY CONCIENTE DE LA SITUACION EN LA QUE ESTAMOS LOS MEXICANOS EN ESTE TIEMPO YA  QUE EL PRECIO QUE ELLA MANEJA CON EL PRODUCTO ES UNO DE LOS MEJORES DE LA COMUNIDAD.AGRADECIMIENTO:GRACIAS POR CONFIAR EN NOSOTRAS POR DARNOS LA OPORTUNIDAD APOYARNOS CON UN CREDITO EL CUAL NOS SIRVE PARA HACER CRECER NUESTRO NEGOCIO O INICIAR ALGUNO, POR EL INTERES QUE TIENE DE QUE SALGAMOS ADELANTE COMO MUJERES PRODUCTIVAS  POR QUE NO CUALQUIER PERSONA TIENE LA OPORTUNIDAD DE CONOCER ALA  FUNDACION REALIDAD, A.C.
texts.en:
In the community of Jaloxtoc, a group of five members (all women) expressed their need to obtain a loan. Sra. Maria Guadalupe F. C. sells butchered chickens by the kilo. Sra. Ana Maria R. G. sells snacks. Sra. Rosalina T. T. sells cosmetics. Sra. Dolores B. V. also sells cosmetics. Sra. Elvia M. T. wants to start a business selling clothing. All of these women are dedicated to their work and will use this loan to restock and expand their small businesses.

The group is called “Las Orquideas” (The Orchids) because they wanted a name that is identified with flowers because they consider themselves fragile, even though they are hardworking women. Sra. Guadalupe F. C. is the group leader. She is in a common law marriage and has three children: Jair Vazquez F. (age 8), Jonathan Vazquez F. (age 15), and Cinthli Vazquez F. (age 17). Her daughter helps with the business and is learning how to butcher the chickens. The other children keep busy by helping to sell the chickens by the kilo. Guadalupe has six years of experience in this business. She has many customers and has the personality required to serve her customers well. It is important to mention that Guadalupe is someone who is very conscious about the situation many Mexicans face during this time. Therefore, she manages to sell her products at some of the best prices offered in the community.

The group expresses their thanks for the trust and support placed in them by providing this opportunity. This loan will be used to start or grow their businesses. Anyone who is interested in seeing productive women succeed should have the chance to get to know Fundación Realidad, A.C.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: Progresando Group

texts.es:
“El banco comunal Progresando D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas D. la  Asociación Arariwa es nuevo en su funcionamiento”.

Silberia nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Progresando”  somos 10 integrantes (9 mujeres y 1 varón),  está en el primer ciclo y la junta directiva está conformada por Edith que es la presidenta, Eva que es la Tesorera,  Doris que  es la secretaria y Wilfredo que es el fiscal. Las reuniones  son cada treinta días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa seD. Cusco y en esta oportunidad  me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio D. mi principal actividad económica.  

Silberia, tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos.

Silberia su principal actividad económica es brindar servicios D. cosmetología en el mercado el “Molino II” y se llama “Luyemi”. Antes, ella se dedica al negocio del turismo pero le fue regular. Silberia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que requiere el crédito para comprar una secadora D. cabello.   

La mayoría D. los socios son comerciantes por ejemplo algunos se dedican a la  venta D. comida, productos D. belleza,  ropa, pasto (comida para animales), cuyes y otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo son carpintero, guía D. turismo, cosmetología, etc.
texts.en:
The “Progresando” (Progressing) Communal Bank is a microfinance unit of Asociación Arariwa. This is a new group that just started operation.

Silberia says her Communal Bank consists of 10 members (9 women and 1 man). This is the group’s first loan and the board of directors consists of Edith who serves as president, Eva who serves as treasurer, Doris who serves as secretary, and Wilfredo who serves as auditor. Their meetings are held every thirty days at the central office of Asociación Arariwa, which is headquartered in Cusco. Silberia was provided the opportunity to represent her Communal Bank by giving her testimony about her main business activity. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children. Silberia provides cosmetology services from a salon called “Luyemi” in the Molino II Market. She previously worked at a travel business but found the work monotonous. Silberia is an enterprising and hardworking woman who needs a loan to buy a hair dryer.

Most of the members are merchants who sell food, beauty products, clothing, animal feed, guinea pigs, and provides services such as carpentry, guided tours, beauty consulting, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a hair dryer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase hogs for butchering & animal feed

loans.name: Durabank Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Durabank”, actualmente se encuentra en el X ciclo y está conformado por 16 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas de la unidad de micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa sede Cusco.       

Las actividades económicas de los algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo a las ventas de joyería, venta de colocaciones de vidrio templado, venta de aves de corral, etc. y otros socios brindan servicios que están ligados al transportes terrestre como por ejemplo atención al cliente, lavado de buses, administración de agencia de viajes terrestres, auxiliar contable,  mecánico automotriz, llamadas de celulares, limpieza del hogar y lavado de ropa. 

Belén tiene 42 años y su principal actividad económica se dedica a la venta de boletos turísticos. Hace 14 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Su actividad económica complementaria es vender cosméticos. 

Ya son 3 años que Belén participa en el banco comunal y le ha va muy bien gracias a su puntualidad y responsabilidad. Belén requiere el crédito para comprar más cosméticos. 
 	
Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

(Los socios Walter, Mariela y Gabina aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía, ellos se fueron rápido el día del desembolso y se les tomo la foto en otra reunión).
texts.en:
The Communal Bank named “Durabank” is currently in its tenth loan cycle and consists of 16 hardworking and enterprising members who look at each moment as an opportunity to get ahead and provide a better future for their children. The members meet every thirty days at the offices of the microfinance division of Asociación Arariwa, which has its headquarters in Cusco. Some of the members’ business activities include selling jewelry, tempered glass, poultry, and other items. Other members provide services directly related to the land transportation industry that include attending customers, washing buses, making travel arrangements, accounting, automotive repair, mobile phone service, housekeeping, and laundry. Belén is 42 years old and earns a living selling tour tickets. She has been in this business for 14 years and has done very well. Belén also has a side business selling cosmetics. She has been a member of her Communal Bank for three years and has performed well due to her punctuality and responsibility. Belén needs a loan to buy more cosmetics. Cusco is a city that is known for its archaeological sites, historical center, and landscapes, making it one of the most charming cities in southern Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose Antonio es un joven de 22 años de edad es soltero, actualmente vive con su abuela en San Martin Jil. y para que no lo mantenga su abuela instalo un negocio que es venta de celulares, computadoras, discos duros, CDS, el esta graduado a nivel medio de Perito Contador tambien realiza tramites contables. El credito que solicita es para comprar repuestos de computadoras. Es un negocio rentable le va muy bien ya que tiene clientes que lo solicitan para que les brinde sus servicios. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y poder vender computadoras de todas marcas, para llegar a ser un empresario de exito reconocido por la comunidad y poder ayudar a su abuela.
texts.en:
Jose Antonio is a young man who is 22 years of age, single, and currently lives with his grandmother in San Martin Jilotepeque. In order to support his grandmother, he established a business selling mobile phones, computers, hard drives, and CDs. Jose Antonio graduated as a certified accountant and also performs accounting paperwork.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy computer parts. His business is profitable and doing very well because he has customers who request his services. Jose Antonio dreams of growing his business and selling all brands of computers so that he can become a successful well-known entrepreneur in the community and continue to support his grandmother.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase three computers, accessories, and parts

loans.name: Carlos Demetrio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es la  Sr. DEMETRIO,  ella tiene 49 años de edad, es separado y tiene 4 menores hijos, Nuestro socio alterna su trabajo con el comercio minorista, el se dedica a la docencia, él es profesor nombrado, el también es agricultor y ganadero en ancahuasi; Nuestro socio tiene terrenos de cultivo en su tierra natal y ahora el requiere el préstamo para poder comprar las semillas y abono.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Demetrio is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción” (Virgin of the Immaculate Conception). He lives in the District and Province of Anta, Department of Cusco.

Demetrio is 49 years old, separated from his spouse, and has four young children. He divides his time between his job and his small business. Demetrio works as a teacher and is a well-known professor. In addition, he is a farmer and livestock breeder in Ancahuasi. He owns farmland in his hometown and now needs a loan to buy seeds and compost.

Demetrio appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, he commits to submitting his loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & compost

loans.name: Jean Carlos

texts.es: Jean Carlos P. S., tiene la edad de 25 años, está en unión libre, tiene 3 hijos de 4,2 años y otro de 2 meses, los son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la siembra y la compra de insumos para el desarrollo del cultivo de tiquisque. La idea es  darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de tiquisque, para que cuando estén listos para cosechar los puedan vender y obtener mayores ganancias. El desea poder asistir el cultivo para lograr un mejor desarrollo del mismo,  y así lograr una mejor producción.Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Jean Carlos tiene varios años de experiencia en la agricultura.El está seguro de que le va a ir muy bien en el nuevo  proyecto.El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Jean Carlos P. S. is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 4, 2, and 2 months) who are his highest priority. This loan will be used to buy supplies for planting and growing “tiquisque” (a tuber crop similar taro root). He plans to adequately maintain his crops so that he can generate better earnings when it is time to harvest and sell his output. Jean Carlos attends to his crops as a means of self-development so that he can improve production. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services that have been provided. Don Jean Carlos has several years of experience in agriculture. He is sure that he will do well in this new project. Jean Carlos hopes in the future to provide his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. In addition, he want to continue growing as a person and a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farm supplies for planting and growing "tiquisque"

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es: Yorleny S. E., tiene la edad de 34 años, está casado, y vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos que son mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para siembra y para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar unas matas de café para sembrar, y además comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Yorleny también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Yorleny S. E. is 34 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children, who are her main priority. She wants the loan to plant and help her farm, specifically in growing coffee. The idea is to buy more coffee bushes to plant, as well as to buy organic and chemical fertilizer. She wants to have good maintainance of the coffee plants in order to have better quality and obtain the best income possible at harvest time. This is the first time that she has had a loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the opportunities they have given her. Yorleny has also worked for several years in agriculture. In the future, she hopes to offer her family a better quality of life and greater financial stability and to be able to keep growing as a person and as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting and assistance with growing coffee

loans.name: Cendy Johanna

texts.es:
Cendy C. de 30 años, vive en una zona periurbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así por su abundancia de la flor orquídeas, calles ya de asfalto y casas de cemento) de Guayaquil. Es soltera y no tiene hijos. 

Cendy trabajaba en una empresa pero por la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio decidió retirarse de esa empresa y empezar a ganar su propio dinero. Aunque tenia miedo de perder todo su dinero continuo con su sueño e invirtió todos sus ahorros en arroz, azúcar y bebidas y construyo en la parte delantera de su casa un local para la tienda.

Cendy ahora trabaja en su tienda desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días en ocasiones sus padres le ayudan en la tienda. Vende legumbres, granos, enlatados, bebidas, etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar legumbres, bebidas y arroz para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de su tienda.
texts.en:
Cendy C. is 30 years old. She lives in Orquídeas (called this due to its abundance of orchids, asphalt streets and cement houses), on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She is single and has no children. Cendy worked in a business but out of desperation to have her own business, she decided to leave that business and start to make her own money. Although she was afraid of losing al her money, she continued with the dream and invested all of her savings in rice, sugar and beverages and built a place for her store in the front of her house. Cendy now works in her store from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. every day. On occasion, her parents help her in the store. She sells vegetables, grains, canned goods, beverages, etc. With the loan, she wants to buy vegetables, beverages, and rice for her store. In the future, she wants to have more stores.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beverages, vegetables, rice

loans.name: Solidario Mil Flores Group

texts.es:
El grupo Solidario Mil Flores está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas provenientes de Pochocuape, comarca rural de Managua. Este lugar cuenta con precarias condiciones de acceso donde su ingreso se da solo por caponeras y con las lluvias se ha deteriorado notablemente la vía de transito.

La coordinadora del grupo es  Gioconda del Carmen A. Zabala quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos y ropa desde hace tres años. Ella inició con este negocio con el fin de contar  con mayores ingresos en el hogar y sacar adelante a sus dos hijos junto con su esposo Ernesto Antonio Zelaya policía de tránsito.
A. invertirá en perfumes, cremas new, cremas rejuvenecedoras, colonias noir, camisas de damas y pantalones que son los productos donde tiene mayor demanda.

Sus compañeras de grupo son  Claudia Marcela A. T.  quien en 1998 inicio a realizar comales,  pailas, cazuelas etc. y Sonia del Carmen T. Z. quien tiene un pequeña venta y kiosco en el colegio Rey David quien invertirá en tajadas, mentas, gaseosas, bombones, meneítos, bananos, jocote etc.
texts.en:
The support group Mil Flores is made up of three hard working, dedicated and decisive women from Pochocuape, a rural area of Managua. The area has precarious access conditions and can only be reached by motorcycle taxi. With the rains, the road has deteriorated notably. The group coordinator is Gioconda del Carmen A. Zabala, who has sold cosmetics and clothing for three years. She began this business with the purpose of having more income and getting ahead with her two children and her husband Ernesto Antonio Zelaya, who is a traffic police officer. A. will invest in perfume, New cream, Noir cologne, revitalizing creams, and women's shirts and pants. These are her products that have the highest demand. The other group members are Claudia Marcela A. T., who in 1998 began making griddles, buckets, pots, etc., and Sonia del Carmen T. Z. who has a small kiosk in the Rey David high school. She will invest in baked goods, mints, sodas, candies, chips, bananas, jocote fruit, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In the purchase of perfumes, New cream, Noir cologne, revitalizing creams, and women's shirts and pants.

loans.name: Almohada Group

texts.es:
El grupo Almohada está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y decididas provenientes del barrio Camilo Ortega que se encuentra ubicado en la zona sur de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es Nora B. quien en 1990  empieza a realizar y comercializar donas y platanitos los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Darxnia Leticia H. H. quien desde hace un año tiene una pequeña venta en la que invertira con la  compra de frijoles, papel higiénico, pan, arroz, huevos, gaseosa etc.  y Lesbia Raquel Dávila A. quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos e invertirá en las líneas  Fareway, Ismari, Dulce Honestidad.
texts.en:
The Almohada group consists of three hard-working, enterprising, and determined women from the Camilo Ortega district located in the southern region of Managua. The coordinator of the group is Nora B., who in 1990 began to create and sell doughnuts and chips that she sells as a street vendor. Her group companions are Darxnia Leticia H. H. who for a year has had a small sales business; she will purchase beans, tissue paper, bread, rice, eggs, soft drinks, etc.; and Lesbia Raquel Dávila A. who sells cosmetics and will invest in Fareway, Ismari, and Dulce Honestidad products.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of business stock

loans.name: Armonia Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Armonía II está integrado por Martha Lorena Dávila Rodríguez, Delia Argentina Pérez,  Alfredo Mauricio R. Dolmo  personas  trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes del barrio Camilo Ortega.  La coordinadora del grupo es Martha Lorena Dávila Rodríguez quien es vendedora ambulante de pozol y tiste bebidas tradicionales a base  de maíz y cacao, además comercializar chatarra en lo cual invertirá el crédito. 

Mientras Delia Argentina Pérez es dueña de una pequeña venta y vende tortillas y frijoles cocidos. Actualmente con el crédito compra productos como huevos, café presto, quintal de arroz, azúcar y frijoles. 
 Don Alfredo Mauricio R. se dedica al comercio de nacatamales comida típica a base de maíz, cerdo, arroz, cebolla y chiltoma los cuales comercializa los fines de semana. Además los domingos realiza sopas de hueso, de mondongo, de queso, de albóndigas, de cola, de res y de pescado entre otras.
texts.en:
The Harmony II Group consists of Martha Lorena Dávila Rodríguez, Delia Argentina Pérez, Alfredo Mauricio R. Dolmo, hard-working, ambitious, and enterprising persons from the Camilo Ortega district. The group coordinator is Martha Lorena Dávila Rodríguez who is a street vendor of pozol and tiste, traditional beverages based on corn and cocoa, as well as fast food, in which she will invest her loan. Delia Argentina Pérez, meanwhile, is the owner of a small business selling cooked tortillas and beans. Currently, with this loan, she will purchase products such as eggs, instant coffee, a sack of rice, sugar, and beans. Don Alfredo Mauricio R. sells nacatamales, a regional meal based on corn, pork, rice, onion and sweet peppers, which he sells on weekends. On Sundays he also makes soups of bones, tripe, cheese, meatballs, oxtail, beef, and fish among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business stock

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Gueraline is the coordinator of her group Mujeres en Progreso 1, 2 (Women in Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally — many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty, industrial area north of the capital, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She lives in a simple, rented structure with her husband and child.

Gueraline is excited to be taking out her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling underwear, creams, and detergents as well as other products by purchasing more goods in the main market and then reselling them in her community at a profit. She will use her profits to purchase medications and save towards having her own home and vehicle. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: increasing her inventory

loans.name: Reyna Group

texts.es:
El grupo Reyna está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Sandra Lourdes Peralda C. quien desde 1989 comercializa ropa en el Mercado Oriental de manera ambulante. Ella con el préstamo comprara pantalones de vestir, bluyins, faldas, camisas y blusas en grandes cantidades.

Mientras Martha Lorena V. otra de las integrantes quien desde hace 20 años se dedica al comercio de cosméticos y ropa variada  invertirá en blusas, sandalias, trajes de niños y pantalones. Y Auxiliadora del Rosario Palacio  vende nacatamales, cosméticos y ropa en cuyos negocios invertirá el crédito con la compra de ingredientes para los nacatamales (maíz, cerdo, arroz, papa, especie), body, perfumes, blusas, pantalones etc.
texts.en:
The Reyna Group consists of three hard-working, ambitious, and enterprising women. Sandra Lourdes Peralda C. has sold clothing as a street vendor in the Eastern Market since 1989. With this loan she will purchase trousers, jeans, skirts, shirts, and blouses in large quantities. Martha Lorena V., another of the members, has sold cosmetics and various clothing for 20 years; she will invest in blouses, sandals, children's outfits, and pants. The assistant at the Rosario Palace sells nacatamales (a regional food), cosmetics and clothing; she will invest this loan in ingredients for the nacatamales (corn, pork, sugar, potatoes, and such), bodysuits, perfumes, blouses, pants, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of business stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Valor Y Sacrificio Community Lending Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL VALOR Y SACRIFICIO

Hilaria es una D. las doce socias D. L. alcancia comunal VALOR Y SACRIFICIO, que ya tiene trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por casi 3 años, tiempo en el cual las socias han completado algunos D. sus planes y proyectos.
HIlaria tiene 42 años D. edad y es madre D. 2 hijos que ya son independientes, elL. trabaja en L. venta D. artesanias, las cuales distribuye desD. su casa, tambien esta aprendiendo sobre L. elaboración D. estas en todas su variedades posibles, para que elL. misma las elabore, y así tenga más ingresos.
ElL. comenzó haciendo tejidos D. lana, como chompas, gorros, guantes, etc.
ElL. plantea aprender mas sobre artesanias, tambien espera algun día tener una tienda.
El prestamo actual lo usara para comprar mas artesanias para venderlos.
Su más granD. sueño es tener una tienda propia y un mototaxi para alquilarlas.
texts.en:
Valor y Sacrificio Communal Bank Hilaria is one of the 12 members of the Valor y Sacrificio (“Courage and Sacrifice”) Communal Bank, which has already been working with EDAPROSPRO-PROSPERIDAD for almost 3 years. In this time, the members have completed several of their plans and projects. At 42 years old, Hilaria is the mother of two children who are already independent. She works selling artisanal products, which she distributes from her home. She is also learning about the production of these crafts in all their possible varieties so that she herself can create them and increase her profit margins. She began making woven wool products such as sweaters, hats, gloves, etc. Hoping one day to have a store, she plans to learn more about artisanal work and use the current loan to buy artisanal crafts to sell. Her biggest dream is to have and rent out her own store and a mototaxi.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment of capital in work

loans.name: Unidas Para El Futuro 4 Group

texts.en:
Elipadia is the coordinator of her group Unidas para el Futuro (United for the Future), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally — many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the slums north of the capital, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She in a simple structure as a single mother with her three children.

Epiladia is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza to invest in her business, which sells silver jewelry, by purchasing more anklets, bracelets, rings and necklaces. She will use the profits to save towards owning her own home and helping her daughters. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Silver jewelry to sell

loans.name: 25 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Constantina C. es integrante de la Asociación Comunal 25 de Diciembre, ella tiene 41 años y es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto hace aproximadamente 2 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida hace 14 años y con  el tiempo ha ido perfeccionanado sus habilidades culinarias. Constancia necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos como la papa, arroz y fideo.

Las demás integrantes de esta Asociación tienen diversos negocios como  la venta de arroz, tejido de prendas de vestir, venta de alimento seco, venta de fruta y atención de tienda de barrio. Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Constantina C. is a member of the community association "25 de Diciembre". She is 41 years old and has lived close to the city of El Alto for approximately 2 years. She has sold food over the last 14 years and with the passing of time has perfected her culinary skills. Constancia needs this loan to buy food supplies such as potatoes, rice and pasta. The other members of the association run different businesses, attending to customers and selling rice, dry foods and fabric for items of clothing. Each of the members needs the loan to invest in their business.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food supplies

loans.name: Nellys Aidee

texts.es:
Nellys P. de 48 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así por su abundancia de la flor orquídeas, calles ya de asfalto y casas de cemento) de Guayaquil. Ella tiene tres hijos de 19, 16 y 14 años de edad. 

Ella tenida un pequeño local de caña en la parte delantera de su casa, empezó vendiendo confites y bebidas. Poco a poco termino de arreglar el local y lo construyo de cemento. Pero como necesitaba mas ingresos decidió invertir sus ahorros en algunos cuadernos y lápices.

Por esa buena decisión ahora tiene una papelería afuera de su casa, trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00 todos los días. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y papelería para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere permanecer con su negocio y ampliarlo con otras sucursales, y que sus hijos terminen de los estudios.
texts.en:
Nellys P. is 48 years old and lives in an urban area of Guayaquil called Orquídeas, which is named for its abundance of orchids, its now asphalt streets and cement houses. She has three children who are 19, 16 and 14 years of age. Nellys runs a small store selling sugar cane out the back of her house. She started out by selling sweets and drinks, and bit by bit she finished working on the store and built it out of cement. Since she also needed more income, Nellys decided to invest her savings in some exercise books and pencils. It was this good decision that led her to set up a stationery store outside her house, where she works from 7am to 8pm every day. With this loan she would like to buy exercise books, pens and stationery for her business. In the future she would like to maintain her business and set up other branches, and she hopes that her children will finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Exercise books, pens, paper

loans.name: Caminando Con Jesus 1 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group Caminando Con Jesus (Walking with Jesus), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Santiago, a large city known for its production of tobacco, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Ana makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children.

Ana is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business hawking clothing around her neighborhood by purchasing more merchandise. She will use the profits to save towards her goals of putting her business in its own locale and purchasing a vehicle to move her merchandise, developments that will make her life a lot simpler. Ana thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Panamá Group

texts.es:
El grupo Panamá está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Melba Alicia Obregon quien desde hace seis años instalo una pequeña farmacia la cual con el crédito piensa invertir en diferentes productos de gran demanda.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Linda Ruth Márquez García quien tiene un negocio variado desde ropa, cosméticos, plásticos etc. y Janeth Esmeralda quien es propietaria de una pulpería la cual piensa surtir con el crédito.
texts.en:
The Panamá group is comprised of three hard-working women. One of them is Melba Alicia Obregon. She set up a small pharmacy six years ago. She plans to use the loan to invest in different products that are in great demand. Her colleague in the group, Linda Ruth Márquez García, has a business selling various items like clothes and plastics, etc. Her other colleague, Janeth Esmeralda, is the proprietor of a mini-market. She plans to stock her store with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medicine

loans.name: Juan Orlando

texts.es: Juan Orlando P. C., tiene la edad de 58 años, está casado, y tiene 8 hijos que son su mayor prioridad.  El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea aumentar el número de animales en su finca. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Don Juan trabaja desde hace varios años con el ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Juan Orlando P. C. is 58 years old. He is married and has eight children, who are his greatest priority. He wants the loan to buy livestock in order to increase the number of animals on his farm. He wants to adequately take care of the livestock in order to get the best income possible when he sells them. This is not his first loan with Fudescosur. He is very happy with the terms of the loan that they have always offered him. Juan has worked with livestock for several years. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability. He also hopes to be able to keep growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock

loans.name: Cristo La Solucion 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Santiago is the coordinator of his group Cristo La Solucion (Christ is the Solution), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his wife and three children.

Santiago is excited to be taking his fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business selling medication by purchasing more merchandise to sell in his small pharmacy. He will use the profits to cover the basic needs of his family as well as save towards purchasing a vehicle for the pharmacy so that he can make deliveries and retrieve orders. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase medicine to sell in the pharmacy

loans.name: Las Gardeñas, Barrio Santa Ana Group

texts.es: Doña Fidelia P. T. de cincuenta y cinco años de edad originaria del Paraje Chonimatux del Barrio Santa Ana, Momostenango, Actualmente ella se dedica ala fabricacion de calzado, a travez de su trabajo ella a superado y con el cual ella mantiene a su familia, por tal motivo a ella le surgio la idea de formar un grupo, el cual pudo formar el grupo de catorce integrantes que desde hace diez años se vienen conociendo y que son de la misma comunidad, cada una de ellas desempeña diferentes trabajos tales como, venta de alimentos, venta de medicamentos, venta de ropa, por tal motivo ella se acercaron a la oficina de la Asociacion Asdir Pologua Momostenango, para solicitar un credito para poder ampliar su capital.
texts.en:
Fidelia P. T., age 55, is from the Santa Ana neighborhood in Chonimatux, Momostenango. She currently makes footwear. Through her work she has succeeded and supports her family. With this in mind, she got the idea to form a group. She was able to form a group of 14 members. They have known each other for ten years, and they are from the same community. Each one of them works at different activities like selling food, selling medicine, or selling clothes. They went to the Asociacion Asdir Pologua Momostenango to ask for a loan to be able to increase their capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mujeres De Bella Vista B. Patzite Group

texts.es: Doña, Leocadia Marcelina A. I. de treinta y ocho años de edad, originaria del Paraje Bella Vista del Barrio Patzite Momostenango, actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de comida ya que mencionado trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace mucho tiempo tanto ella como sus hijos realizan este trabajo el cual ella a superado y logrado pagar la educacion, alimentacion y medicina a sus hijos, por lo tanto a ella le surgio la idea de formar un grupo de mujeres para que ellas puedan superar como ella lo a hecho el cual logro formar un grupo de diez señoras que desde hace doce años se vienen conociendo, mencionadas señoras se dedican a diferentes trabajos como: venta de pasteles, venta de refacciones, venta de consumo diario, todas ellas se acercaron a la oficina de la Agencia ASDIR Pologua Momostenango, Solicitando un Credito para ampliar el capital de sus negocios.
texts.en:
Leocadia Marcelina A. I., 38, is a native of the Paraje Bella Vista community of the Patzite neighborhood of Momostenango. She is currently engaged in the business of selling food. She mentions that she has been doing this kind of work for a long time. She and her children carry out this work, in which she has succeeded. As a result she has managed to pay for the education of her children, as well as for their food and medicines. She had the idea of creating this group of women, so that they could succeed like she did. She managed to get 10 women to join 12 years ago, and they have come to know each other. These women perform a variety of occupations, such as: selling pastries, selling spare parts, and selling grocery items. They have approached the office of Agencia ASDIR in Pologua, Momostenango, requesting a loan to expand the capital of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Del Cusco Group

texts.es:
“El banco comunal Virgen del Rosario del Cusco D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas D. la  Asociación Arariwa está en el ciclo 12 D. funcionamiento”.

Felicia nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”  somos 13 integrantes (12 mujeres y 1 varón). Las reuniones  son cada treinta días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa seD. Cusco y en esta oportunidad  me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio D. mi principal actividad económica.  

Felicia, tiene 47 años, es viuda, tiene dos hijos y su principal actividad económica es vender comida en el paradero final D. los expresos “Columbia” en la calle los Incas D. la ciudad del Cusco. Ella venD. desayuno D. forma ambulatoria desD. hace 26 años y se levanta  a las 4 D. mañana para preparar el desayuno y sale a vender D. 7 a 10 D. la mañana. Su actividad económica complementaria es vender productos D. belleza.   Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos D. belleza para mujer como por ejemplo aretes, perfumes, colonias, collares, lápiz labial, etc.     

La mayoría D. los socios son comerciantes por ejemplo algunos se dedican a la  venta D. comida, anticuchos, tejidos y bordados, comestibles,  joyería y otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo D. chofer D. taxi y empleados. 
	
Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país.
texts.en:
Felicia tells us, “We have 13 members (12 women and 1 man) in our communal bank, Virgen del Rosario del Cusco. Our meetings are every 30 days in the central office of the Asociació Arariwa headquarters in Cusco. They elected me to represent the communal bank in order to tell about my main economic activity.” Felicia, age 47, is a widow with two children. Her main economic activity is selling food at the final stop of the Columbia express train. It is on Los Incas Street in the city of Cusco. She has been selling breakfast as a street vendor for 26 years. She gets up at four in the morning to prepare the breakfast, and she leave to sell from seven to ten in the morning. Her supplemental economic activity is selling beauty products. She needs the loan to buy more women’s beauty products like earrings, perfume, cologne, necklaces, and lipstick, etc. Most of the members are merchants. For example some of them sell food, kebabs, weavings and embroidery, groceries, and jewelry. Other members offer services such as taxi drivers or work as employees. Cusco is a city characterized by its archeological centers, its historical center, its scenery, and its history. It is an enchanting city in the southern region of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Felicia needs the loan to buy more beauty products

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. FELICITAS,  ella tiene 38 años de edad, es casaca y tiene  1 hijo, Nuestra socia alterna su trabajo con el comercio minorista, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y como cuyes, chanchos, aves de corral,  y a la agricultura, nuestra socia tiene su terreno en el cual cultiva maíz, papa, hortalizas; la socia vende lo que cosecha y a sus animales menores también, ella desea el préstamo para aumentar la producción de animales menores.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicita belongs to the Virgen Inmaculada Concepción (Virgin of the Immaculate Conception) Communal Bank and lives in the district of Anta, in Anta province, Cusco department. Felicita is 38 years old, married, and has one child. She alternates between retail commerce and raising farm animals, including guinea pigs, hogs, and chickens, and agriculture. On her land she cultivates corn, potatoes, and vegetables. Felicita sells what she harvests as well as her animals. She requests a loan to increase animal production. Felicita is grateful for and values the help offered by this means and promises to comply with the repayment of her debt in the time established.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INCREASING PRODUCTION OF THE FARM ANIMALS SHE SELLS

loans.name: Patron San Jeronimo Ii Group

texts.es:
“El banco comunal Patrón San Jerónimo II de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la  Asociación Arariwa está en el ciclo 10 de funcionamiento".

Sofía nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Patrón San Jerónimo II” somos 13 integrantes (10 mujeres y 3 varones). Las reuniones son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa sede Cusco y en esta oportunidad  me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi principal actividad económica. "El banco comunal es bueno porque me ayudan a ahorrar dinero y me dan charlas de gestión financiera”.

Sofía, tiene 45 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos (Mariela de 22 años y Vanesa de 19 años), su esposo es chofer de la línea de carros “Nueva Chaska”  y Sofía trabaja como cobradora  de pasajes en el carro. Su actividad económica complementaria es cosechar y sembrar maíz. Ya son 22 años que se dedica a los negocios y le va muy bien.  Ella requiere para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.  Su sueño es sacar profesional a su segunda hija  y construir  su casa de material noble.   

La mayoría de los socios son comerciantes por ejemplo algunos se dedican a las ventas de comestible, panes, cosméticos, ropa, golosinas, anticuchos, queso, tarjetas y otros socios brindan servicios  de transportes, mecánica, cocina y guía de turismo.  
	
Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.
texts.en:
“Asociación Arariwa’s Micro Finances Unit’s Patrón San Jerónimo II communal bank is in its 10th operational cycle” Sofía tells us: In my “Patrón San Jerónimo II” communal bank we are 13 members (10 women and 3 men). The meetings take place every 30 days in Asociación Arariwa’s central offices, Cusco branch. On this occasion I was elected communal bank representative to give my testimony regarding my main commercial activity. “The communal bank is good because they help me save money and they give financial operations chats.” Sofía, 45, is married and has two children (Mariela, 22, and Vanesa, 19). Her husband is a driver for the “Nueva Chaska” transportation company and Sofía works as his fare collector. Her complementary commercial activity is corn farming. She has been in these lines of work for 22 years now and she does well. She wants to buy seed and fertilizers. Her dream is to see her second daughter become a professional and to build her house with substantial materials. Most of the other group members are merchants. For example: they sell food, bread, cosmetics, clothing, sweets, anticuchos (skewered grilled meats), cheese, cards; some members provide transportation, auto mechanic, and cooking and tourism guide services. Cusco is a city that is known for its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery and its history; it is an enchanting city in the south of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras R. De Teja Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del Banco Comunal de la Aldea Rancho de Teja del municipio de San Francisco el Alto, del departamento de Totonicapán, están conformados por MUJERES todas se conocen bien desde hace más de veinte años, este grupo está conformado por once integrantes,  mujeres que se dedican en diferentes funciones como crianza de animales, confección de ropa, venta de canastillas.

Las integrantes del grupo decidieron solicitar un crédito en ASDIR para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia ya que estas personas son de escasos recursos y es de gran ayuda para ellas ampliar su capital de negocio y mejoras sus ventas como también sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The women of "Aldea Rancho de Teja" (Village of Rancho de Teja) Village Bank, in San Francisco el Alto, Department of Totonicapán, have all known each other well for more than twenty years. The group consists of eleven members, women engaged in a variety of businesses, including raising animals, making clothing, and selling small baskets. The members decided to seek a loan with ASDIR in order to improve quality of life for themselves and their families. They are people of meager resources and it's immensely helpful for them to grow their working capital, improve their sales, and increase their incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva L. Vda. D. H. D. 58 años D. edad se dedica a la elaboración D. pan, negocio el cual se encuentra ubicado en el municipio D. Nueva San Salvador, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus tres hijos, dos menores D. edad, los cuales estudian educación básica y la mayor que se dedica a estudiar en la universidad. Genova se ha ganado la vida D. esta manera durante 30 años, oficio el cual aprendió D. su madre, la cual también poseía una panadería, y a lo cual Genova se dedica desD. joven ya que ayudaba a su madre, en la actualidad este negocio le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos, los cuales han dependido por completo D. ella a lo largo D. todas sus vidas, ya que Genova es madre soltera. Ella es una mujer que cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos, ya que es muy trabajadora y luchadora, así mismo una madre muy responsable, la cual su prioridad son sus hijos. Genova solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina llamada harina fuerte y también harina suave, las cuales le permiten elaborar diferentes tipos D. pan, D. esta manera ella podrá aumentar su producción y percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Genoveva L. Vda. D. Hernandez, 58, operates a business making and selling bread, a business she operates in the town of Nueva San Salvador in La Libertad. She lives in the town with her three children, the two youngest of whom are in primary school and the oldest in college. Genova has maD. a living making and selling bread, a skill she learned from her mother, for 30 years. Her mother operated a bakery shop and Genova started helping her with the business when she was just a girl. Owning her own business has allowed her to help her 3 children get ahead in the world. Genova is a single mother and has been the sole provider of her children for all of their lives. She is well regarded among her neighbors because she works hard and strives to get ahead. She is also a devoted mother and her children are her first priority. Genova is applying for a loan so that she can buy flour, both so-called strong flour and mild flour, and, in turn, make different kinds of bread. She wants to increase her production and her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for bakery business.

location.town: Nueva San Salvador, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana Isabel B. D. F. D. 33 años D. edad, posee una tienda en la cual venD. productos alimenticios como cereales, comida enlatada y otros productos más los cuales son D. primera necesidad, así  mismo posee una venta D. platillos típicos como yuca frita, tamales, enchiladas y otros más, la cual coloca cada tarD. a las afueras D. su casa. Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual se dedica por completo a atender su negocio y a cuidar a sus tres hijos D. 12, 8 y 5 años D. edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar, ella cuenta con la ventaja que la tienda este ubicada en su casa D. habitación en el departamento D. San Miguel.  Ana solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo D. poder comprar mayor cantidad D. productos y D. esta manera surtir la tienda lo más posible, ya que D. esta forma ella podrá atender a más clientela, así mismo para poder comprar materia prima para los platillos típicos que elabora. Todo eso lo hace ya que espera mejorar su economía familiar y así brindarles un mejor futuro a todos.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel B. D. F., 33, owns a shop where she sells cereals, dairy products and other everyday supplies. She also sells typical dishes such as fried yucca, tamales, enchiladas and so on, dishes that she sells from her house. Ana works hard, tending her store and caring for her three chidren, 12-, 8- and 5-years old, all of whom are in schoool. She is lucky that her store is located in her house in the "departamento" of San Miguel. Ana is applying for a loan because she wants to buy a wider range of products so that she can better stock her store. Offering a wider range of products will allow her to better serve her customers. She also wants to buy basic ingredients for making the prepared dishes she sells. She hopes all of this effort will improve the lives of her children and proviD. them all with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goods for resale.

loans.name: Candelario

texts.es: Candelario G. B. reside en el municipio de Santo Tomás, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja haciendo los quehaceres del hogar. Candelario posee una ferretería la cual esta ubicada sobre la calle principal del centro de Santo Tomas, en donde cuenta con muy buena ubicación, ya que es un lugar que cuenta con gran afluencia de personas. El servicio que Candelario ofrece en muy básico, razón por la cual cuenta con muchos clientes quienes solicitan reproducción de llaves, dar filo a cuchillos para cocina, y así mismo comprar herramientas entre otras cosas más. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con la capacidad económica para comprar herramientas para comercializar, cables, metal y otros más, los cuales le permitan ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Candelario G. B. lives in the town of Santo Tomas in the "departamento" of San Salvador. He lives in a house that he owns with his wife who works in the family home. Candelario owns a hardware business that he operates on the main street of Santo Tomas, a very good location for a business in the town because of the constant traffic on the street. The services that Candelario sells are very basic: making copies of keys, sharpening kitchen knives and supplying tools. He is applying for a loan so that he will have enough money to buy supplies of tools, wiring, metal and other products, supplies that will allow him to provide a wider range of goods to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

location.town: Santo Tomás, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Lucia Santos

texts.es: Lucia Santos G. D. M. D. 40 años D. edad, es una señora muy responsable y trabajadora  la  cual cuenta con muy bueno valores, razón por la que es muy respetada y querida. Vive en la ciudad D. Soyapango junto a su esposo quien trabaja como zapatero, manera a través D. la cual aporta a su hogar, así mismo vive en junto a tres hijos D. 16, 14 y 11 años D. edad, y junto a su suegra quien ayuda con los quehaceres del hogar. Lucia brinda el apoyo financiero necesario a su esposo, a través D. una tienda D. productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, la cual les permite contar con una vida estable, en la cual pueden suplir a sus hijos con muchos esfuerzos D. todo lo necesario. Lucia solicita un préstamo a través del cual le pueda brindar la ayuda necesario a su esposo, ya que las maquinas con las que él repara los zapatos se ha descompuesto, por lo que necesitan contar con el dinero necesario para repararlas, esto es D. mucha urgencia para ellos ya que esta es la única forma en la que él se gana la vida, así mismo Lucia solicita dicho préstamo a Integral con el deseo D. poder surtir más la tienda y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Lucia Santos G. D. M., 40, is a very responsible and hard-working woman who has good values which make her very respected and well-liked. She lives in the city of Soyapango with her husband who supports his family working as a cobbler. They have three children who are 16, 14 and 11 years of age. Her mother-in-law also lives with them and she helps with household chores. Lucia helps her husband support the family with earnings from a small grocery store; this allows them to have a stable life in which they can proviD. their children, though much effort, with all they need. Lucia is asking for funding to help out her husband because the machine he uses to repair shoes is broken and they need funds to repair it; this is urgent because this is his only source of income. Lucia is also asking Integral for funds with which to stock her store so that her profits will be greater.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for shoe repair machine and to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Blanca Delmi

texts.es: Blanca Delmi V. D. M. D. 46 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. Madre soltera D. tres hijos, por los cuales ha luchado durante muchos años para sacarlos adelante y poder brindarles una vida mejor. Blanca posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, negocio el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar y sus hijos, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda  contar con el dinero necesario para equipar su negocio con todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio, ya que en muchas ocasiones se ve obligada a perder a sus clientes, ya que no posee los productos que le solicitan, circunstancias las cuales ella desea poder cambiar, para mejorar y salir adelante con su negocio. Blanca es una señora muy visionaria quien siempre desea salir adelante e ir creciendo día con día por el bienestar D. ella y sus tres hijos, los cuales son la mayor inspiración para ella y la razón D. la solicitud D. dicho préstamo ya que solo D. esta manera podrá mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Blanca Delmi V. D. M., 46, lives in San Salvador department. She is a single mother of three children for whom she has fought for many years to get them ahead and proviD. a better life for them. Blanca has a grocery store in her home which provides for her and her children’s basic needs. She is asking for funding with which to stock her store with the necessary items to proviD. better service because in many occasions she is forced to lose customers because she doesn’t have what they are looking for on hand. She wants to change this circumstance to improve and move her business forward. Blanca is a visionary person who always wants to move ahead and continues to grow daily for her own and her three children’s wellbeing; they are her greatest motivation in life and the reason for this loan request because this is the only way she can improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. JUANA,  ella tiene 49 años de edad, es separada y tiene 1 hijo menor, Nuestra socia alterna su trabajo con el comercio minorista, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos agrícolas y animales menores, también a la agricultura y ganadería, ella viene trabajando con esta actividad desde hace 20 años, La socia compra ganados de la feria ganadera y los cría, también vende lo que sus terrenos producen, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una vaquita pequeña.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the "Virgen Inmaculada Concepción" (Virgin of the Immaculate Conception) Village Bank. She lives in the District and Province of Anta, Department of Cusco. She's forty-nine, separated, and has one dependent child. She divides her time between her housework and her retail business. She earns her living buying and selling agricultural products and young animals in addition to farming and raising cattle. She's been doing this for more than twenty years. She buys cows at the cattle fair and raises them. She also sells the produce she grows. She is seeking a loan to buy a young cow. Juana appreciates and values the support she gets from the bank, and she promises to pay her loan back in full and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Juana is seeking a loan to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Kutimuy Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “Kutimuy” se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas D. L. unidad D. micro finanzas D. L. Asociación Arariwa D. L. ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el ciclo 13  y está conformado por 20 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 
 
Las actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios a lo que se dedican son a las ventas D. chocolates, comestibles, materiales D. construcción, confección D. manualidades y otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo, guía D. turismo,  agencia D. transportes, empleado administrativo y enfermera. 

Carmen, tiene 52 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos y su principal actividad económica es vender su tienda D. abarrotes. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo, elL. requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cerveza y gaseosas. Olga forma parte D. L. junta directiva del banco comunal desD. el año 1992  y es una D. las fundadoras del banco comunal. Su sueño D. L. socia es tener una ferretería.
 
Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora D. L. región sur del país.
texts.en:
The members of “Kutimuy” communal bank meet every thirty days in Asociación Arariwa’s Micro Finances Unit’s offices in the city of Cusco. The communal bank is currently in its 13th cycle and it’s composed of 20 hard-working and enterprising members who constantly seek ways to succeed and to proviD. a better future for their children through their daily efforts. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities. Some sell chocolate, food, building materials and supplies while some make crafts; others proviD. services such as: tourist guides, public transport, administrative employee, nursing. Carmen, 52, is married and has three children; her main commercial activity is grocery sales. She has been in this line of work for 15 years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs funds to increase her stock, especially beer and soft-drinks. Olga has been a member of the governing board of the communal bank since 1992; she’s one of the founding members. Her dream is to own a hardware store. All the members value and appreciate the loan granted through this means and pledge to repay in a timely fashion. Cusco is a city that is known for its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery and its history; it’s an enchanting city in the south of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Jaylen

texts.en:
Jaylen A. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 32 years old. Jaylen is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jaylen owns & operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Jaylen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jaylen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Jaylen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jaylen is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Jaylen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Lulu L. became a member of ASHI in 2001. Her dream of having her own business came true when she received loans after joining ASHI.

At first, Lulu had a small “sari-sari” store. Sari-sari means a store attached to a house where various kinds of foodstuff, beverages and other basic commodities are sold. A lot of people from the village are customers of this kind of store because this is the most convenient way they can access things they need every day without spending on transportation costs. Lulu and her family enjoyed the small proceeds her business brought them. 

Eventually, through her successive loans from ASHI, Lulu was able to purchase a “pedicab” (a bicycle with sidecar) for a transportation business managed by her husband. Lulu and her husband have four children to support and so they both have to work hard and earn through their own business. Lulu’s youngest child is two years old and the eldest is 26. Her oldest and her second oldest child, who is 24, are both working as computer programmers for small private shops in town. Both are not earning well, and so Lulu still supports some of their needs as well as the needs of her three other children. 

Because Lulu’s husband’s pedicab is operated using a bicycle, he earns only a small income by the end of each day of hard work. Lulu is requesting a loan through ASHI to purchase a motorcycle to replace her husband’s bicycle. With this, his income will grow and he will be able to support the improvement of their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Munkhgerel

texts.en: Munkhgerel is 40 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a rental apartment. Her daughter, Odmaa is 18 years old and attends a university. Her husband works for a tour company. During the day, Munkhgerel sells tights at a local department called Bileg and Khuree Goyol. She operates a retail business, purchases a variety of Italian products from Russia and resells them for a profit. She started her business in 2005 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~365 USD). After years of successful operations, she has managed to increase her working capital to a level exceeding 3,000,000 tugrugs (~2,188 USD) today. Munkhgerel has good communication skills and her business is very important to her. She says, “I would like to open a new sales point in the countryside.” She is requesting a loan to purchase a large number of tights to sell to her many customers.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị (20203050014) is a 27-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, N. operates a family member's business raising cattle for sale. N. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  N. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. The loan will be the second loan taken out by N. from SEDA.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


N. Nguyễn Thị (20203050014) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, N. Tham gia công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  N. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  N. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
A hardworking entrepreneur, Ester C. has run a fish cage and fish-trading business for almost 10 years from Talim Island in the province of Rizal, earning her a reasonable monthly profit. Ester’s main challenge has been having a small stock due to the hindrances of small working capital to put into her fishing trade. As an active businesswoman, Ester has also been engaged in a sewing business for added income.

She joined ASHI, a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 1999 and is very grateful for secured access to capital and other services such as savings and insurance. This loan, amounting to 35,000 PHP, is to help Ester buy fishing nets, bamboo, rope and fingerlings to increase her stock to match her customers' demands in the local community. She thinks that commercializing her fishing business and expanding it will enable her to earn more revenue and be able to pay school fees for her children and cater to other family needs. With access to additional working capital through ASHI and Kiva, Ester is hopeful her dreams of sending her children to a university to complete their college degrees will be achieved. Ester's wishes to give her children a brighter future fuel her commitment to her business.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets, bamboo, rope and fingerlings.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma D. J.' main source of income comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She is 46 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Brgy.Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. Alma has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Alma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Alma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily V. is a 42-year-old mother of four children. She is a native of the Talim Island in the town of Binangonan, which is located in the Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is happily living with her children and her 44-year-old husband Mario who is a fish vendor.

Emily dreams of escaping the spiral of poverty. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines in 2006 with hope of having access to capital to start a business. She and her husband used to be partners in their retail business but as they grew older it become increasingly tiring and laborious. So four years ago when Emily received her first loan from ASHI, she constructed a fish cage in the lake. Since then her business has continued to grow and provide additional income for her family. Emily now requests her sixth loan for 30,000 pesos to use as additional capital for her fish cage business. The loan will be used to pay for more fingerlings.

Emily is looking forward to increased demand for fish on the island so her business will grow and generate enough income for her family. She dreams of sending her four children to school until they finish college.

loans.use: To buy fingerlings

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela F. owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in her local community. She is 59 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Brgy. Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. Adela has been in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Adela joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Adela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase products to sell. Adela is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines.
