It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en: Over the years, Maximina R. has provided for her family with her sewing business and her sari-sari (variety) store for more than five years. The profit from these businesses has been the main source of the family's income. Now that Maximina has access to working capital, her profits are better than before. Maximina is now requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva for the much larger amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase a new sewing machine and support the inventories of her store. This will allow her to grow their businesses further so that their children can fulfill their dreams of completing college degrees and finding good jobs. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her activities will generate a steady income to improve her financial stability and give a better life to her family in a decent manner. Maximina’s biggest dream is to have a successful tailoring business and to manage a full-fledged mini-grocery store someday. She believes this opportunity will give her the confidence to succeed while helping her family rise out of poverty. The financial opportunity of her two businesses is one of the best ways to help provide for her family and she very much wants to lift her family from under the umbrella of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and inventory for her store.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia A. is a new member of ASHI. She is requesting a loan to start her own small business, a “sari-sari” store. Sari-sari means various kinds of foodstuff, beverages and other basic commodities sold in her house.  Through the proceeds of this business, Alicia is hopeful that her husband’s small income as a hired carpenter will be augmented and she will have a financial source to support the needs of her seven children, especially their need for education. 

Despite poverty, Alicia still hopes that her business will grow and its proceeds will be able to be substantial to support the improvement of their lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and other goods for her store.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Despite the burden she is carrying on her shoulders being a single mother, 55-year-old Dominga D. C. remains strong and optimistic about reaching her dream for her two children. Being a mother, she cannot seem to ignore the feeling of guilt when she sees her children suffer from a shortage of food and other basic needs. When Dominga joined KIVA partner ASHI in 2006, the loan she requested was used to support her sewing business. She offers tailoring services particularly in the neighboring village. The profit from this business provides their cash flow and provides them with their basic needs. The income, however, is just too small to improve their standard of living. Thus, Dominga is now requesting a much larger loan to engage in a buy & sell business and to continue expanding her sewing business. With inventory for both businesses, she will gain more customers from around the village. Dominga is hoping that her envisioned businesses will help her to support the financial needs of her two children so that they are able to graduate from college. By then, she thinks their lives will be changed and she will have her dreams fulfilled.

loans.use: To expand her sewing business and start a buy & sell business.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong T. T. N. was born in 1976. She lives in Luong Quy village, Xuan Non commune, Dong Anh district. She is married with three children. Her husband is a driver for a company near the house and has a monthly income. Mrs Huong has a store (she sells cakes, sweets, beer, etc). Besides the store, she is a tailor who makes clothes. Her family has a monthly income of about 7,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND).  She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. For this loan, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to expand her store and buy cloth to make clothes.

loans.use: To expand her store and buy cloth to make clothes.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Despite being old, 76-year-old Inocencia D. and her 77-year-old husband are still working hard in a business to survive poverty. Through a loan from ASHI, Inocencia has been able to put up a small eatery. She and her husband are responsible for managing the business. The proceeds are used to support their daily needs, weekly payments to ASHI and their monthly bills. 

Inocencia really wants to grow her business by requesting additional capital through a loan. She wanted to increase the profit of her business to have extra money to support her grandchildren from her three children. Her children are hired laborers and earn a small amount of money. Inocencia also wants to support a small farming business for her eldest 27-year-old child who is presently unemployed. 

Despite being poor, Inocencia and her husband still hope that through the proceeds of the business they are growing, the lifestyle of her children at least will be improved.

loans.use: To purchase cooking ingredients and farm inputs

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
Q. Trương Thị (20203050016) is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - B. Ninh.  Q. is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cach Nhóm 05 (4).


Q. is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Q. owns & operates a business making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  Q. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Q. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Q. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Q. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Đoàn Thị B. (0) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


2.  Trương Thị Q. (0) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) is a 55-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


5.  Đoàn Thị T. (0) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Q. Trương Thị (20203050016) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - B. Ninh.  Q. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô cach nhóm 05 (4).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Q. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Q. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Q. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp C. thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Q. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Đoàn Thị B. (0) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  Trương Thị Q. (0) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


4.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


5.  Đoàn Thị T. (0) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía B. Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm C. phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mr. Savy S. (who is not in the photo, his wife is available instead), age 40 and his wife, Mrs. Sarom Tin, age 38, live in a small village along National Road Number 5 about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1987 and have five children: one daughter who works in a garment factory, and four sons. One son is a construction worker and the other three attend school. 

Savy has been a construction worker for two years. His wife has been selling lotus for five years. In addition, he hopes to create a new business driving a motor taxi. He will be able to earn extra income to support his family. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive as a motor taxi.

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
T. Trương Thị (20203050001) is a 53-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, T. operates a family member's business raising cattle for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by T. from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Trương Thị (20203050001) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, T. Tham gia công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải T./ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn G. is from the village of Brgy. Poblacion, Diadi, Neuva Vizcaya. She is 52 years old. Evelyn is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Tob

texts.en: Mrs. Tob K. is a villager in Angk Ta Phouk village in Takeo province. She was born in 1970. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Besides the farm business, she is a chicken breeder too. Her obstacle is that she does not have something to transport while she does farming. So to improve the conditions for her family, Mrs. Tob K. is seeding a loan to buy a motorbike to use. She is single and lives with seven members in her household. Two of her assistants are seamstresses in the garment factory, while the others have different positions.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mr. Thy C. (pictured here), 28 and his wife, Mrs. Soknea Ou, 29, have been married since 2005 and have two children: one son and one daughter. They live in a small village off National Road Number Two about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Thy has been driving a Tuk Tuk taxi for five years.  His wife stays at home and does housework. In the past, she used to sell Soya-bean juice.

Thy is asking for his first loan of 500 USD to build a fence around his house and to build a kitchen for his family to use.

loans.use: To build a fence around his house and to build a kitchen for use by his family.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en: A committed member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2006, Eufemia R. is thankful to be able to obtain capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Eufemia has achieved solid records with regular attendance at group & center meetings and steady repayments on her previous loan. To supply additional income for her family, Eufemia requests a new loan of 18,000 PHP to expand the family’s fish cages & fish selling business.  With the loan, she will purchase raw materials including fishnets and an additional supply of fish for sale.  With additional equipment, she believes their fish inventory will increase, thus generating higher income and profits from the business. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Eufemia is positive that the family business will continue to flourish, deliver stable profits, and support improvements in her family’s quality of life out of poverty. Eufemia also dreams that her children go to school until college and that they find stable jobs. One of her aspirations is to be able to build her own house that is durable and spacious.

loans.use: To purchase fish nets and an additional supply of fish to sell

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeun U., who lives in Ta Preah village in Takeo province, was born in 1966. She owns a general store in the local village and she is a pig breeder also. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. So to improve breeding pigs, Mrs. Thoeun U. is asking for a loan to buy some piglets and pig food for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Bauch Kun, is a farmer who owns two hectares of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family and he is a white wine maker also. Through this activity, this couple supports three children. Two of the children are enrolled in the local public school, and the youngest one is five years old.

loans.use: To buy some piglets and pig food

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mr.Thy M., 49, and his wife Mrs. Narath Horn, 32, have been married since 2000 and have two children: one son and one daughter. One of them attends school and the other one is still young. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Thy is not in the photo; but his wife is pictured instead. 

Thy has been a wooden house builder for five years and owner of a grocery store for a year. He is asking for his first loan in the amount of $600 to purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mr. Saret V., 32 year old and his wife, Mrs. Chanthol Um (pictured together), 28, live along National Road Number One about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2004 and have two children: one and one daughter. Both of them are still young.  

Saret has been operating a business selling cows for two years. He buys cow from other provinces far from his house and sells at his house. Mrs. Chanthol has been a farmer for six years. 

Saret is asking for a loan of 1,000USD. He will use the loan to purchase cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị (20203050004) is a 52-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. V. is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách nhóm 01 (1).


V. is married and has three adult children.  To making a living, V. owns & operates a business providing waste disposal services to local community members.  V. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, V. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,944,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by V. from SEDA.  V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050005) is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050002) is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 7,840,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  Trương Thị V. (20203050003) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


4.  Nguyễn Thị

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: 41-year-old Jocelyn V. is a mother focused on her family’s dream. She lives in the coastal place of Talim Island, Binangonan, Rizal, Philippines with her loving husband, Wilfredo (a fisherman) and five children. The couple works hard to give a better education to their children for the future and they want a better life as well. They decided to join ASHI in 2006 to get capital for their business, which is a fishing and fish trading business. They have requested a new loan of Php 17,000.00. They will invest this capital to maintain raw materials needed in the fishing business and to purchase additional inventories of fish for sale. They hope to build their own beautiful house, expanding their fishing business and have wider space for their fishing equipment. The family feels very happy with the loan that will improve their lives. She is continuing to pray and wish all lenders all the best and good luck, and that they will continue to support poor families like hers who want to improve their standards of living.

loans.use: To support the maintenance of raw materials needed in the fishing business and to purchase additional inventories of fish for sale.

loans.name: Neat

texts.en: Mrs. Neat H., who was born in 1977, lives in Lieb village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her field is ready to be planted, but she does not have enough money to support it. So to improve her rice production, Mrs. Neat H. is requesting a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline. Her husband, Mr. Sorm Sam, owns a plow machine and he is a fisherman also. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school and the other is too young to go to school or work. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom N. (pictured above) and her husband, Mr. Savat Miech, live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh and have been married for 27 years. The couple has three sons; one is a tailor, another son attends University, and another one stays at home.

Mom has been operating a grocery store for more than two years. She buys products from Koki market and re-sells them from her house, with her husband's assistance.

Mom’s son finished his baccalaureate and continues his study at University in Phnom Penh. She hopes to support her son's further education so he will find a good job when he finishes his studying. Mom is therefore requesting her second loan of $700 to pay school fees for her son as well as purchasing additional stock (grocery items) for her business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son and purchase stock for grocery business

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mrs. Neang H. (pictured above), age 56 and her husband, Mr. Soeun Kong, age 63, have been married for eight years and have one daughter. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Neang has been operating a grocery store since 1980. She buys grocery items from Phnom Penh market for resale and operates her store in front of her house. Her husband assists his wife in the business.  

Neang is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase grocery items for resale in her business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Dương's Group

texts.en:
Hà Dương T. (20201010007) is a 31 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hà is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ngân Cầu nhóm 02 (2).

Hà is single and does not have any children. To making a living, Hà owns and operates a food service business. Hà has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3.800.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA. She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20201010011) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her food stall business.

2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20201010006) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her food stall business.

3.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20201010005) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

4.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201010013) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business providing recycling services.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hà Dương T. (20201010007) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các tH.nh viên.  Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ngân Cầu nhóm 02 (2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ thực phẩm cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 3.800.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hà đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hà đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20201010011) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20201010006) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20201010005) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


4.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201010013) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophat S. (shown in the photo) and her husband Mr. Morn Meu, have been married since 1984 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, one daughter is a garment factory worker, one son has full-time employment and another one attends school. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophat is a silk weaver. Her husband has been a boat repairer in the village for more than two years. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $350 to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Kasi

texts.en:
Mrs. Kasi B. (pictured above), age 33, and her husband, Mr. Sot Sok, age 32, have been married since 1998 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. The family is living on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Kasi is a tailor while her husband is a motor taxi driver. She is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase wood material to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To purchase wood material to renovate her house.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha K. lives in Rung village in Takeo province. She was born in 1970. She is a farmer who owns a four-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil and it is a long way from an irrigation system. So to improve her rice production, Mrs. Sokha K. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and rice seed and to hire farm laborers to plow her rice field. Her husband, Mr. Orng Mork, is a construction worker. She supports three children. One of her children is a seamstress in the garment factory and the others are attending the local public school. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and rice seed

loans.name: Đào's Group

texts.en:
V. A. Đào Thị (20201010003) is a 37 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  V. A. is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ngân Cầu nhóm 01 (1).


V. A. is married and has three school-aged children.  To making a living, V. A. is employed in a business that provides general services to local community members.  V. A. has been engaged in this business for over twelve years and earns approximately $280 a month from these activities.


In 2009, V. A. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  V. A. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  This will be her 2nd loan from SEDA.  V. A. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị V. (20201010002) is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector providing recycling services.


2.  Trương Thị L. (20201010013) is a 24 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


3.  Trần Thị L. (20201010012) is a 34 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

A. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doA. của cô ấy/ A. ấy.  V. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.

1.  Nguyễn Thị V. (20201010002) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


2.  Trương Thị L. (20201010013) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là kinh doA. cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  Trần Thị L. (20201010012) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là kinh doA. cửa hàng T.t.

Do việc biên dịch thủ công các dA. mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Mrs. Vannak K. (in the photo), 31, and her husband, Mr. Sam-ath Sut, 40, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1996 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of the children are in school. 

Vannak has been a garment factory worker for fifteen years and her husband is a policeman. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Sivorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sivorn E. (pictured here), age 58, is a widow with two children. One of her sons is a construction worker. She lives with her sister and elderly mother in a small village off of National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. 

Sivorn has been operating a business cutting grass to sell for cow feed since she was young. Also she is a rice and vegetable farmer. She hopes to continue increasing her productivity, so she is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice and vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: In Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province, there is a person named Mrs. Mom K.. She was born in 1962. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sophean K., owns a plow machine. Now her problem is that her husband’s wheel plow machine is broken. So to improve her husband’s business, Mrs. Mom K. is requesting a loan to buy a pair of wheel plow machines. With the rest of the loan, she wants to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide. She is a mother of a child who is studying in the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a pair of wheel plow machines

loans.name: Hemalatha

texts.en:
Hemalatha is a 56-year-old married woman living with her husband in the town of Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka. They have two children, ages 29 and 26, both married.

Hemalatha's first job was food processing but it was not as profitable for the family as they needed it to be. Now, she has a business making and selling dresses and her husband and children provide support for her business. The family benefits from the hard work they put into the sewing business in the form of increased income.

Hemalatha does her job on-time and is a very honest lady. She is seeking a 30,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy cloth and other raw materials for the sewing business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more cloth and other raw materials

loans.name: Leangse

texts.en:
Leangse N. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sarith Rim, have been married since 1990 and have three children; one son and two daughters. All of the children are in school. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

One month ago, Leangse started a business selling food in front of the garment factory. Her husband has been driving a motor taxi since 1989. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
M. Trương Thị (20201010001) is a 27-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two children.  To make a living, M. sells bicycles in the local community.  M. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $255 a month from this activity.


In 2009, M. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  M. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be her 2nd loan from SEDA.  M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


M. Trương Thị (20201010001) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, M. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán xe đạp trong cộng đồng địa phương.  M. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, M. kiếm được khoảng 4.700.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, M. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  M. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  M. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Mrs. Lorn S. lives in Roneam Tnaot village in Takeo province and she is 44 years old. She is a chicken seller in the local market. She earns some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Phorn Phork, is a rice middleman. Since her husband’s business is going well she wants to expand it. So to improve his business selling rice, Mrs. Lorn S. is seeking a loan to buy more rice to resell. She is a mother of five children. One of the children is helping her husband’s business and the others are enrolled in the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell

loans.name: Sreyla

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyla K., age 30, and husband, Mr. Ranu Nin, age 31, (pictured here together), have been married since 2001 and have two daughters. One of them attends school and the other one is still young. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. 

Sreyla has been a garment factory worker since 1997, and her husband has been a mechanic since 1996. She is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to get to work.

loans.name: Melka

texts.en:
Melka is a 34-year-old married woman living with her husband, son, and daughter in Akurassa in the Galle district of Sri Lanka.

Melka manages a retail grocery shop which stocks general goods such as food, spices, rice and so on. Villagers come to purchase these goods as part of their daily routines. She has been doing this business for ten years now and she is known to be a very hard worker.

Melka has asked for a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy more grocery items. She is hoping to provide good education for her children and hopes to expand her retail shop quickly.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Non

texts.en:
Mrs. Non S. is 35 years old and lives in Ta Preah village in the Takeo province. She is a dessert and food seller in her local village and her husband Mr. Rat San is a chicken breeder and a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land for cultivating rice to sell to support his family. 

Since her husband’s chicken breeding is going well, she wants to start breeding other animals. To fulfill this purpose, Mrs. Non S. is asking for a loan to buy two oxen to breed and to plow the rice field.

She is a mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in a local public school, while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to breed and plow the rice field

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthy S. is 36 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Sreychim Hem, is 34 years old. They have been married since 1999 and have one daughter, who attends school. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanthy has been a fisherman for ten years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for two years. He wants to start a pig-raising business in order to earn extra income.  He is asking for his first loan of $500 to purchase piglets to raise and to build a kitchen for his family's use.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and to build a kitchen for his family.

loans.name: Sinon

texts.en: In Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province exists a person who is Mrs. Sinon S. and she was born in 1975. She is a farmer who owns a two point five-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. So, to improve the production rice, Mrs. Sinon S. is a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and hire farm laborers to plow the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Ma Svey, is a fisherman, and she has four children, one of whom works taking care of ducks, while the others are attending the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and hire farmer laborers to plow the rice field.

loans.name: Khna

texts.en: Mrs. Khna M. was born in 1966 and she lives in Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a one point five-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Now she has a few problems because her field is infertile, it is a long way from an irrigation system, and it has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mrs. Khna M. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, pesticide, and to hire farm laborers to plow the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Roeurn Loeng, is a construction laborer and also a fisherman. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer, while the other is attending the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide.

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
Hà Trương Thị (20203050013) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Y. Phong - B. Ninh.  Hà is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách nhóm 03 (3).


Hà is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Hà owns and operates a furniture-making business, making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  Hà has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $267 a month from these activities.


In 2009, Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.000.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7.840.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  This will be her 2nd loan from SEDA.  Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050011) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Y. (20203050015) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050024) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.


4.  Nguyễn V. H. (20203050012) is a 29-year-old male who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support his business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.


5.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050096) is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


6.  Trương Thị B. (20203050097) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hà  Trương Thị (20203050013) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Y. Phong - B. Ninh.  Hà  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các tH.nh viên.  Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách nhóm 03 (3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán T. thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hà  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hà  kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hà  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hà  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.000.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguY. liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050011) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Y. (20203050015) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050024) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.


4.  Nguyễn V. H. (20203050012) là 29 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.


5.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050096) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


6.  Trương Thị B. (20203050097) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía B. Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Nirosha

texts.en:
Nirosha L. is a 33-year-old married woman living with her husband and daughter in Akurassa, Sri Lanka.

Nirosha and her husband work together producing colorful floor rugs, a business that they have been running for one year now. They are both very hard-working and have seen success because there is a strong market for their products. Their business is situated near to Akurassa town, so they have a good market for their rugs.

Nirosha is seeking a 25,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to develop her business further. With the loan, she plans to buy cloth and other materials necessary for producing these rugs.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for making rugs

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is a 36-year-old woman from the city of Lahore (famous for its Punjabi foods and historical places). For the past 15 years, she has lived in a 2-room house.

She has completed her education to 10th standard, but could not study further due to the limited financial resources of her family.

She got married at the age of 18. After marriage she started sewing clothes to financially support her husband. He works in Saudi Arabia, so he lives far away from his family. Now she makes embroidered dresses as well, and earns a good income. She utilizes her income for the education of her children and also saves the additional profit.

She works not only to generate income for her family, but also because she loves her work. Her work gives her satisfaction because it enables her to meet the desires of her children and it encourages her husband. 

Sajida is also a very sensible mother. She has four children: one son and three daughters. All of her children are studying because she wants them to have a good future.

She has a brother who lives with her and is involved in making handbags. Sajida wants to help him because he is a very hard worker. She is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) to invest in her brother's business so that he may purchase required items for the handbags (leather, cloth, zippers). Helping him increase his income makes Sajida proud.

loans.use: To purchase items to make handbags

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites J. is from the village of Brgy. Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Marites is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish in the market. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marites is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan T. N. was born in 1951. She is a farmer, raising pigs and cows. She has a son who is working for a lock company near the house and he earns a salary. Her husband is retired. They have a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND.

Lan T. N. has participated in SEDA since 2006 and has repaid punctually. For this loan, she wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy a cow and feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy a cow and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Renuka

texts.en:
Renuka  is a 32-year-old married woman living with her husband and two daughters. She has one 6-year-old and one 2-year-old. Her husband assists with her business and they are very close and work well together.

Renuka has a sewing shop where she sews dresses for local customers and villagers. Five years ago, she started this business.

Renuka has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy raw materials for her sewing shop to help her business. She is grateful for BRAC Sri Lanka because of the support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Shahnaz Bano's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz Bano lives in the city of Lahore (famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods) in Pakistan. She is 53 years old, Muslim and has studied till matriculation. She is a widow; without her husband, it has been very difficult for her to live but she has never given up and keeps involving herself in a small business selling garments.

She has an obedient 16-year-old daughter who is the only source of her motivation. She focuses on giving her a good career and for this reason, she works hard to generate income. 

She not only sells garments but also provides the facility of sewing to her clients. From these two businesses, she earns approximately Pak Rs. 10,000 which allows her to manage the education expenses of her daughter and to run the financial circle.

She is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) to purchase an electric sewing machine which will help her to sew more clothes because the manual machine takes her double the time and makes her tired quickly.

She has a dream to give her daughter the chance to gain higher education and to see her become a teacher of a renowned college.

loans.use: Purchase an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina R. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 58 years old. Rosalina is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $100 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rosalina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is 54 years old and lives in a city named Lahore (famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods) in Pakistan. 

She is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t afford her education expenses due to having a big family to serve.  After her marriage, she left her home town and started living with her husband, but life was not easy.  Her husband is a hawker of vegetables.  As she is a very sensitive woman, she wanted to do work on fixed income, but she couldn’t do that due to her illiteracy; therefore, she has decided to polish her embroidery skills and for the last three years, she has been preparing embroidered dresses and supporting her husband in generating income. 

She is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) to purchase seasonal vegetables so her husband may increase his business and generate a good income.

She has a dream of opening a vegetable shop for her husband in the main market of Lahore so he does not have to go to different areas to sell vegetables, especially in the summer season.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
U. Trương Thị (20203050009) is a 23-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  U. is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách nhóm 02 (2).


U. is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, U. owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector, operating a furniture making business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  U. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, U. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  U. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.944.000 VND which will also be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  U. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About the other borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trương Thị H. (20203050006) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.


2.  Trương Thị XU. (20203050008) is a 21-year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector, operating a furniture making business.


3.  Trương Thị KhU. (20203050010) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector, operating a furniture making business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050007) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Priyanka  Ranjani

texts.en:
Priyanka is a 42-year-old married woman living with her husband and two daughters (ages 15 and 7), in Hikkaduwa, a town in the Galle area of southern Sri Lanka. 

Priyanka manages a food processing business. Priyanka makes 'string hoppers', a food made from rice flour dough and a mainstay of the Sri Lankan diet.  Her husband also provides help to her business.  She prepares breakfast for many of the nearby villagers.  

Priyanka has asked for a loan of 25,000 rupees (LKR) from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy pots and a gas cooker to improve her 'string hoppers' business.  She wants to provide nutritious options for her family through the increased income that she hopes to earn.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy pots and gas cooker for making 'string hoppers'

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en: Ngan T. N. was born in 1977. She has two sons. She raises pigs and makes clothes. Her husband is a driver. She and her husband live with her mother-in-law in Luong Quy village. They have a monthly income of about 8,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She wants to save a lot of money to care for her sons and to have a better life. She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and has repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,066,000 VND to buy cloth and food for the pigs.

loans.use: To buy cloth and food for the pigs.

loans.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en:
Imelda M. is from the town of Sinamar Norte, San Mateo, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Imelda is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Imelda M. group.

Imelda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $45 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

Charlita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase more products. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elsa is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $160 a month for these activities.
